classes.name: LuaAISettings
classes.description: Collection of settings for overriding default ai behavior.

attributes.name: allow_destroy_when_commands_fail
attributes.description: If enabled, units that repeatedly fail to succeed at commands will be destroyed.

attributes.name: allow_try_return_to_spawner
attributes.description: If enabled, units that have nothing else to do will attempt to return to a spawner.

attributes.name: do_separation
attributes.description: If enabled, units will try to separate themselves from nearby friendly units.

attributes.name: join_attacks
attributes.description: If enabled, the unit will join attack groups.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: path_resolution_modifier
attributes.description: Defines how coarse the pathfinder's grid is, where smaller values mean a coarser grid. Defaults to `0`, which equals a resolution of `1x1` tiles, centered on tile centers. Values range from `-8` to `8` inclusive, where each integer increment doubles/halves the resolution. So, a resolution of `-8` equals a grid of `256x256` tiles, and a resolution of `8` equals `1/256` of a tile.

attributes.name: size_in_group
attributes.description:
The number of "slots" that the unit takes up in a unit group. Must be greater than 0.

If this value is changed after the unit has been added to a group, the exact behavior is undefined.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

classes.name: LuaBootstrap
classes.description: Entry point for registering event handlers. It is accessible through the global object named `script`.

methods.name: generate_event_name
methods.description: Generate a new, unique event ID that can be used to raise custom events with [LuaBootstrap::raise_event](runtime:LuaBootstrap::raise_event).

return_values.description: The newly generated event ID. This will be a new value that does not correspond to any named entry in defines.events.

methods.name: get_event_filter
methods.description: Gets the filters for the given event.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: ID of the event to get.

return_values.description: The filters or `nil` if none are defined.

methods.name: get_event_handler
methods.description: Find the event handler for an event.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event identifier to get a handler for.

return_values.description: Reference to the function currently registered as the handler, if it was found.

methods.name: get_event_id
methods.description: Converts LuaEventType into related value of defines.events. Value will be provided also if event was not given a constant inside of defines.events.

methods.name: get_event_order
methods.description: Gets the mod event order as a string.

methods.name: on_configuration_changed
methods.description:
Register a function to be run when mod configuration changes.

This is called when the game version or any mod version changed, when any mod was added or removed, when a startup setting has changed, when any prototypes have been added or removed, or when a migration was applied. It allows the mod to make any changes it deems appropriate to both the data structures in its [storage](runtime:storage) table or to the game state through [LuaGameScript](runtime:LuaGameScript).

For more context, refer to the [Data Lifecycle](runtime:data-lifecycle) page.

parameters.name: handler
parameters.description: The handler for this event. Passing `nil` will unregister it.

methods.name: on_event
methods.description: Register a handler to run on the specified event(s). Each mod can only register once for every event, as any additional registration will overwrite the previous one. This holds true even if different filters are used for subsequent registrations.
examples:
```
-- Register for the on_tick event to print the current tick to console each tick
script.on_event(defines.events.on_tick,
function(event) game.print(event.tick) end)
```

```
-- Register for the on_built_entity event, limiting it to only be received when a `"fast-inserter"` is built
script.on_event(defines.events.on_built_entity,
function(event) game.print("Gotta go fast!") end,
{{filter = "name", name = "fast-inserter"}})
```

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event(s) or custom-input to invoke the handler on.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: The filters for this event. Can only be used when registering for individual events.

parameters.name: handler
parameters.description: The handler for this event. Passing `nil` will unregister it.

methods.name: on_init
methods.description:
Register a function to be run on mod initialization.

This is only called when a new save game is created or when a save file is loaded that previously didn't contain the mod. During it, the mod gets the chance to set up initial values that it will use for its lifetime. It has full access to [LuaGameScript](runtime:LuaGameScript) and the [storage](runtime:storage) table and can change anything about them that it deems appropriate. No other events will be raised for the mod until it has finished this step.

For more context, refer to the [Data Lifecycle](runtime:data-lifecycle) page.

parameters.name: handler
parameters.description: The handler for this event. Passing `nil` will unregister it.

methods.name: on_load
methods.description:
Register a function to be run on save load. This is only called for mods that have been part of the save previously, or for players connecting to a running multiplayer session.

It gives the mod the opportunity to rectify potential differences in local state introduced by the save/load cycle. Doing anything other than the following three will lead to desyncs, breaking multiplayer and replay functionality. Access to [LuaGameScript](runtime:LuaGameScript) is not available. The [storage](runtime:storage) table can be accessed and is safe to read from, but not write to, as doing so will lead to an error.

The only legitimate uses of this event are these:

- Re-setup [metatables](https://www.lua.org/pil/13.html) as they are not persisted through the save/load cycle.

- Re-setup conditional event handlers, meaning subscribing to an event only when some condition is met to save processing time.

- Create local references to data stored in the [storage](runtime:storage) table.

For all other purposes, [LuaBootstrap::on_init](runtime:LuaBootstrap::on_init), [LuaBootstrap::on_configuration_changed](runtime:LuaBootstrap::on_configuration_changed) or [migrations](runtime:migrations) should be used instead.

For more context, refer to the [Data Lifecycle](runtime:data-lifecycle) page.

parameters.name: handler
parameters.description: The handler for this event. Passing `nil` will unregister it.

methods.name: on_nth_tick
methods.description: Register a handler to run every nth-tick(s). When the game is on tick 0 it will trigger all registered handlers.

parameters.name: handler
parameters.description: The handler to run. Passing `nil` will unregister it for the provided nth-tick(s).

parameters.name: tick
parameters.description: The nth-tick(s) to invoke the handler on. Passing `nil` as the only parameter will unregister all nth-tick handlers.

parameters.name: message

methods.name: raise_event
methods.description: Raise an event. Only events generated with [LuaBootstrap::generate_event_name](runtime:LuaBootstrap::generate_event_name) and the following can be raised:
lists:
Events that can be raised manually:

- [on_console_chat](runtime:on_console_chat)
- [on_player_crafted_item](runtime:on_player_crafted_item)
- [on_player_fast_transferred](runtime:on_player_fast_transferred)
- [on_biter_base_built](runtime:on_biter_base_built)
- [on_market_item_purchased](runtime:on_market_item_purchased)
- [script_raised_built](runtime:script_raised_built)
- [script_raised_destroy](runtime:script_raised_destroy)
- [script_raised_revive](runtime:script_raised_revive)
- [script_raised_teleported](runtime:script_raised_teleported)
- [script_raised_set_tiles](runtime:script_raised_set_tiles)
examples:
```
-- Raise the on_console_chat event with the desired message 'from' the first player
local data = {player_index = 1, message = "Hello friends!"}
script.raise_event(defines.events.on_console_chat, data)
```

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Table with extra data that will be passed to the event handler. Any invalid LuaObjects will silently stop the event from being raised.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: ID or name of the event to raise.

methods.name: register_metatable
methods.description:
Register a metatable to have linkage recorded and restored when saving/loading.

The metatable itself will not be saved. Instead, only the linkage to a registered metatable is saved, and the metatable registered under that name will be used when loading the table.

`register_metatable()` can not be used in the console, in event listeners or during a `remote.call()`.

The metatable first needs to be defined in the mod's root scope, then registered using this method. From then on, it will be properly restored for tables in [storage](runtime:storage).

```
local metatable =
{
  __index = function(key)
    return "no value for key " .. key
  end
}
script.register_metatable("my_metatable", metatable)
```

This previously defined `metatable` can then be set on any table as usual:

```
local table = {key="value"}
setmetatable(table, metatable)
```

parameters.name: metatable
parameters.description: The metatable to register.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of this metatable. Names must be unique per mod.

methods.name: register_on_object_destroyed
methods.description:
Registers an object so that after it's destroyed, [on_object_destroyed](runtime:on_object_destroyed) is called.

Once an object is registered, it stays registered until it is actually destroyed, even through save/load cycles. The registration is global across all mods, meaning once one mod registers an object, all mods listening to [on_object_destroyed](runtime:on_object_destroyed) will receive the event when it is destroyed. Registering the same object multiple times will still only fire the destruction event once, and will return the same registration number.

Depending on when a given object is destroyed, [on_object_destroyed](runtime:on_object_destroyed) will either be fired at the end of the current tick or at the end of the next tick.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: The object to register.

return_values.description: The registration number. It is used to identify the object in the [on_object_destroyed](runtime:on_object_destroyed) event.

The [useful identifier](runtime:RegistrationTarget) of the object if it has one. This identifier is specific to the object type, for example for trains it is the value [LuaTrain::id](runtime:LuaTrain::id).
Type of the target object.

methods.name: set_event_filter
methods.description:
Sets the filters for the given event. The filters are only retained when set after the actual event registration, because registering for an event with different or no filters will overwrite previously set ones.

Limit the [on_marked_for_deconstruction](runtime:on_marked_for_deconstruction) event to only be received when a non-ghost entity is marked for deconstruction.

```
script.set_event_filter(defines.events.on_marked_for_deconstruction, {{filter = "ghost", invert = true}})
```

Limit the [on_built_entity](runtime:on_built_entity) event to only be received when either a `unit` or a `unit-spawner` is built.

```
script.set_event_filter(defines.events.on_built_entity, {{filter = "type", type = "unit"}, {filter = "type", type = "unit-spawner"}})
```

Limit the [on_entity_damaged](runtime:on_entity_damaged) event to only be received when a `rail` is damaged by an `acid` attack.

```
script.set_event_filter(defines.events.on_entity_damaged, {{filter = "rail"}, {filter = "damage-type", type = "acid", mode = "and"}})
```

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: ID of the event to filter.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: The filters or `nil` to clear them.

attributes.name: active_mods

examples:

```
-- This will print the names and versions of all active mods to the console.

  game.print(name .. " version " .. version)
end
```

classes.name: LuaChunkIterator
classes.description:
A chunk iterator can be used for iterating chunks coordinates of a surface.

The returned type is a [ChunkPositionAndArea](runtime:ChunkPositionAndArea) containing the chunk coordinates and its area.
examples:
```
for chunk in some_surface.get_chunks() do
  game.player.print("x: " .. chunk.x .. ", y: " .. chunk.y)
  game.player.print("area: " .. serpent.line(chunk.area))
end
```

classes.name: LuaCommandProcessor
classes.description: Allows for the registration of custom console commands through the global object named `commands`. Similarly to [event subscriptions](runtime:LuaBootstrap::on_event), these don't persist through a save-and-load cycle.

methods.name: add_command
methods.description:
Add a custom console command.

Trying to add a command with the `name` of a game command or the name of a custom command that is already in use will result in an error.

This example command will register a custom event called `print_tick` that prints the current tick to either the player issuing the command or to everyone on the server, depending on the command parameter:

```
commands.add_command("print_tick", nil, function(command)
  if command.player_index ~= nil and command.parameter == "me" then
    game.get_player(command.player_index).print(command.tick)
  else
    game.print(command.tick)
  end
end)
```

This shows the usage of the table that gets passed to any function handling a custom command. This specific example makes use of the `tick` and the optional `player_index` and `parameter` fields. The user is supposed to either call it without any parameter (`"/print_tick"`) or with the `"me"` parameter (`"/print_tick me"`).

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: The function that will be called when this command is invoked.

parameters.name: help
parameters.description: The localised help message. It will be shown to players using the `/help` command.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The desired name of the command (case sensitive).

methods.name: remove_command
methods.description: Remove a custom console command.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the command to remove (case sensitive).

return_values.description: Whether the command was successfully removed. Returns `false` if the command didn't exist.

Adds a member to this UnitGroup. Has the same effect as setting defines.command.group command on the member to join the group.

The member must have the same force be on the same surface as the group.

methods.description: Destroys this commandable. If it is a unit group, members will not be destroyed, they will be merely unlinked from the group.

methods.description: Release the commandable from the spawner. This allows the spawner to continue spawning additional units.

methods.name: set_autonomous
methods.description: Make this group autonomous. Autonomous groups will automatically attack polluted areas. Autonomous groups aren't considered to be [script-driven](runtime:LuaCommandable::is_script_driven).

methods.name: get_inventory

Get an inventory belonging to this entity. This can be either the "main" inventory or some auxiliary one, like the module slots or logistic trash slots.

A given [defines.inventory](runtime:defines.inventory) is only meaningful for the corresponding LuaObject type. EG: get_inventory(defines.inventory.character_main) is only meaningful if 'this' is a player character. You may get a value back but if the type of 'this' isn't the type referred to by the [defines.inventory](runtime:defines.inventory) it's almost guaranteed to not be the inventory asked for.

return_values.description: The inventory or `nil` if none with the given index was found.

methods.variant_parameter_description: Other attributes may be specified depending on `type`:

methods.name: teleport
methods.description:
Teleport the entity to a given position, possibly on another surface.

Some entities may not be teleported. For instance, transport belts won't allow teleportation and this method will always return `false` when used on any such entity.

You can also pass 1 or 2 numbers as the parameters and they will be used as relative teleport coordinates `'teleport(0, 1)'` to move the entity 1 tile positive y. `'teleport(4)'` to move the entity 4 tiles to the positive x.

`script_raised_teleported` will not be raised if teleporting a player with no character.

raises.name: on_player_changed_position
raises.description: Raised if the teleported entity is a player character.

raises.name: script_raised_teleported
raises.description: Raised if the `raise_teleported` flag was set and the entity was successfully teleported.

parameters.name: build_check_type
parameters.description: The build check type done when teleporting to the destination. Defaults to `script`. This is ignored when teleporting between surfaces.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where to teleport to.

parameters.name: raise_teleported
parameters.description: If true, [defines.events.script_raised_teleported](runtime:defines.events.script_raised_teleported) will be fired on successful entity teleportation.

parameters.name: snap_to_grid
parameters.description: If false the exact position given is used to instead of snapping to the normal entity grid. This only applies if the entity normally snaps to the grid.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Surface to teleport to. If not given, will teleport to the entity's current surface. Only players, cars, and spidertrons can be teleported cross-surface.

return_values.description: `true` if the entity was successfully teleported.

classes.name: LuaCustomTable
classes.description:
Lazily evaluated table. For performance reasons, we sometimes return a custom table-like type instead of a native Lua table. This custom type lazily constructs the necessary Lua wrappers of the corresponding C++ objects, therefore preventing their unnecessary construction in some cases.

There are some notable consequences to the usage of a custom table type rather than the native Lua table type: Iterating a custom table is only possible using the `pairs` Lua function; `ipairs` won't work. Another key difference is that custom tables cannot be serialised into a game save file -- if saving the game would require serialisation of a custom table, an error will be displayed and the game will not be saved.

In previous versions of Factorio, this would create a [LuaPlayer](runtime:LuaPlayer) instance for every player in the game, even though only one such wrapper is needed. In the current version, accessing [game.players](runtime:LuaGameScript::players) by itself does not create any [LuaPlayer](runtime:LuaPlayer) instances; they are created lazily when accessed. Therefore, this example only constructs one [LuaPlayer](runtime:LuaPlayer) instance, no matter how many elements there are in `game.players`.

```
game.players["Oxyd"].character.die()
```

This statement will execute successfully and `storage.p` will be useable as one might expect. However, as soon as the user tries to save the game, a "LuaCustomTable cannot be serialized" error will be shown. The game will remain unsaveable so long as `storage.p` refers to an instance of a custom table.

```
storage.p = game.players  -- This has high potential to make the game unsaveable
```

The following will produce no output because `ipairs` is not supported with custom tables.

```
for _, p in ipairs(game.players) do game.player.print(p.name); end  -- incorrect; use pairs instead
```
examples:
```
-- Custom tables may be iterated using `pairs`.
for _, p in pairs(game.players) do game.player.print(p.name); end
```

It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

classes.name: LuaEntity
classes.description:
The primary interface for interacting with entities through the Lua API. Entities are everything that exists on the map except for tiles (see [LuaTile](runtime:LuaTile)).

Most functions on LuaEntity also work when the entity is contained in a ghost.

methods.name: add_autopilot_destination
methods.description: Adds the given position to this spidertron's autopilot's queue of destinations.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position the spidertron should move to.

methods.name: add_market_item
methods.description: Offer a thing on the market.
examples:
```
-- Adds market offer, 1 copper ore for 10 iron ore
market.add_market_item{price={{name = "iron-ore", count = 10}}, offer={type="give-item", item="copper-ore"}}
```

```
-- Adds market offer, 1 copper ore for 5 iron ore and 5 stone ore
market.add_market_item{price={{name = "iron-ore", count = 5}, {name = "stone", count = 5}}, offer={type="give-item", item="copper-ore"}}
```

methods.name: can_be_destroyed
methods.description: Whether the entity can be destroyed

methods.name: can_shoot
methods.description: Whether this character can shoot the given entity or position.

methods.name: can_wires_reach
methods.description: Can wires reach between these entities.

methods.name: cancel_deconstruction
methods.description: Cancels deconstruction if it is scheduled, does nothing otherwise.

raises.name: on_cancelled_deconstruction
raises.description: Raised if the entity's deconstruction was successfully cancelled.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force who did the deconstruction order.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to set the `last_user` to if any.

methods.name: cancel_upgrade
methods.description: Cancels upgrade if it is scheduled, does nothing otherwise.

raises.name: on_cancelled_upgrade
raises.description: Raised if the entity way previously marked for upgrade.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force who did the upgrade order.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to set the last_user to if any.

return_values.description: Whether the cancel was successful.

methods.name: clear_fluid_inside
methods.description: Remove all fluids from this entity.

methods.name: clear_market_items
methods.description: Removes all offers from a market.

methods.name: clone
methods.description: Clones this entity.

raises.name: on_entity_cloned
raises.description: Raised if the entity was successfully cloned.

parameters.name: create_build_effect_smoke
parameters.description: If false, the building effect smoke will not be shown around the new entity.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The destination position

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: The destination surface

return_values.description: The cloned entity or `nil` if this entity can't be cloned/can't be cloned to the given location.

methods.name: connect_linked_belts
methods.description:
Connects current linked belt with another one.

Neighbours have to be of different type. If given linked belt is connected to something else it will be disconnected first. If provided neighbour is connected to something else it will also be disconnected first. Automatically updates neighbour to be connected back to this one.

Can also be used on entity ghost if it contains linked-belt.

parameters.name: neighbour
parameters.description: Another linked belt or entity ghost containing linked belt to connect or nil to disconnect

methods.name: connect_rolling_stock
methods.description: Connects the rolling stock in the given direction.

return_values.description: Whether any connection was made

methods.name: copy_settings
methods.description: Copies settings from the given entity onto this entity.

parameters.name: by_player
parameters.description: If provided, the copying is done 'as' this player and [on_entity_settings_pasted](runtime:on_entity_settings_pasted) is triggered.

return_values.description: Any items removed from this entity as a result of copying the settings.

methods.name: create_build_effect_smoke
methods.description:
Creates the same smoke that is created when you place a building by hand.

You can play the building sound to go with it by using [LuaSurface::play_sound](runtime:LuaSurface::play_sound), eg: `entity.surface.play_sound{path="entity-build/"..entity.prototype.name, position=entity.position}`

methods.name: create_cargo_pod
methods.description:
Creates a cargo pod if possible.

Cargo pod will be created with [invalid](runtime:defines.cargo_destination.invalid) destination type. Setting [cargo_pod_destination](runtime:LuaEntity::cargo_pod_destination) will cause it to launch.

parameters.name: cargo_hatch
parameters.description: The hatch to create the pod at. A random (available) one is picked if not provided.

methods.name: damage
methods.description: Damages the entity.

parameters.name: cause
parameters.description: The entity that originally triggered the events that led to this damage being dealt (e.g. the character, turret, enemy, etc. that pulled the trigger). Does not need to be on the same surface as the entity being damaged.

parameters.name: damage
parameters.description: The amount of damage to be done.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force that will be doing the damage.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The entity that is directly dealing the damage (e.g. the projectile, flame, sticker, grenade, laser beam, etc.). Needs to be on the same surface as the entity being damaged.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of damage to be done, defaults to `"impact"`.

return_values.description: the total damage actually applied after resistances.

methods.name: deplete
methods.description: Depletes and destroys this resource entity.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description:
Destroys the entity.

Not all entities can be destroyed - things such as rails under trains cannot be destroyed until the train is moved or destroyed.

raises.name: script_raised_destroy
raises.description: Raised if the `raise_destroy` flag was set and the entity was successfully destroyed.

parameters.name: do_cliff_correction
parameters.description: Whether neighbouring cliffs should be corrected. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: item_index
parameters.description: The index of the undo item to add this action to. An index of `0` creates a new undo item for it. Defaults to putting it into the appropriate undo item automatically if not specified.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player whose undo queue this action should be added to.

parameters.name: raise_destroy
parameters.description: If `true`, [script_raised_destroy](runtime:script_raised_destroy) will be called. Defaults to `false`.

return_values.description: Returns `false` if the entity was valid and destruction failed, `true` in all other cases.

methods.name: die
methods.description:
Immediately kills the entity. Does nothing if the entity doesn't have health.

Unlike [LuaEntity::destroy](runtime:LuaEntity::destroy), `die` will trigger the [on_entity_died](runtime:on_entity_died) event and the entity will produce a corpse and drop loot if it has any.
examples:
```
-- This function can be called with only the `cause` argument and no `force`:
entity.die(nil, killer_entity)
```

raises.name: on_entity_died
raises.description: Raised if the entity was successfully killed. If `force` is not specified, the event will blame the `"neutral"` force.

raises.name: on_post_entity_died
raises.description: Raised if the entity was successfully killed.

parameters.name: cause
parameters.description: The cause to attribute the kill to.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force to attribute the kill to.

return_values.description: Whether the entity was successfully killed.

methods.name: disconnect_linked_belts
methods.description:
Disconnects linked belt from its neighbour.

Can also be used on entity ghost if it contains linked-belt

methods.name: disconnect_rolling_stock
methods.description: Tries to disconnect this rolling stock in the given direction.

return_values.description: If anything was disconnected

methods.name: force_finish_ascending
methods.description: Take an ascending cargo pod and safely make it skip all animation and immediately switch surface.

methods.name: force_finish_descending
methods.description: Take a descending cargo pod and safely make it arrive and deposit cargo.

raises.name: on_cargo_pod_delivered_cargo
raises.description: Raised instantly if landing on the ground (i.e. destination type is [surface](runtime:defines.cargo_destination.surface). If landing in a [station](runtime:defines.cargo_destination.station), event will be raised after parking is complete.

methods.name: get_beacon_effect_receivers

methods.name: get_beacons

methods.name: get_beam_target

methods.name: get_cargo_bays
methods.description: Gets the cargo bays connected to this cargo landing pad or space platform hub.

methods.name: get_child_signals
methods.description: Returns all child signals. Child signals can be either RailSignal or RailChainSignal. Child signals are signals which are checked by this signal to determine a chain state.

parameters.name: wire_connector_id
parameters.description: Wire connector to get circuit network for.

return_values.description: The circuit network or nil.
Rail connected in the specified manner to this one, `nil` if unsuccessful.
Rail direction of the returned rail which points to origin rail
Turn to be taken when going back from returned rail to origin rail

methods.name: get_connected_rails
methods.description: Get the rails that this signal is connected to.

methods.name: get_connected_rolling_stock
methods.description: Gets rolling stock connected to the given end of this stock.

return_values.description: The rolling stock connected at the given end, `nil` if none is connected there.
The rail direction of the connected rolling stock if any.

methods.name: get_control_behavior
methods.description: Gets the control behavior of the entity (if any).

return_values.description: The control behavior or `nil`.

methods.name: get_damage_to_be_taken
methods.description: Returns the amount of damage to be taken by this entity.

return_values.description: `nil` if this entity does not have health.

methods.name: get_driver
methods.description: Gets the driver of this vehicle if any.

return_values.description: `nil` if the vehicle contains no driver. To check if there's a passenger see [LuaEntity::get_passenger](runtime:LuaEntity::get_passenger).

methods.name: get_electric_input_flow_limit
methods.description: The input flow limit for the electric energy source. `nil` if the entity doesn't have an electric energy source.

methods.name: get_electric_output_flow_limit
methods.description: The output flow limit for the electric energy source. `nil` if the entity doesn't have an electric energy source.

methods.name: get_filter
methods.description: Get the filter for a slot in an inserter, loader, mining drill, asteroid collector, or logistic storage container. The entity must allow filters.

parameters.name: slot_index
parameters.description: Index of the slot to get the filter for.

return_values.description: The filter, or `nil` if the given slot has no filter.

methods.name: get_fluid
methods.description: Gets fluid of the i-th fluid storage.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Fluid storage index. Valid values are from 1 up to [LuaEntity::fluids_count](runtime:LuaEntity::fluids_count).

return_values.description: Fluid in this storage. nil if fluid storage is empty.

methods.name: get_fluid_contents
methods.description:
Get amounts of all fluids in this entity.

If information about fluid temperatures is required, [LuaEntity::fluidbox](runtime:LuaEntity::fluidbox) should be used instead.

return_values.description: The amounts, indexed by fluid names.

methods.name: get_fluid_count
methods.description:
Get the amount of all or some fluid in this entity.

If information about fluid temperatures is required, [LuaEntity::fluidbox](runtime:LuaEntity::fluidbox) should be used instead.

parameters.name: fluid
parameters.description: Prototype name of the fluid to count. If not specified, count all fluids.

methods.name: get_fuel_inventory
methods.description: The fuel inventory for this entity or `nil` if this entity doesn't have a fuel inventory.

methods.name: get_health_ratio
methods.description: The health ratio of this entity between 1 and 0 (for full health and no health respectively).

return_values.description: `nil` if this entity doesn't have health.

methods.name: get_heat_setting
methods.description: Gets the heat setting for this heat interface.

methods.name: get_inbound_signals
methods.description: Returns all signals guarding entrance to a rail block this rail belongs to.

methods.name: get_infinity_container_filter
methods.description: Gets the filter for this infinity container at the given index, or `nil` if the filter index doesn't exist or is empty.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to get.

methods.name: get_infinity_pipe_filter
methods.description: Gets the filter for this infinity pipe, or `nil` if the filter is empty.

methods.name: get_item_insert_specification
methods.description: Get an item insert specification onto a belt connectable: for a given map position provides into which line at what position item should be inserted to be closest to the provided position.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Position where the item is to be inserted.

return_values.description: Index of the transport line that is closest to the provided map position.
Position along the transport line where item should be dropped.

methods.name: get_line_item_position
methods.description: Get a map position related to a position on a transport line.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Index of the transport line. Transport lines are 1-indexed.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Linear position along the transport line. Clamped to the transport line range.

methods.name: get_logistic_point
methods.description:
Gets all the `LuaLogisticPoint`s that this entity owns. Optionally returns only the point specified by the index parameter.

When `index` is not given, this will be a single `LuaLogisticPoint` for most entities. For some (such as the player character), it can be zero or more.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If provided, only returns the `LuaLogisticPoint` specified by this index.

methods.name: get_logistic_sections
methods.description: Gives logistic sections of this entity if it uses logistic sections.

methods.name: get_market_items
methods.description: Get all offers in a market as an array.

methods.name: get_max_transport_line_index
methods.description: Get the maximum transport line index of a belt or belt connectable entity.

methods.name: get_module_inventory
methods.description: Inventory for storing modules of this entity; `nil` if this entity has no module inventory.

methods.name: get_or_create_control_behavior
methods.description: Gets (and or creates if needed) the control behavior of the entity.

return_values.description: The control behavior or `nil`.

methods.name: get_outbound_signals
methods.description: Returns all signals guarding exit from a rail block this rail belongs to.

methods.name: get_output_inventory
methods.description: Gets the entity's output inventory if it has one.

return_values.description: A reference to the entity's output inventory.

methods.name: get_parent_signals
methods.description: Returns all parent signals. Parent signals are always RailChainSignal. Parent signals are those signals that are checking state of this signal to determine their own chain state.

methods.name: get_passenger
methods.description:
Gets the passenger of this car, spidertron, or cargo pod if any.

This differs over [LuaEntity::get_driver](runtime:LuaEntity::get_driver) in that for cars, the passenger can't drive the car.

return_values.description: `nil` if the vehicle contains no passenger. To check if there's a driver see [LuaEntity::get_driver](runtime:LuaEntity::get_driver).

methods.name: get_priority_target
methods.description: Get the entity ID at the specified position in the turret's priority list.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the entry to fetch.

methods.name: get_radius
methods.description: The radius of this entity.

methods.name: get_rail_end
methods.description: Gets a LuaRailEnd object for specified end of this rail

methods.name: get_rail_segment_end
methods.description:
Get the rail at the end of the rail segment this rail is in.

A rail segment is a continuous section of rail with no branches, signals, nor train stops.

return_values.description: The rail entity.
A rail direction pointing out of the rail segment from the end rail.

methods.name: get_rail_segment_length
methods.description:
Get the length of the rail segment this rail is in.

A rail segment is a continuous section of rail with no branches, signals, nor train stops.

methods.name: get_rail_segment_overlaps
methods.description:
Get a rail from each rail segment that overlaps with this rail's rail segment.

A rail segment is a continuous section of rail with no branches, signals, nor train stops.

methods.name: get_rail_segment_rails
methods.description:
Get all rails of a rail segment this rail is in

A rail segment is a continuous section of rail with no branches, signals, nor train stops.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Selects end of this rail that points to a rail segment end from which to start returning rails

return_values.description: Rails of this rail segment

methods.name: get_rail_segment_signal
methods.description:
Get the rail signal at the start/end of the rail segment this rail is in.

A rail segment is a continuous section of rail with no branches, signals, nor train stops.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction of travel relative to this rail.

parameters.name: in_else_out
parameters.description: If true, gets the signal at the entrance of the rail segment, otherwise gets the signal at the exit of the rail segment.

return_values.description: `nil` if the rail segment doesn't start/end with a signal.

methods.name: get_rail_segment_stop
methods.description:
Get train stop at the start/end of the rail segment this rail is in.

A rail segment is a continuous section of rail with no branches, signals, nor train stops.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction of travel relative to this rail.

return_values.description: `nil` if the rail segment doesn't start/end with a train stop.

methods.name: get_recipe
methods.description: Current recipe being assembled by this machine, if any.

methods.name: get_signal

parameters.name: signal
