parameters.name: wire_connector_id
parameters.description: Wire connector ID from which to get the signal

return_values.description: The current value of the signal.

methods.name: get_signals
methods.description: Read all signals from the selected wire connector.

parameters.name: extra_wire_connector_id
parameters.description: Additional wire connector ID. If specified, signals will be added to the result

parameters.name: wire_connector_id
parameters.description: Wire connector ID from which to get the signal

return_values.description: Current values of all signals.

methods.name: get_spider_legs
methods.description: Gets legs of given SpiderVehicle.

methods.name: get_stopped_train
methods.description: The train currently stopped at this train stop, if any.

methods.name: get_train_stop_trains
methods.description: The trains scheduled to stop at this train stop.

methods.name: get_transport_line
methods.description: Get a transport line of a belt or belt connectable entity.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Index of the requested transport line. Transport lines are 1-indexed.

methods.name: get_upgrade_target
methods.description: Returns the new entity prototype and its quality.

return_values.description: `nil` if this entity is not marked for upgrade.
`nil` if this entity is not marked for upgrade.

methods.name: get_wire_connector
methods.description: Gets a single wire connector of this entity

parameters.name: or_create
parameters.description: If true and connector does not exist, it will be allocated if possible

parameters.name: wire_connector_id
parameters.description: Identifier of a specific connector to get

methods.name: get_wire_connectors
methods.description: Gets all wire connectors of this entity

parameters.name: or_create
parameters.description: If true, it will try to create all connectors possible

methods.name: ghost_has_flag
methods.description: Same as [LuaEntity::has_flag](runtime:LuaEntity::has_flag), but targets the inner entity on a entity ghost.

parameters.name: flag
parameters.description: The flag to test.

return_values.description: `true` if the entity has the given flag set.

methods.name: has_flag
methods.description:
Test whether this entity's prototype has a certain flag set.

`entity.has_flag(f)` is a shortcut for `entity.prototype.has_flag(f)`.

parameters.name: flag
parameters.description: The flag to test.

return_values.description: `true` if this entity has the given flag set.

methods.name: insert_fluid
methods.description: Insert fluid into this entity. Fluidbox is chosen automatically.

parameters.name: fluid
parameters.description: Fluid to insert.

return_values.description: Amount of fluid actually inserted.
`true` if this gate is currently closed.
`true` if this gate is currently closing

methods.name: is_connected_to_electric_network
methods.description: Returns `true` if this entity produces or consumes electricity and is connected to an electric network that has at least one entity that can produce power.

methods.name: is_crafting
methods.description: Returns whether a craft is currently in process. It does not indicate whether progress is currently being made, but whether a crafting process has been started in this machine.

return_values.description: `true` if this gate is currently opened.
`true` if this gate is currently opening.

methods.name: is_rail_in_same_rail_block_as
methods.description: Checks if this rail and other rail both belong to the same rail block.

methods.name: is_rail_in_same_rail_segment_as
methods.description: Checks if this rail and other rail both belong to the same rail segment.

methods.name: is_registered_for_construction
methods.description: Is this entity or tile ghost or item request proxy registered for construction? If false, it means a construction robot has been dispatched to build the entity, or it is not an entity that can be constructed.

methods.name: is_registered_for_deconstruction
methods.description: Is this entity registered for deconstruction with this force? If false, it means a construction robot has been dispatched to deconstruct it, or it is not marked for deconstruction. The complexity is effectively O(1) - it depends on the number of objects targeting this entity which should be small enough.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force construction manager to check.

methods.name: is_registered_for_repair
methods.description: Is this entity registered for repair? If false, it means a construction robot has been dispatched to upgrade it, or it is not damaged. This is worst-case O(N) complexity where N is the current number of things in the repair queue.

methods.name: is_registered_for_upgrade
methods.description: Is this entity registered for upgrade? If false, it means a construction robot has been dispatched to upgrade it, or it is not marked for upgrade. This is worst-case O(N) complexity where N is the current number of things in the upgrade queue.

raises.name: on_rocket_launch_ordered
raises.description: Raised if the rocket launch was successfully initiated.

return_values.description: `true` if the rocket was successfully launched. Return value of `false` means the silo is not ready for launch.

methods.name: mine
methods.description:
Mines this entity.

'Standard' operation is to keep calling `LuaEntity.mine` with an inventory until all items are transferred and the items dealt with.

The result of mining the entity (the item(s) it produces when mined) will be dropped on the ground if they don't fit into the provided inventory. If no inventory is provided, the items will be destroyed.

raises.name: script_raised_destroy
raises.description: Raised if the `raise_destroyed` flag was set and the entity was successfully mined.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If true, when the item(s) don't fit into the given inventory the entity is force mined. If false, the mining operation fails when there isn't enough room to transfer all of the items into the inventory. Defaults to false. This is ignored and acts as `true` if no inventory is provided.

parameters.name: ignore_minable
parameters.description: If true, the minable state of the entity is ignored. Defaults to `false`. If false, an entity that isn't minable (set as not-minable in the prototype or isn't minable for other reasons) will fail to be mined.

parameters.name: inventory
parameters.description: If provided the item(s) will be transferred into this inventory. If provided, this must be an inventory created with [LuaGameScript::create_inventory](runtime:LuaGameScript::create_inventory) or be a basic inventory owned by some entity.

parameters.name: raise_destroyed
parameters.description: If true, [script_raised_destroy](runtime:script_raised_destroy) will be raised. Defaults to `true`.

return_values.description: Whether mining succeeded.

methods.name: order_deconstruction
methods.description: Sets the entity to be deconstructed by construction robots.

raises.name: on_marked_for_deconstruction
raises.description: Raised if the entity was successfully marked for deconstruction.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force whose robots are supposed to do the deconstruction.

parameters.name: item_index
parameters.description: The index of the undo item to add this action to. An index of `0` creates a new undo item for it. An index of `1` adds the action to the latest undo action on the stack. Defaults to putting it into the appropriate undo item automatically if one is not specified.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to set the last_user to, if any. Also the player whose undo queue this action should be added to.

return_values.description: if the entity was marked for deconstruction.

methods.name: order_upgrade
methods.description: Sets the entity to be upgraded by construction robots.

raises.name: on_marked_for_upgrade
raises.description: Raised if the entity was successfully marked for upgrade.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force whose robots are supposed to do the upgrade.

parameters.name: item_index
parameters.description: The index of the undo item to add this action to. An index of `0` creates a new undo item for it. Defaults to putting it into the appropriate undo item automatically if not specified.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player whose undo queue this action should be added to.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The prototype of the entity to upgrade to.

return_values.description: Whether the entity was marked for upgrade.

methods.name: play_note
methods.description: Plays a note with the given instrument and note.

return_values.description: Whether the request is valid. The sound may or may not be played depending on polyphony settings.

methods.name: release_from_spawner
methods.description: Release the unit from the spawner which spawned it. This allows the spawner to continue spawning additional units.

methods.name: remove_fluid
methods.description:
Remove fluid from this entity.

If temperature is given only fluid matching that exact temperature is removed. If minimum and maximum is given fluid within that range is removed.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount to remove

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Fluid prototype name.

return_values.description: Amount of fluid actually removed.

methods.name: remove_market_item
methods.description:
Remove an offer from a market.

The other offers are moved down to fill the gap created by removing the offer, which decrements the overall size of the offer array.

parameters.name: offer
parameters.description: Index of offer to remove.

return_values.description: `true` if the offer was successfully removed; `false` when the given index was not valid.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force that requests the gate to be closed.

parameters.name: extra_time
parameters.description: Extra ticks to stay open.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force that requests the gate to be open.

methods.name: revive
methods.description: Revive a ghost, which turns it from a ghost into a real entity or tile.

raises.name: script_raised_revive
raises.description: Raised if this was an entity ghost and the `raise_revive` flag was set and the entity was successfully revived.

raises.name: script_raised_set_tiles
raises.description: Raised if this was a tile ghost and the `raise_revive` flag was set and the tile was successfully revived.

parameters.name: raise_revive
parameters.description: If true, and an entity ghost; [script_raised_revive](runtime:script_raised_revive) will be called. Else if true, and a tile ghost; [script_raised_set_tiles](runtime:script_raised_set_tiles) will be called.

parameters.name: return_item_request_proxy
parameters.description: If `true` the function will return item request proxy as the third return value.

return_values.description: Any items the new real entity collided with or `nil` if the ghost could not be revived.
The revived entity if an entity ghost was successfully revived.
The item request proxy if it was requested with `return_item_request_proxy`.

methods.name: rotate
methods.description: Rotates this entity as if the player rotated it.

raises.name: on_player_rotated_entity
raises.description: Raised if the `by_player` argument was given and the rotation was successful.

parameters.name: reverse
parameters.description: If `true`, rotate the entity in the counter-clockwise direction.

return_values.description: Whether the rotation was successful.

methods.name: set_beam_source
methods.description: Set the source of this beam.

methods.name: set_beam_target
methods.description: Set the target of this beam.

methods.name: set_driver
methods.description:
Sets the driver of this vehicle.

This differs from [LuaEntity::set_passenger](runtime:LuaEntity::set_passenger) in that the passenger can't drive the vehicle.

parameters.name: driver
parameters.description: The new driver. Writing `nil` ejects the current driver, if any.

methods.name: set_filter
methods.description: Set the filter for a slot in an inserter (ItemFilter), loader (ItemFilter), mining drill (EntityID), asteroid collector (AsteroidChunkID) or logistic storage container (ItemWithQualityID). The entity must allow filters.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The item or entity to filter, or `nil` to clear the filter.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Index of the slot to set the filter for.

methods.name: set_fluid
methods.description:
Sets fluid to the i-th fluid storage.

Fluid storages that are part of FluidBoxes (also available through [LuaFluidBox](runtime:LuaFluidBox)) may reject some fluids if they do not match filters or are above the FluidBox volume. To verify how much fluid was set a return value can be used which is the same as value that would be returned by [LuaEntity::get_fluid](runtime:LuaEntity::get_fluid).

parameters.name: fluid
parameters.description: Fluid to set. Fluid storage will be cleared if this is not provided.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Fluid storage index. Valid values are from 1 up to [LuaEntity::fluids_count](runtime:LuaEntity::fluids_count).

return_values.description: Fluid in this storage after it was set. nil if fluid storage is empty.

methods.name: set_heat_setting
methods.description: Sets the heat setting for this heat interface.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The new setting.

methods.name: set_infinity_container_filter
methods.description: Sets the filter for this infinity container at the given index.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The new filter, or `nil` to clear the filter.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to set.

methods.name: set_infinity_pipe_filter
methods.description: Sets the filter for this infinity pipe.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The new filter, or `nil` to clear the filter.

methods.name: set_passenger
methods.description:
Sets the passenger of this car or spidertron.

This differs from [LuaEntity::get_driver](runtime:LuaEntity::get_driver) in that the passenger can't drive the car.

parameters.name: passenger
parameters.description: The new passenger. Writing `nil` ejects the current passenger, if any.

methods.name: set_priority_target
methods.description: Set the entity ID name at the specified position in the turret's priority list.

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: The name of the entity prototype, or `nil` to clear the entry.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the entry to set.

methods.name: set_recipe
methods.description: Sets the given recipe in this assembly machine.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: The quality. If not provided `normal` is used.

parameters.name: recipe
parameters.description: The new recipe. Writing `nil` clears the recipe, if any.

return_values.description: Any items removed from this entity as a result of setting the recipe.

methods.name: silent_revive
methods.description: Revives a ghost silently, so the revival makes no sound and no smoke is created.

raises.name: script_raised_revive
raises.description: Raised if this was an entity ghost and the `raise_revive` flag was set and the entity was successfully revived.

raises.name: script_raised_set_tiles
raises.description: Raised if this was a tile ghost and the `raise_revive` flag was set and the tile was successfully revived.

parameters.name: raise_revive
parameters.description: If true, and an entity ghost; [script_raised_revive](runtime:script_raised_revive) will be called. Else if true, and a tile ghost; [script_raised_set_tiles](runtime:script_raised_set_tiles) will be called.

return_values.description: Any items the new real entity collided with or `nil` if the ghost could not be revived.
The revived entity if an entity ghost was successfully revived.
The item request proxy.

methods.name: spawn_decorations
methods.description: Triggers spawn_decoration actions defined in the entity prototype or does nothing if entity is not "turret" or "unit-spawner".

methods.name: start_fading_out
methods.description: Only works if the entity is a speech-bubble, with an "effect" defined in its wrapper_flow_style. Starts animating the opacity of the speech bubble towards zero, and destroys the entity when it hits zero.

methods.name: stop_spider
methods.description: Sets the [speed](runtime:LuaEntity::speed) of the given SpiderVehicle to zero. Notably does not clear its [autopilot_destination](runtime:LuaEntity::autopilot_destination), which it will continue moving towards if set.

methods.name: supports_backer_name
methods.description: Whether this entity supports a backer name.

methods.name: to_be_deconstructed
methods.description: Is this entity marked for deconstruction?

methods.name: to_be_upgraded
methods.description: Is this entity marked for upgrade?

methods.name: toggle_equipment_movement_bonus
methods.description:
Toggle this entity's equipment movement bonus. Does nothing if the entity does not have an equipment grid.

This property can also be read and written on the equipment grid of this entity.

methods.name: update_connections
methods.description: Reconnect loader, beacon, cliff and mining drill connections to entities that might have been teleported out or in by the script. The game doesn't do this automatically as we don't want to lose performance by checking this in normal games.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description:
Deactivating an entity will stop all its operations (car will stop moving, inserters will stop working, fish will stop moving etc).

Entities that are not active naturally can't be set to be active (setting it to be active will do nothing)

Ghosts, simple smoke, and corpses can't be modified at this time.

It is even possible to set the character to not be active, so he can't move and perform most of the tasks.

attributes.name: ai_settings
attributes.description: The ai settings of this unit.

attributes.name: allow_dispatching_robots
attributes.description: Whether this character's personal roboports are allowed to dispatch robots.

attributes.name: always_on
attributes.description: If the lamp is always on when not driven by control behavior.

attributes.name: amount
attributes.description: Count of resource units contained.

attributes.name: armed
attributes.description: Whether this land mine is armed.

attributes.name: artillery_auto_targeting
attributes.description: If this artillery auto-targets enemies.

attributes.name: associated_player
attributes.description:
The player this character is associated with, if any. Set to `nil` to clear.

The player will be automatically disassociated when a controller is set on the character. Also, all characters associated to a player will be logged off when the player logs off in multiplayer.

Reading this property will return a [LuaPlayer](runtime:LuaPlayer), while [PlayerIdentification](runtime:PlayerIdentification) can be used when writing.

A character associated with a player is not directly controlled by any player.

attributes.name: attached_cargo_pod
attributes.description: The cargo pod attached to this rocket silo rocket if any.

attributes.name: autopilot_destination
attributes.description: Destination of this spidertron's autopilot, if any. Writing `nil` clears all destinations.

attributes.name: autopilot_destinations
attributes.description: The queued destination positions of spidertron's autopilot.

attributes.name: backer_name
attributes.description:
The backer name assigned to this entity. Entities that support backer names are labs, locomotives, radars, roboports, and train stops. `nil` if this entity doesn't support backer names.

While train stops get the name of a backer when placed down, players can rename them if they want to. In this case, `backer_name` returns the player-given name of the entity.

attributes.name: beacons_count
attributes.description: Number of beacons affecting this effect receiver. Can only be used when the entity has an effect receiver (AssemblingMachine, Furnace, Lab, MiningDrills)

attributes.name: belt_neighbours
attributes.description: The belt connectable neighbours of this belt connectable entity. Only entities that input to or are outputs of this entity. Does not contain the other end of an underground belt, see [LuaEntity::neighbours](runtime:LuaEntity::neighbours) for that.

parameters.name: inputs
parameters.description: Array of transport belt connectable entities.

parameters.name: outputs
parameters.description: Array of transport belt connectable entities.

attributes.name: belt_shape
attributes.description:
Gives what is the current shape of a transport-belt.

Can also be used on entity ghost if it contains transport-belt.

attributes.name: belt_to_ground_type
attributes.description: Whether this underground belt goes into or out of the ground.

attributes.name: bonus_mining_progress
attributes.description: The bonus mining progress for this mining drill. Read yields a number in range [0, mining_target.prototype.mineable_properties.mining_time]. `nil` if this isn't a mining drill.

attributes.name: bonus_progress
attributes.description: The current productivity bonus progress, as a number in range `[0, 1]`.

attributes.name: bounding_box
attributes.description: [LuaEntityPrototype::collision_box](runtime:LuaEntityPrototype::collision_box) around entity's given position and respecting the current entity orientation.

attributes.name: burner
attributes.description: The burner energy source for this entity, if any.

attributes.name: cargo_hatches
attributes.description: The cargo hatches owned by this entity if any.

attributes.name: cargo_pod_destination
attributes.description:
The destination of this cargo pod entity.

Use [force_finish_ascending](runtime:LuaEntity::force_finish_ascending) if you want it to only descend from orbit.

attributes.name: cargo_pod_origin
attributes.description: The origin of this cargo pod entity. (Must be a silo, hub or pad)

attributes.name: cargo_pod_state
attributes.description: The state of this cargo pod entity.

attributes.name: chain_signal_state
attributes.description: The state of this chain signal.

attributes.name: character_corpse_death_cause
attributes.description: The reason this character corpse character died. `""` if there is no reason.

attributes.name: character_corpse_player_index
attributes.description:
The player index associated with this character corpse.

The index is not guaranteed to be valid so it should always be checked first if a player with that index actually exists.

attributes.name: character_corpse_tick_of_death
attributes.description: The tick this character corpse died at.

attributes.name: cliff_orientation
attributes.description: The orientation of this cliff.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color of this character, rolling stock, train stop, car, spider-vehicle, flying text, corpse or simple-entity-with-owner. `nil` if this entity doesn't use custom colors.

Car color is overridden by the color of the current driver/passenger, if there is one.

attributes.name: combat_robot_owner
attributes.description: The owner of this combat robot, if any.

attributes.name: combinator_description
attributes.description: The description on this combinator

attributes.name: commandable
attributes.description: Returns a LuaCommandable for this entity or nil if entity is not commandable.

attributes.name: connected_rail
attributes.description: The rail entity this train stop is connected to, if any.

attributes.name: connected_rail_direction
attributes.description: Rail direction to which this train stop is binding. This returns a value even when no rails are present.

attributes.name: consumption_bonus
attributes.description: The consumption bonus of this entity.

attributes.name: consumption_modifier
attributes.description: Multiplies the energy consumption.

attributes.name: copy_color_from_train_stop
attributes.description: If this RollingStock has 'copy color from train stop' enabled.

attributes.name: corpse_expires
attributes.description: Whether this corpse will ever fade away.

attributes.name: corpse_immune_to_entity_placement
attributes.description: If true, corpse won't be destroyed when entities are placed over it. If false, whether corpse will be removed or not depends on value of [CorpsePrototype::remove_on_entity_placement](prototype:CorpsePrototype::remove_on_entity_placement).

attributes.name: crafting_progress
attributes.description: The current crafting progress, as a number in range `[0, 1]`.

attributes.name: crafting_speed
attributes.description: The current crafting speed, including speed bonuses from modules and beacons.

attributes.name: crane_destination
attributes.description: Destination of the crane of this entity. Throws when trying to set the destination out of range.

attributes.name: crane_destination_3d
attributes.description: Destination of the crane of this entity in 3D. Throws when trying to set the destination out of range.

attributes.name: crane_grappler_destination
attributes.description: Will set destination for the grappler of crane of this entity. The crane grappler will start moving to reach the destination, but the rest of the arm will remain stationary. Throws when trying to set the destination out of range.

attributes.name: crane_grappler_destination_3d
attributes.description: Will set destination in 3D for the grappler of crane of this entity. The crane grappler will start moving to reach the destination, but the rest of the arm will remain stationary. Throws when trying to set the destination out of range.

attributes.name: custom_status
attributes.description: A custom status for this entity that will be displayed in the GUI.

attributes.name: damage_dealt
attributes.description: The damage dealt by this turret, artillery turret, or artillery wagon.

attributes.name: destructible
attributes.description:
If set to `false`, this entity can't be damaged and won't be attacked automatically. It can however still be mined.

Entities that are indestructible naturally (they have no health, like smoke, resource etc) can't be set to be destructible.

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description: The current direction this entity is facing.

attributes.name: disabled_by_control_behavior
attributes.description: If the updatable entity is disabled by control behavior.

attributes.name: disabled_by_recipe
attributes.description: If the updatable entity is disabled by recipe.

attributes.name: disabled_by_script
attributes.description:
If the updatable entity is disabled by script.

Note: Some entities (Corpse, FireFlame, Roboport, RollingStock, dying entities) need to remain active and will ignore writes.

attributes.name: draw_data
attributes.description: Gives a draw data of the given entity if it supports such data.

attributes.name: driver_is_gunner
attributes.description: Whether the driver of this car or spidertron is the gunner. If `false`, the passenger is the gunner. `nil` if this is neither a car or a spidertron.

attributes.name: drop_position
attributes.description:
Position where the entity puts its stuff.

Mining drills and crafting machines can't have their drop position changed; inserters must have `allow_custom_vectors` set to true on their prototype to allow changing the drop position.

Meaningful only for entities that put stuff somewhere, such as mining drills, crafting machines with a drop target or inserters.

attributes.name: drop_target
attributes.description: The entity this entity is putting its items to. If there are multiple possible entities at the drop-off point, writing to this attribute allows a mod to choose which one to drop off items to. The entity needs to collide with the tile box under the drop-off position. `nil` if there is no entity to put items to, or if this is not an entity that puts items somewhere.

attributes.name: effective_speed
attributes.description: The current speed of this unit in tiles per tick, taking into account any walking speed modifier given by the tile the unit is standing on. `nil` if this is not a unit.

attributes.name: effectivity_modifier
attributes.description: Multiplies the acceleration the vehicle can create for one unit of energy. Defaults to `1`.

attributes.name: effects
attributes.description: The effects being applied to this entity, if any. For beacons, this is the effect the beacon is broadcasting.

attributes.name: electric_buffer_size
attributes.description:
The buffer size for the electric energy source. `nil` if the entity doesn't have an electric energy source.

Write access is limited to the ElectricEnergyInterface type.

attributes.name: electric_drain
attributes.description: The electric drain for the electric energy source. `nil` if the entity doesn't have an electric energy source.

attributes.name: electric_emissions_per_joule
attributes.description: The table of emissions of this energy source in `pollution/Joule`, indexed by pollutant type. `nil` if the entity doesn't have an electric energy source. Multiplying values in the returned table by energy consumption in `Watt` gives `pollution/second`.

attributes.name: electric_network_id
attributes.description: Returns the id of the electric network that this entity is connected to, if any.

attributes.name: electric_network_statistics
attributes.description: The electric network statistics for this electric pole.

attributes.name: enable_logistics_while_moving
attributes.description: Whether equipment grid logistics are enabled while this vehicle is moving.

attributes.name: energy
attributes.description: Energy stored in the entity's energy buffer (energy stored in electrical devices etc.). Always 0 for entities that don't have the concept of energy stored inside.
examples:
```
game.player.print("Machine energy: " .. game.player.selected.energy .. "J")
game.player.selected.energy = 3000
```

attributes.name: energy_generated_last_tick
attributes.description: How much energy this generator generated in the last tick.

attributes.name: entity_label
attributes.description: The label on this spider-vehicle entity, if any. `nil` if this is not a spider-vehicle.

attributes.name: filter_slot_count
attributes.description: The number of filter slots this inserter, loader, mining drill, asteroid collector or logistic storage container has. 0 if not one of those entities.

attributes.name: fluidbox
attributes.description: Fluidboxes of this entity.

attributes.name: fluids_count
attributes.description: Returns count of fluid storages. This includes fluid storages provided by FluidBoxes but also covers other fluid storages like FluidTurret's internal buffer and FluidWagon's fluid since they are not FluidBox and cannot be exposed through [LuaFluidBox](runtime:LuaFluidBox).

attributes.name: follow_offset
attributes.description: The follow offset of this spidertron, if any entity is being followed. This is randomized each time the follow entity is set.

attributes.name: follow_target
attributes.description: The follow target of this spidertron, if any.

attributes.name: friction_modifier
attributes.description: Multiplies the car friction rate.
examples:
```
-- This will allow the car to go much faster
game.player.vehicle.friction_modifier = 0.5
```

attributes.name: frozen
attributes.description: If the freezable entity is currently frozen.

attributes.name: ghost_localised_name
attributes.description: Localised name of the entity or tile contained in this ghost.

attributes.name: ghost_name
attributes.description: Name of the entity or tile contained in this ghost

attributes.name: ghost_prototype
attributes.description: The prototype of the entity or tile contained in this ghost.

attributes.name: ghost_type
attributes.description: The prototype type of the entity or tile contained in this ghost.

attributes.name: ghost_unit_number
attributes.description: The [unit_number](runtime:LuaEntity::unit_number) of the entity contained in this ghost. It is the same as the unit number of the [EntityWithOwnerPrototype](prototype:EntityWithOwnerPrototype) that was destroyed to create this ghost. If it was created by other means, or if the inner entity does not support unit numbers, this property is `nil`.

attributes.name: gps_tag
attributes.description: Returns a [rich text](https://wiki.factorio.com/Rich_text) string containing this entity's position and surface name as a gps tag. [Printing](runtime:LuaGameScript::print) it will ping the location of the entity.
examples:
```
-- called on a LuaEntity on the default surface it returns:
entity.gps_tag -- => "[gps=-4,-9]"

-- called on a LuaEntity on "custom-surface" it returns:
different_entity.gps_tag -- => "[gps=1,-5,custom-surface]"
```

attributes.name: graphics_variation
attributes.description: The graphics variation for this entity. `nil` if this entity doesn't use graphics variations.

attributes.name: grid
attributes.description: This entity's equipment grid, if any.

attributes.name: health
attributes.description:
The current health of the entity, if any. Health is automatically clamped to be between `0` and max health (inclusive). Entities with a health of `0` can not be attacked.

To get the maximum possible health of this entity, see [LuaEntity::max_health](runtime:LuaEntity::max_health).

attributes.name: held_stack
attributes.description: The item stack currently held in an inserter's hand.

attributes.name: held_stack_position
attributes.description: Current position of the inserter's "hand".

attributes.name: highlight_box_blink_interval
attributes.description: The blink interval of this highlight box entity. `0` indicates no blink.

attributes.name: highlight_box_type
attributes.description: The highlight box type of this highlight box entity.

attributes.name: ignore_unprioritised_targets
attributes.description: Whether this turret shoots at targets that are not on its priority list.

attributes.name: infinity_container_filters
attributes.description: The filters for this infinity container.

attributes.name: initial_amount
attributes.description:
Count of initial resource units contained. `nil` if this is not an infinite resource.

If this is not an infinite resource, writing will produce an error.

attributes.name: insert_plan
attributes.description: The insert plan for this ghost or item request proxy.

attributes.name: inserter_filter_mode
attributes.description: The filter mode for this filter inserter. `nil` if this inserter doesn't use filters.

attributes.name: inserter_spoil_priority
attributes.description: The spoil priority for this inserter.

attributes.name: inserter_stack_size_override
attributes.description:
Sets the stack size limit on this inserter.

Set to `0` to reset.

attributes.name: inserter_target_pickup_count
attributes.description:
Returns the current target pickup count of the inserter.

This considers the circuit network, manual override and the inserter stack size limit based on technology.

attributes.name: is_entity_with_health
attributes.description: If this entity is EntityWithHealth

attributes.name: is_entity_with_owner
attributes.description: If this entity is EntityWithOwner

attributes.name: is_freezable
attributes.description: If the entity is freezable.

attributes.name: is_headed_to_trains_front
attributes.description: If the rolling stock is facing train's front.

attributes.name: is_military_target
attributes.description: Whether this entity is a MilitaryTarget. Can be written to if [LuaEntityPrototype::allow_run_time_change_of_is_military_target](runtime:LuaEntityPrototype::allow_run_time_change_of_is_military_target) returns `true`.

attributes.name: is_updatable
attributes.description: If the entity is updatable.

attributes.name: item_requests
attributes.description: Items this ghost will request when revived or items this item request proxy is requesting.

attributes.name: kills
attributes.description: The number of units killed by this turret, artillery turret, or artillery wagon.

attributes.name: last_user
attributes.description:
The last player that changed any setting on this entity. This includes building the entity, changing its color, or configuring its circuit network. `nil` if the last user is not part of the save anymore.

Reading this property will return a [LuaPlayer](runtime:LuaPlayer), while [PlayerIdentification](runtime:PlayerIdentification) can be used when writing.

attributes.name: link_id
attributes.description: The link ID this linked container is using.

attributes.name: linked_belt_neighbour
attributes.description:
Neighbour to which this linked belt is connected to, if any.

Can also be used on entity ghost if it contains linked-belt.

May return entity ghost which contains linked belt to which connection is made.

attributes.name: linked_belt_type
attributes.description:
Type of linked belt. Changing type will also flip direction so the belt is out of the same side.

Can only be changed when linked belt is disconnected (has no neighbour set).

Can also be used on entity ghost if it contains linked-belt.

attributes.name: loader_belt_stack_size_override
attributes.description: The belt stack size override for this loader. Set to `0` to disable. Writing this value requires [LoaderPrototype::adjustable_belt_stack_size](prototype:LoaderPrototype::adjustable_belt_stack_size) to be `true`.

attributes.name: loader_container
attributes.description: The container entity this loader is pointing at/pulling from depending on the [LuaEntity::loader_type](runtime:LuaEntity::loader_type), if any.

attributes.name: loader_filter_mode
attributes.description: The filter mode for this loader. `nil` if this loader does not support filters.

attributes.name: loader_type
attributes.description: Whether this loader gets items from or puts item into a container.

attributes.name: localised_name
attributes.description: Localised name of the entity.

attributes.name: logistic_cell
attributes.description: The logistic cell this entity is a part of. Will be `nil` if this entity is not a part of any logistic cell.

attributes.name: logistic_network
attributes.description: The logistic network this entity is a part of, or `nil` if this entity is not a part of any logistic network.

attributes.name: max_health
attributes.description: Max health of this entity.

attributes.name: minable
attributes.description:
Not minable entities can still be destroyed.

Tells if entity reports as being minable right now. This takes into account minable_flag and entity specific conditions (for example rail under rolling stocks is not minable, vehicle with passenger is not minable).

Write to this field since 2.0.26 is deprecated and it will result in write to minable_flag instead.

attributes.name: minable_flag
attributes.description: Script controlled flag that allows entity to be mined.

attributes.name: mining_drill_filter_mode
attributes.description: The filter mode for this mining drill. `nil` if this mining drill doesn't have filters.

attributes.name: mining_progress
attributes.description: The mining progress for this mining drill. Is a number in range [0, mining_target.prototype.mineable_properties.mining_time]. `nil` if this isn't a mining drill.

attributes.name: mining_target
attributes.description: The mining target, if any.

attributes.name: mirroring
attributes.description: If the entity is currently mirrored. This state is referred to as `flipped` elsewhere, such as on the [on_player_flipped_entity](runtime:on_player_flipped_entity) event.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the entity prototype. E.g. "inserter" or "fast-inserter".

attributes.name: name_tag
attributes.description: Name tag of this entity. Returns `nil` if entity has no name tag. When name tag is already used by other entity, the name will be removed from the other entity. Entity name tags can also be set in the entity "extra settings" GUI in the map editor.

attributes.name: neighbour_bonus
attributes.description: The current total neighbour bonus of this reactor.

attributes.name: neighbours
attributes.description: A list of neighbours for certain types of entities. Applies to underground belts, walls, gates, reactors, cliffs, and pipe-connectable entities.
lists:
Differs depending on the type of entity:

- When called on a pipe-connectable entity, this is an array of entity arrays of all entities a given fluidbox is connected to.
- When called on an underground transport belt, this is the other end of the underground belt connection, or `nil` if none.
- When called on a wall-connectable entity or reactor, this is a dictionary of all connections indexed by the connection direction "north", "south", "east", and "west".
- When called on a cliff entity, this is a dictionary of all connections indexed by the connection direction "north", "south", "east", and "west".

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: operable
attributes.description: Player can't open gui of this entity and he can't quick insert/input stuff in to the entity when it is not operable.

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description: The smooth orientation of this entity.

attributes.name: pickup_position
attributes.description:
Where the inserter will pick up items from.

Inserters must have `allow_custom_vectors` set to true on their prototype to allow changing the pickup position.

attributes.name: pickup_target
attributes.description: The entity this inserter will attempt to pick up items from. If there are multiple possible entities at the pick-up point, writing to this attribute allows a mod to choose which one to pick up items from. The entity needs to collide with the tile box under the pick-up position. `nil` if there is no entity to pull items from.

attributes.name: player
attributes.description: The player connected to this character, if any.

attributes.name: pollution_bonus
attributes.description: The pollution bonus of this entity.

attributes.name: power_production
attributes.description: The power production specific to the ElectricEnergyInterface entity type.

attributes.name: power_switch_state
attributes.description: The state of this power switch.

attributes.name: power_usage
attributes.description: The power usage specific to the ElectricEnergyInterface entity type.

attributes.name: previous_recipe
attributes.description: The previous recipe this furnace was using, if any.

attributes.name: procession_tick
attributes.description: how far into the current procession the cargo pod is.

attributes.name: productivity_bonus
attributes.description:
The productivity bonus of this entity.

This includes force based bonuses as well as beacon/module bonuses.

attributes.name: products_finished
attributes.description: The number of products this machine finished crafting in its lifetime.

attributes.name: prototype
attributes.description: The entity prototype of this entity.

attributes.name: proxy_target
attributes.description: The target entity for this item-request-proxy, if any.

attributes.name: proxy_target_entity
attributes.description: Entity of which inventory is exposed by this ProxyContainer

attributes.name: proxy_target_inventory
attributes.description: Inventory index of the inventory that is exposed by this ProxyContainer

attributes.name: pump_rail_target
attributes.description: The rail target of this pump, if any.

attributes.name: quality
attributes.description:
The quality of this entity.

Not all entities support quality and will give the "normal" quality back if they don't.

attributes.name: radar_scan_progress
attributes.description: The current radar scan progress, as a number in range `[0, 1]`.

attributes.name: rail_layer
attributes.description: Gets rail layer of a given signal

attributes.name: recipe_locked
attributes.description: When locked; the recipe in this assembling machine can't be changed by the player.

attributes.name: relative_turret_orientation
attributes.description:
The relative orientation of the vehicle turret, artillery turret, artillery wagon. `nil` if this entity isn't a vehicle with a vehicle turret or artillery turret/wagon.

Writing does nothing if the vehicle doesn't have a turret.

attributes.name: removal_plan
attributes.description: The removal plan for this item request proxy.

attributes.name: remove_unfiltered_items
attributes.description: Whether items not included in this infinity container filters should be removed from the container.

attributes.name: render_player
attributes.description:
The player that this `simple-entity-with-owner`, `simple-entity-with-force`, or `highlight-box` is visible to. `nil` when this entity is rendered for all players.

Reading this property will return a [LuaPlayer](runtime:LuaPlayer), while [PlayerIdentification](runtime:PlayerIdentification) can be used when writing.

attributes.name: render_to_forces
attributes.description:
The forces that this `simple-entity-with-owner` or `simple-entity-with-force` is visible to. `nil` or an empty array when this entity is rendered for all forces.

Reading will always give an array of [LuaForce](runtime:LuaForce)

attributes.name: request_from_buffers
attributes.description:
Whether this requester chest is set to also request from buffer chests.

Useable only on entities that have requester slots.

attributes.name: result_quality
attributes.description:
The quality produced when this crafting machine finishes crafting. `nil` when crafting is not in progress.

Note: Writing `nil` is not allowed.

attributes.name: robot_order_queue
attributes.description: Get the current queue of robot orders.

attributes.name: rocket
attributes.description: The rocket silo rocket this cargo pod is attached to, or rocket silo rocket attached to this rocket silo - if any.

attributes.name: rocket_parts
attributes.description: Number of rocket parts in the silo.

attributes.name: rocket_silo_status
attributes.description: The status of this rocket silo entity.

attributes.name: rotatable
attributes.description:
When entity is not to be rotatable (inserter, transport belt etc), it can't be rotated by player using the R key.

Entities that are not rotatable naturally (like chest or furnace) can't be set to be rotatable.

attributes.name: secondary_bounding_box
attributes.description: The secondary bounding box of this entity or `nil` if it doesn't have one. This only exists for curved rails, and is automatically determined by the game.

attributes.name: secondary_selection_box
attributes.description: The secondary selection box of this entity or `nil` if it doesn't have one. This only exists for curved rails, and is automatically determined by the game.

attributes.name: selected_gun_index
attributes.description: Index of the currently selected weapon slot of this character, car, or spidertron. `nil` if this entity doesn't have guns.

attributes.name: selection_box
attributes.description: [LuaEntityPrototype::selection_box](runtime:LuaEntityPrototype::selection_box) around entity's given position and respecting the current entity orientation.

attributes.name: shooting_target
attributes.description: The shooting target for this turret, if any. Can't be set to `nil` via script.

attributes.name: signal_state
attributes.description: The state of this rail signal.

attributes.name: speed
attributes.description:
The current speed if this is a car, rolling stock, projectile or spidertron, or the maximum speed if this is a unit. The speed is in tiles per tick. `nil` if this is not a car, rolling stock, unit, projectile or spidertron.

Only the speed of units, cars, and projectiles are writable.

attributes.name: speed_bonus
attributes.description:
The speed bonus of this entity.

This includes force based bonuses as well as beacon/module bonuses.

attributes.name: splitter_filter
attributes.description: The filter for this splitter, if any is set.

attributes.name: splitter_input_priority
attributes.description: The input priority for this splitter.

attributes.name: splitter_output_priority
attributes.description: The output priority for this splitter.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description:
The status of this entity, if any.

This is always the actual status of the entity, even if [LuaEntity::custom_status](runtime:LuaEntity::custom_status) is set.

attributes.name: sticked_to
attributes.description: The entity this sticker is sticked to.

attributes.name: sticker_vehicle_modifiers
attributes.description: The vehicle modifiers applied to this entity through the attached stickers.

attributes.name: stickers
attributes.description: The sticker entities attached to this entity, if any.

attributes.name: storage_filter
attributes.description:
The storage filter for this logistic storage container.

Useable only on logistic containers with the `"storage"` [logistic_mode](runtime:LuaEntityPrototype::logistic_mode).

attributes.name: supports_direction
attributes.description: Whether the entity has direction. When it is false for this entity, it will always return north direction when asked for.

attributes.name: tags
attributes.description: The tags associated with this entity ghost. `nil` if this is not an entity ghost or when the ghost has no tags.

attributes.name: temperature
attributes.description: The temperature of this entity's heat energy source. `nil` if this entity does not use a heat energy source.

attributes.name: tick_grown
attributes.description: The tick when this plant is fully grown.

attributes.name: tick_of_last_attack
attributes.description: The last tick this character entity was attacked.

attributes.name: tick_of_last_damage
attributes.description: The last tick this character entity was damaged.

attributes.name: tile_height
attributes.description: Specifies the tiling size of the entity, is used to decide, if the center should be in the center of the tile (odd tile size dimension) or on the tile border (even tile size dimension). Uses the current direction of the entity.

attributes.name: tile_width
attributes.description: Specifies the tiling size of the entity, is used to decide, if the center should be in the center of the tile (odd tile size dimension) or on the tile border (even tile size dimension). Uses the current direction of the entity.

attributes.name: time_to_live
attributes.description: The ticks left before a combat robot, highlight box, smoke, or sticker entity is destroyed.

attributes.name: time_to_next_effect
attributes.description: The ticks until the next trigger effect of this smoke-with-trigger.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The timeout that's left on this landmine in ticks. It describes the time between the landmine being placed and it being armed.

attributes.name: to_be_looted
attributes.description: Will this item entity be picked up automatically when the player walks over it?

attributes.name: torso_orientation
attributes.description: The torso orientation of this spider vehicle.

attributes.name: train
attributes.description: The train this rolling stock belongs to, if any. `nil` if this is not a rolling stock.

attributes.name: train_stop_priority
attributes.description: Priority of this train stop.

attributes.name: trains_count
attributes.description:
Amount of trains related to this particular train stop. Includes train stopped at this train stop (until it finds a path to next target) and trains having this train stop as goal or waypoint.

Train may be included multiple times when braking distance covers this train stop multiple times.

Value may be read even when train stop has no control behavior.

attributes.name: trains_in_block
attributes.description: The number of trains in this rail block for this rail entity.

attributes.name: trains_limit
attributes.description:
Amount of trains above which no new trains will be sent to this train stop. Writing nil will disable the limit (will set a maximum possible value).

When a train stop has a control behavior with wire connected and set_trains_limit enabled, this value will be overwritten by it.

attributes.name: tree_color_index
attributes.description: Index of the tree color.

attributes.name: tree_color_index_max
attributes.description: Maximum index of the tree colors.

attributes.name: tree_gray_stage_index
attributes.description: Index of the tree gray stage

attributes.name: tree_gray_stage_index_max
attributes.description: Maximum index of the tree gray stages.

attributes.name: tree_stage_index
attributes.description: Index of the tree stage.

attributes.name: tree_stage_index_max
attributes.description: Maximum index of the tree stages.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The entity prototype type of this entity.

attributes.name: unit_number
attributes.description:
A unique number identifying this entity for the lifetime of the save. These are allocated sequentially, and not re-used (until overflow).

Only entities inheriting from [EntityWithOwnerPrototype](prototype:EntityWithOwnerPrototype), as well as [ItemRequestProxyPrototype](prototype:ItemRequestProxyPrototype) and [EntityGhostPrototype](prototype:EntityGhostPrototype) are assigned a unit number. Returns `nil` otherwise.

attributes.name: units
attributes.description: The units associated with this spawner entity.

attributes.name: use_filters
attributes.description:
If set to 'true', this inserter will use filtering logic.

This has no effect if the prototype does not support filters.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: vehicle_automatic_targeting_parameters
attributes.description: Read when this spidertron auto-targets enemies

methods.name: get_crafting_speed
methods.description: The crafting speed of this crafting-machine.

methods.name: get_fluid_usage_per_tick
methods.description: The fluid usage of this generator prototype.

methods.name: get_inserter_extension_speed
methods.description: The extension speed of this inserter.

methods.name: get_inserter_rotation_speed
methods.description: The rotation speed of this inserter.

methods.name: get_inventory_size
methods.description: Gets the base size of the given inventory on this entity or `nil` if the given inventory doesn't exist.

methods.name: get_max_circuit_wire_distance
methods.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity. 0 if the entity doesn't support circuit wires.

methods.name: get_max_distance_of_nearby_sector_revealed
methods.description: The radius of the area constantly revealed by this radar, or cargo landing pad, in chunks.

methods.name: get_max_distance_of_sector_revealed
methods.description: The radius of the area this radar can chart, in chunks.

methods.name: get_max_energy
methods.description: The max energy for this flying robot prototype.

methods.name: get_max_energy_production
methods.description: The theoretical maximum energy production for this entity.

methods.name: get_max_energy_usage
methods.description: The theoretical maximum energy usage for this entity.

methods.name: get_max_health
methods.description: Max health of this entity. Will be `0` if this is not an entity with health.

methods.name: get_max_power_output
methods.description: The maximum power output of this burner generator or generator prototype.

methods.name: get_max_wire_distance
methods.description: The maximum wire distance for this entity. 0 if the entity doesn't support wires.

methods.name: get_pumping_speed
methods.description: The pumping speed of this offshore or normal pump.

methods.name: get_researching_speed
methods.description: The base researching speed of this lab prototype.

methods.name: get_supply_area_distance
methods.description: The supply area of this electric pole or beacon prototype.

methods.name: has_flag
methods.description: Test whether this entity prototype has a certain flag set.

parameters.name: flag
parameters.description: The flag to test.

return_values.description: `true` if this prototype has the given flag set.

attributes.name: absorptions_to_join_attack
attributes.description: A table of pollutions amounts that has to be absorbed by the unit's spawner before the unit will leave the spawner and attack the source of the pollution, indexed by the name of each absorbed pollution type.

attributes.name: active_energy_usage
attributes.description: The active energy usage of this rocket silo or combinator prototype.

attributes.name: additional_pastable_entities
attributes.description: Entities this entity can be pasted onto in addition to the normal allowed ones.

attributes.name: affected_by_tiles
attributes.description: Whether this unit prototype is affected by tile walking speed modifiers.

attributes.name: air_resistance

attributes.name: is_building
lists:
These are the objects that are considered buildings:

- AccumulatorPrototype
- ArtilleryTurretPrototype
- BeaconPrototype
- BoilerPrototype
- BurnerGeneratorPrototype
- CombinatorPrototype → ArithmeticCombinator, DeciderCombinator
- ConstantCombinatorPrototype
- ContainerPrototype → LogisticContainer, InfinityContainer
- CraftingMachinePrototype → AssemblingMachine, RocketSilo, Furnace
- ElectricEnergyInterfacePrototype
- ElectricPolePrototype
- EnemySpawnerPrototype
- GatePrototype
- GeneratorPrototype
- HeatInterfacePrototype
- HeatPipePrototype
- InserterPrototype
- LabPrototype
- LampPrototype
- LinkedContainerPrototype
- MarketPrototype
- MiningDrillPrototype
- OffshorePumpPrototype
- PipePrototype → InfinityPipe
- PipeToGroundPrototype
- PowerSwitchPrototype
- ProgrammableSpeakerPrototype
- PumpPrototype
- RadarPrototype
- RailPrototype → CurvedRail, StraightRail
- RailSignalBasePrototype → RailChainSignal, RailSignal
- ReactorPrototype
- RoboportPrototype
- SimpleEntityPrototype
- SimpleEntityWithOwnerPrototype → SimpleEntityWithForce
- SolarPanelPrototype
- StorageTankPrototype
- TrainStopPrototype
- TransportBeltConnectablePrototype → LinkedBelt, Loader1x1, Loader1x2, Splitter, TransportBelt, UndergroundBelt
- TurretPrototype → AmmoTurret, ElectricTurret, FluidTurret
- WallPrototype

classes.name: LuaEquipmentGrid
classes.description: An equipment grid is for example the inside of a power armor.

methods.name: can_move
methods.description: Check whether moving an equipment would succeed.

parameters.name: equipment
parameters.description: The equipment to move

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where to put it

methods.name: cancel_removal
methods.description: Cancels removal for the given equipment.

return_values.description: If the equipment removal was successfully cancelled.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clear all equipment from the grid, removing it without actually returning it.

parameters.name: by_player
parameters.description: If provided, the action is done 'as' this player and [on_player_removed_equipment](runtime:on_player_removed_equipment) is triggered.

methods.name: count
methods.description: Get the number of all or some equipment in this grid.

parameters.name: equipment
parameters.description: The equipment to count. If not specified, count all equipment.

methods.name: find
methods.description: Find equipment by name.

parameters.name: equipment
parameters.description: Prototype of the equipment to find.

parameters.name: search_ghosts
parameters.description: If ghosts inner equipment should be searched. Defaults to `false`

return_values.description: The first found equipment, or `nil` if equipment could not be found.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Find equipment in the Equipment Grid colliding with this position.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position

return_values.description: The found equipment, or `nil` if equipment occupying the given position could not be found.

methods.name: get_contents

classes.name: LuaFlowStatistics
classes.description:
Encapsulates statistic data for different parts of the game.

In the context of flow statistics, `input`, `output` and `storage` describe in which position of the associated GUI the values are shown. Input values are shown on the far left side, output values to the immediate right, and storage values (if present) to the far right.

- The item production GUI shows "consumption" on the right, thus `output` describes the item consumption numbers. The same goes for fluid consumption.

- The kills GUI shows "losses" on the right, so `output` describes how many of the force's entities were killed by enemies.

- The electric network GUI shows "power consumption" on the left side, so in this case `input` describes the power consumption numbers. In addition, electric networks are currently the only ones that utilize the `storage` part of their statistics, showing accumulator charges to the far right of the GUI.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Reset all the statistics data to 0.

methods.name: get_flow_count
methods.description:
Gets the flow count value for the given time frame. If `sample_index` is not provided, then the value returned is the average across the provided precision time period. These are the values shown in the bottom section of the statistics GUIs.

Use `sample_index` to access the data used to generate the statistics graphs. Each precision level contains 300 samples of data so at a precision of 1 minute, each sample contains data averaged across 60s / 300 = 0.2s = 12 ticks.

All return values are normalized to be per-tick for electric networks and per-minute for all other types.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The statistics category to read from. Valid choices are `"input"`, `"output"` and `"storage"`.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: If true, the count of items/fluids/entities is returned instead of the per-time-frame value.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The prototype ID.

parameters.name: precision_index
parameters.description: The precision to read.

parameters.name: sample_index
parameters.description: The sample index to read from within the precision range. If not provided, the entire precision range is read. Must be between 1 and 300 where 1 is the most recent sample and 300 is the oldest.

parameters.description: The prototype ID.

classes.name: LuaFluidBox
classes.description:
An array of fluid boxes of an entity. Entities may contain more than one fluid box, and some can change the number of fluid boxes -- for instance, an assembling machine will change its number of fluid boxes depending on its active recipe. See [Fluid](runtime:Fluid).

Do note that reading from a [LuaFluidBox](runtime:LuaFluidBox) creates a new table and writing will copy the given fields from the table into the engine's own fluid box structure. Therefore, the correct way to update a fluidbox of an entity is to read it first, modify the table, then write the modified table back. Directly accessing the returned table's attributes won't have the desired effect.
examples:
```
-- Double the temperature of the fluid in entity's first fluid box.
fluid = entity.fluidbox[1]
fluid.temperature = fluid.temperature * 2
entity.fluidbox[1] = fluid
```

methods.name: add_linked_connection
methods.description:
Registers a linked connection between this entity and other entity. Because entity may have multiple fluidboxes, each with multiple connections that could be linked, a unique value for this and other linked_connection_id may need to be given.

It may happen a linked connection is not established immediately due to crafting machines being possible to not have certain fluidboxes exposed at a given point in time, but once they appear (due to recipe changes that would use them) they will be linked. Linked connections are persisted as (this_entity, this_linked_connection_id, other_entity, other_linked_connection_id) so if a pipe connection definition's value of linked_connection_id changes existing connections may not restore correct connections.

Every fluidbox connection that was defined in prototypes as connection_type=="linked" may be linked to at most 1 other fluidbox. When trying to connect already used connection, previous connection will be removed.

Linked connections cannot go to the same entity even if they would be part of other fluidbox.

methods.name: flush
methods.description: Flushes all fluid from this fluidbox and its fluid system.

parameters.name: fluid
parameters.description: If provided, only this fluid is flushed.
