methods.name: is_pathfinder_busy
methods.description: Is pathfinder busy? When the pathfinder is busy, it won't accept any more pathfinding requests.

methods.name: is_quality_unlocked
methods.description: Is the specified quality unlocked for this force?

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: Name of the quality.

methods.name: is_space_location_unlocked
methods.description: Is the specified planet unlocked for this force?

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the planet.

methods.name: is_space_platforms_unlocked
methods.description: Are the space platforms unlocked? This basically just controls the availability of the space platforms button.

methods.name: kill_all_units
methods.description: Kill all units and flush the pathfinder.

methods.name: lock_quality
methods.description: Locks the quality to not be accessible to this force.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: Name of the quality.

methods.name: lock_space_location
methods.description: Locks the planet to not be accessible to this force.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the planet.

methods.name: lock_space_platforms
methods.description: Locks the space platforms, which disables the space platforms button

methods.name: play_sound
methods.description:
Play a sound for every player in this force.

The sound is not played if its location is not [charted](runtime:LuaForce::chart) for this force.

parameters.name: override_sound_type
parameters.description: The volume mixer to play the sound through. Defaults to the default mixer for the given sound type.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The sound to play.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where the sound should be played. If not given, it's played globally on each player's controller's surface.

parameters.name: volume_modifier
parameters.description: The volume of the sound to play. Must be between 0 and 1 inclusive.

methods.name: print
methods.description:
Print text to the chat console of all players on this force.

By default, messages that are identical to a message sent in the last 60 ticks are not printed again.

methods.name: rechart
methods.description: Force a rechart of the whole chart.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Which surface to rechart or all if not given.

methods.name: research_all_technologies
methods.description: Research all technologies.

parameters.name: include_disabled_prototypes
parameters.description: Whether technologies that are explicitly disabled in the prototype should also be researched. Defaults to `false`.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Reset everything. All technologies are set to not researched, all modifiers are set to default values.

methods.name: reset_evolution
methods.description: Resets evolution for this force to zero.

methods.name: reset_recipes
methods.description: Load the original version of all recipes from the prototypes.

methods.name: reset_technologies
methods.description: Load the original versions of technologies from prototypes. Preserves research state of technologies.

methods.name: reset_technology_effects
methods.description: Reapplies all possible research effects, including unlocked recipes. Any custom changes are lost. Preserves research state of technologies.

parameters.name: ammo
parameters.description: Ammo category

methods.name: set_cease_fire
methods.description: Add `other` force to this force's cease fire list. Forces on the cease fire list won't be targeted for attack.

methods.name: set_evolution_factor
methods.description: Sets the evolution factor of this force on the given surface.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Defaults to "nauvis".

methods.name: set_evolution_factor_by_killing_spawners
methods.description: Sets the spawner kill part of the evolution factor of this force on the given surface.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Defaults to "nauvis".

methods.name: set_evolution_factor_by_pollution
methods.description: Sets the pollution part of the evolution factor of this force on the given surface.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Defaults to "nauvis".

methods.name: set_evolution_factor_by_time
methods.description: Sets the time part of the evolution factor of this force on the given surface.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Defaults to "nauvis".

methods.name: set_friend
methods.description: Add `other` force to this force's friends list. Friends have unrestricted access to buildings and turrets won't fire at them.

parameters.name: ammo
parameters.description: Ammo category

methods.name: set_hand_crafting_disabled_for_recipe
methods.description: Sets if the given recipe can be hand-crafted. This is used to explicitly disable hand crafting a recipe - it won't allow hand-crafting otherwise not hand-craftable recipes.

methods.name: set_item_launched
methods.description: Sets the count of a given item launched in rockets.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The count to set

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The item to set

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The new position on the given surface.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Surface to set the spawn position for.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: Whether to hide the surface or not.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Surface to set hidden for.

parameters.name: turret
parameters.description: Turret prototype name

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The chunk position to unchart.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Surface to unchart on.

methods.name: unlock_quality
methods.description: Unlocks the quality to be accessible to this force.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: Name of the quality.

methods.name: unlock_space_location
methods.description: Unlocks the planet to be accessible to this force.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the planet.

methods.name: unlock_space_platforms
methods.description: Unlocks the space platforms, which enables the space platforms button

attributes.name: ai_controllable
attributes.description:
Enables some higher-level AI behaviour for this force. When set to `true`, biters belonging to this force will automatically expand into new territories, build new spawners, and form unit groups. By default, this value is `true` for the enemy force and `false` for all others.

Setting this to `false` does not turn off biters' AI. They will still move around and attack players who come close.

It is necessary for a force to be AI controllable in order to be able to create unit groups or build bases from scripts.

attributes.name: belt_stack_size_bonus
attributes.description: Belt stack size bonus.

attributes.name: bulk_inserter_capacity_bonus
attributes.description: Number of items that can be transferred by bulk inserters. When writing to this value, it must be >= 0 and <= 254.

attributes.name: character_inventory_slots_bonus
attributes.description: The number of additional inventory slots the character main inventory has.

attributes.name: character_logistic_requests
attributes.description: `true` if character requester logistics is enabled.

attributes.name: character_running_speed_modifier
attributes.description: Modifies the running speed of all characters in this force by the given value as a percentage. Setting the running modifier to `0.5` makes the character run 50% faster. The minimum value of `-1` reduces the movement speed by 100%, resulting in a speed of `0`.

attributes.name: character_trash_slot_count
attributes.description: Number of character trash slots.

attributes.name: cliff_deconstruction_enabled
attributes.description: When true, cliffs will be marked for deconstruction when trying to force-build things that collide.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: Effective color of this force.

attributes.name: connected_players
attributes.description:
The connected players belonging to this force.

This is primarily useful when you want to do some action against all online players of this force.

This does *not* index using player index. See [LuaPlayer::index](runtime:LuaPlayer::index) on each player instance for the player index.

attributes.name: create_ghost_on_entity_death
attributes.description: When an entity dies, a ghost will be placed for automatic reconstruction.

attributes.name: current_research
attributes.description: The currently ongoing technology research, if any.

attributes.name: custom_color
attributes.description: Custom color for this force. If specified, will take priority over other sources of the force color. Writing `nil` clears custom color. Will return `nil` if it was not specified or if was set to `{0,0,0,0}`.

attributes.name: deconstruction_time_to_live
attributes.description: The time, in ticks, before a deconstruction order is removed.

attributes.name: following_robots_lifetime_modifier
attributes.description: Additional lifetime for following robots.

attributes.name: friendly_fire
attributes.description: If friendly fire is enabled for this force.

attributes.name: index
attributes.description: This force's index in [LuaGameScript::forces](runtime:LuaGameScript::forces) (unique ID). It is assigned when a force is created, and remains so until it is [merged](runtime:on_forces_merged) (ie. deleted). Indexes of merged forces can be reused.

attributes.name: inserter_stack_size_bonus
attributes.description: The inserter stack size bonus for non stack inserters

attributes.name: items_launched
attributes.description: All of the items that have been launched in rockets.

attributes.name: logistic_networks
attributes.description: List of logistic networks, grouped by surface.

attributes.name: manual_crafting_speed_modifier
attributes.description: Multiplier of the manual crafting speed. Default value is `0`. The actual crafting speed will be multiplied by `1 + manual_crafting_speed_modifier`.
examples:
```
-- Double the player's crafting speed
game.player.force.manual_crafting_speed_modifier = 1
```

attributes.name: manual_mining_speed_modifier
attributes.description: Multiplier of the manual mining speed. Default value is `0`. The actual mining speed will be multiplied by `1 + manual_mining_speed_modifier`.
examples:
```
-- Double the player's mining speed
game.player.force.manual_mining_speed_modifier = 1
```

attributes.name: maximum_following_robot_count
attributes.description: Maximum number of follower robots.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the force.
examples:
```
game.player.print(game.player.force.name) -- => "player"
```

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: platforms
attributes.description:
The space platforms that belong to this force mapped by their index value.

This will include platforms that are pending deletion.

attributes.name: players
attributes.description: Players belonging to this force.

attributes.name: previous_research
attributes.description: The previous research, if any.

attributes.name: recipes
attributes.description: Recipes available to this force, indexed by `name`.
examples:
```
-- Prints the category of the given recipe
game.player.print(game.player.force.recipes["transport-belt"].category)
```

attributes.name: research_enabled
attributes.description: Whether research is enabled for this force, see [LuaForce::enable_research](runtime:LuaForce::enable_research) and [LuaForce::disable_research](runtime:LuaForce::disable_research).

attributes.name: research_progress
attributes.description: Progress of current research, as a number in range `[0, 1]`.

attributes.name: research_queue
attributes.description:
The research queue of this force. The first technology in the array is the currently active one. Reading this attribute gives an array of [LuaTechnology](runtime:LuaTechnology).

To write to this, the entire table must be written. Providing an empty table or `nil` will empty the research queue and cancel the current research.  Writing to this when the research queue is disabled will simply set the last research in the table as the current research.

This only allows mods to queue research that this force is able to research in the first place. As an example, an already researched technology or one whose prerequisites are not fulfilled will not be queued, but dropped silently instead.

attributes.name: rockets_launched
attributes.description: The number of rockets launched.

attributes.name: share_chart
attributes.description: If sharing chart data is enabled for this force.

attributes.name: technologies
attributes.description: Technologies owned by this force, indexed by `name`.
examples:
```
-- Researches the technology for the player's force
game.player.force.technologies["steel-processing"].researched = true
```

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: vehicle_logistics
attributes.description: When true, cars/tanks that support logistics will be able to use them.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: circuit_read_contents
attributes.description: `true` if the furnace reads its ingredients contents, product contents and materials in crafting.

attributes.name: circuit_read_ingredients
attributes.description: `true` if the furnace outputs ingredients of current recipe as a signals to circuit network.

attributes.name: circuit_read_recipe_finished
attributes.description: `true` if the the furnace sends a signal when the recipe finishes.

attributes.name: circuit_read_working
attributes.description: `true` if the the furnace sends a signal when it is working.

attributes.name: circuit_recipe_finished_signal
attributes.description: The signal sent when the furnace finishes a recipe.

attributes.name: circuit_working_signal
attributes.description: The signal sent when the furnace is working.

attributes.name: include_fuel
attributes.description: `true` if the read contents should include fuel (content of energy source)

attributes.name: include_in_crafting
attributes.description: `true` if the read contents should include items in crafting.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

classes.name: LuaGameScript
classes.description: Main toplevel type, provides access to most of the API though its members. An instance of LuaGameScript is available as the global object named `game`.

methods.name: auto_save
methods.description:
Instruct the game to perform an auto-save.

Only the server will save in multiplayer. In single player a standard auto-save is triggered.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The autosave name if any. Saves will be named _autosave-*name* when provided.

methods.name: ban_player
methods.description: Bans the given player from this multiplayer game. Does nothing if this is a single player game of if the player running this isn't an admin.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to ban.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: The reason given if any.

methods.name: check_consistency
methods.description:
Run internal consistency checks. Allegedly prints any errors it finds.

Exists mainly for debugging reasons.

methods.name: create_force
methods.description:
Create a new force.

The game currently supports a maximum of 64 forces, including the three built-in forces. This means that a maximum of 61 new forces may be created. Force names must be unique.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Name of the new force

return_values.description: The force that was just created

methods.name: create_inventory
methods.description:
Creates an inventory that is not owned by any game object.

It can be resized later with [LuaInventory::resize](runtime:LuaInventory::resize).

Make sure to destroy it when you are done with it using [LuaInventory::destroy](runtime:LuaInventory::destroy).

parameters.name: gui_title
parameters.description: The title of the GUI that is shown when this inventory is opened.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The number of slots the inventory initially has.

methods.name: create_profiler
methods.description:
Creates a [LuaProfiler](runtime:LuaProfiler), which is used for measuring script performance.

LuaProfiler cannot be serialized.

parameters.name: stopped
parameters.description: Create the timer stopped

methods.name: create_random_generator
methods.description:
Creates a deterministic standalone random generator with the given seed or if a seed is not provided the initial map seed is used.

*Make sure* you actually want to use this over math.random(...) as this provides entirely different functionality over math.random(...).

methods.name: create_surface
methods.description:
Create a new surface.

The game currently supports a maximum of 4 294 967 295 surfaces, including the default surface. Surface names must be unique.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the new surface.

parameters.name: settings
parameters.description: Map generation settings.

return_values.description: The surface that was just created.

methods.name: delete_surface
methods.description: Deletes the given surface and all entities on it if possible.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: The surface to be deleted. Currently the primary surface (1, 'nauvis') cannot be deleted.

return_values.description: If the surface was queued to be deleted.

methods.name: disable_replay
methods.description: Disables replay saving for the current save file. Once done there's no way to re-enable replay saving for the save file without loading an old save.

methods.name: force_crc
methods.description: Force a CRC check. Tells all peers to calculate their current CRC, which are then compared to each other. If a mismatch is detected, the game desyncs and some peers are forced to reconnect.

methods.name: get_entity_by_tag
methods.description: Gets an entity by its [name tag](runtime:LuaEntity::name_tag). Entity name tags can also be set in the entity "extra settings" GUI in the map editor.

methods.name: get_entity_by_unit_number
methods.description: Returns entity with a specified unit number or nil if entity with such number was not found or prototype does not have [EntityPrototypeFlags::get-by-unit-number](prototype:EntityPrototypeFlags::get_by_unit_number) flag set.

methods.name: get_map_exchange_string
methods.description: Gets the map exchange string for the map generation settings that were used to create this map.

methods.name: get_player
methods.description: Gets the given player or returns `nil` if no player is found.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player index or name.

methods.name: get_pollution_statistics
methods.description: The pollution statistics for this the given surface.

methods.name: get_script_inventories
methods.description:
Gets the inventories created through [LuaGameScript::create_inventory](runtime:LuaGameScript::create_inventory).

Inventories created through console commands will be owned by `"core"`.

parameters.name: mod
parameters.description: The mod whose inventories to get. If not provided all inventories are returned.

return_values.description: A mapping of mod name to array of inventories owned by that mod.

methods.name: get_surface
methods.description:
Gets the given surface or returns `nil` if no surface is found.

This is a shortcut for [LuaGameScript::surfaces](runtime:LuaGameScript::surfaces).

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: The surface index or name.

methods.name: get_vehicles
methods.description: Returns vehicles in game

methods.name: is_demo
methods.description: Is this the demo version of Factorio?

methods.name: is_multiplayer
methods.description: Whether the save is loaded as a multiplayer map.

methods.name: kick_player
methods.description: Kicks the given player from this multiplayer game. Does nothing if this is a single player game or if the player running this isn't an admin.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to kick.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: The reason given if any.

methods.name: merge_forces
methods.description:
Marks two forces to be merged together. All players and entities in the source force will be reassigned to the target force. The source force will then be destroyed. Importantly, this does not merge technologies or bonuses, which are instead retained from the target force.

The three built-in forces (player, enemy and neutral) can't be destroyed, meaning they can't be used as the source argument to this function.

The source force is not removed until the end of the current tick, or if called during the [on_forces_merging](runtime:on_forces_merging) or [on_forces_merged](runtime:on_forces_merged) event, the end of the next tick.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The force to reassign all entities to.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The force to remove.

methods.name: mute_player
methods.description: Mutes the given player. Does nothing if the player running this isn't an admin.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to mute.

methods.name: play_sound
methods.description:
Play a sound for every player in the game.

The sound is not played if its location is not [charted](runtime:LuaForce::chart) for that player.

parameters.name: override_sound_type
parameters.description: The volume mixer to play the sound through. Defaults to the default mixer for the given sound type.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The sound to play.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where the sound should be played. If not given, it's played globally on each player's controller's surface.

parameters.name: volume_modifier
parameters.description: The volume of the sound to play. Must be between 0 and 1 inclusive.

methods.name: print
methods.description:
Print text to the chat console all players.

By default, messages that are identical to a message sent in the last 60 ticks are not printed again.

methods.name: purge_player
methods.description: Purges the given players messages from the game. Does nothing if the player running this isn't an admin.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to purge.

methods.name: regenerate_entity
methods.description:
Regenerate autoplacement of some entities on all surfaces. This can be used to autoplace newly-added entities.

All specified entity prototypes must be autoplacable.

parameters.name: entities
parameters.description: Prototype names of entity or entities to autoplace.

methods.name: reload_mods
methods.description:
Forces a reload of all mods.

This will act like saving and loading from the mod(s) perspective.

This will do nothing if run in multiplayer.

This disables the replay if replay is enabled.

methods.name: reload_script
methods.description:
Forces a reload of the scenario script from the original scenario location.

This disables the replay if replay is enabled.

methods.name: remove_offline_players
methods.description: Remove players who are currently not connected from the map.

parameters.name: players
parameters.description: List of players to remove. If not specified, remove all offline players.

methods.name: reset_game_state
methods.description: Reset scenario state (game_finished, player_won, etc.).

methods.name: reset_time_played
methods.description: Resets the amount of time played for this map.

methods.name: save_atlas
methods.description:
Saves the current configuration of Atlas to a file. This will result in huge file containing all of the game graphics moved to as small space as possible.

Exists mainly for debugging reasons.

methods.name: server_save
methods.description: Instruct the server to save the map. Only actually saves when in multiplayer.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Save file name. If not specified, the currently running save is overwritten. If there is no current save, no save is made.

methods.name: set_game_state
methods.description: Set scenario state. Any parameters not provided do not change the current state.

methods.name: set_lose_ending_info
methods.description: Set losing ending information for the current scenario.

methods.name: set_wait_for_screenshots_to_finish
methods.description: Forces the screenshot saving system to wait until all queued screenshots have been written to disk.

methods.name: set_win_ending_info
methods.description: Set winning ending information for the current scenario.

methods.name: show_message_dialog
methods.description:
Show an in-game message dialog.

Can only be used when the map contains exactly one player.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: Path to an image to show on the dialog

parameters.name: point_to
parameters.description: If specified, dialog will show an arrow pointing to this place. When not specified, the arrow will point to the player's position. (Use `point_to={type="nowhere"}` to remove the arrow entirely.) The dialog itself will be placed near the arrow's target.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: The gui style to use for this speech bubble. Must be of type speech_bubble.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: What the dialog should say

parameters.name: wrapper_frame_style
parameters.description: Must be of type flow_style.

methods.name: take_screenshot
methods.description:
Take a screenshot of the game and save it to the `script-output` folder, located in the game's [user data directory](https://wiki.factorio.com/User_data_directory). The name of the image file can be specified via the `path` parameter.

If Factorio is running headless, this function will do nothing.

parameters.name: allow_in_replay
parameters.description: Whether to save the screenshot even during replay playback. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: anti_alias
parameters.description: Whether to render in double resolution and downscale the result (including GUI). Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: by_player
parameters.description: If defined, the screenshot will only be taken for this player.

parameters.name: daytime
parameters.description: Overrides the current surface daytime for the duration of screenshot rendering.

parameters.name: force_render
parameters.description: Screenshot requests are processed in between game update and render. The game may skip rendering (ie. drop frames) if the previous frame has not finished rendering or the game simulation starts to fall below 60 updates per second. If `force_render` is set to `true`, the game won't drop frames and process the screenshot request at the end of the update in which the request was created. This is not honored on multiplayer clients that are catching up to server. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: hide_clouds
parameters.description: If `true` cloud shadows on ground won't be rendered. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: hide_fog
parameters.description: If `true` fog effect and foreground space dust effect won't be rendered. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The name of the image file. It should include a file extension indicating the desired format. Supports `.png`, `.jpg` /`.jpeg`, `.tga` and `.bmp`. Providing a directory path (ex. `"save/here/screenshot.png"`) will create the necessary folder structure in `script-output`. Defaults to `"screenshot.png"`.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to focus on. Defaults to the local player.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: If defined, the screenshot will be centered on this position. Otherwise, the screenshot will center on `player`.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: The `.jpg` render quality as a percentage (from 0% to 100% inclusive), if used. A lower value means a more compressed image. Defaults to `80`.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: The maximum allowed resolution is 16384x16384 (8192x8192 when `anti_alias` is `true`), but the maximum recommended resolution is 4096x4096 (resp. 2048x2048). The `x` value of the position is used as the width, the `y` value as the height.

parameters.name: show_cursor_building_preview
parameters.description: When `true` and when `player` is specified, the building preview for the item in the player's cursor will also be rendered. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: show_entity_info
parameters.description: Whether to include entity info ("Alt mode") or not. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: show_gui
parameters.description: Whether to include GUIs in the screenshot or not. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: If defined, the screenshot will be taken on this surface.

parameters.name: water_tick
parameters.description: Overrides the tick of water animation, if animated water is enabled.

parameters.name: zoom
parameters.description: The map zoom to take the screenshot at. Defaults to `1`.

methods.name: take_technology_screenshot
methods.description: Take a screenshot of the technology screen and save it to the `script-output` folder, located in the game's [user data directory](https://wiki.factorio.com/User_data_directory). The name of the image file can be specified via the `path` parameter.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The name of the image file. It should include a file extension indicating the desired format. Supports `.png`, `.jpg` /`.jpeg`, `.tga` and `.bmp`. Providing a directory path (ex. `"save/here/screenshot.png"`) will create the necessary folder structure in `script-output`. Defaults to `"technology-screenshot.png"`.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The screenshot will be taken for this player.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: The `.jpg` render quality as a percentage (from 0% to 100% inclusive), if used. A lower value means a more compressed image. Defaults to `80`.

parameters.name: selected_technology
parameters.description: The technology to highlight.

parameters.name: skip_disabled
parameters.description: If `true`, disabled technologies will be skipped. Their successors will be attached to the disabled technology's parents. Defaults to `false`.

methods.name: unban_player
methods.description: Unbans the given player from this multiplayer game. Does nothing if this is a single player game of if the player running this isn't an admin.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to unban.

methods.name: unmute_player
methods.description: Unmutes the given player. Does nothing if the player running this isn't an admin.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to unmute.

attributes.name: allow_tip_activation
attributes.description:
If the tips are allowed to be activated in this scenario, it is false by default.

Can't be modified in a simulation (menu screen, tips and tricks simulation, factoriopedia simulation etc.)

attributes.name: autosave_enabled
attributes.description: True by default. Can be used to disable autosaving. Make sure to turn it back on soon after.

attributes.name: backer_names
attributes.description: Array of the names of all the backers that supported the game development early on. These are used as names for labs, locomotives, radars, roboports, and train stops.

attributes.name: blueprints
attributes.description: Records contained in the "game blueprints" tab of the blueprint library.

attributes.name: connected_players
attributes.description:
The players that are currently online.

This does *not* index using player index. See [LuaPlayer::index](runtime:LuaPlayer::index) on each player instance for the player index. This is primarily useful when you want to do some action against all online players.

attributes.name: console_command_used
attributes.description: Whether a console command has been used.

attributes.name: default_map_gen_settings
attributes.description: The default map gen settings for this save.

attributes.name: difficulty
attributes.description: Current scenario difficulty.

attributes.name: difficulty_settings
attributes.description: The currently active set of difficulty settings. Even though this property is marked as read-only, the members of the dictionary that is returned can be modified mid-game.
examples:
```
-- This will set the technology price multiplier to 12.
game.difficulty_settings.technology_price_multiplier = 12
```

attributes.name: draw_resource_selection
attributes.description: True by default. Can be used to disable the highlighting of resource patches when they are hovered on the map.

attributes.name: enemy_has_vision_on_land_mines
attributes.description: Determines if enemy land mines are completely invisible or not.

attributes.name: finished
attributes.description: True while the victory screen is shown.

attributes.name: finished_but_continuing
attributes.description: True after players finished the game and clicked "continue".

attributes.name: forces
attributes.description: Get a table of all the forces that currently exist. This sparse table allows you to find forces by indexing it with either their `name` or `index`. Iterating this table with `pairs()` will provide the `name`s as the keys. Iterating with `ipairs()` will not work at all.

attributes.name: map_settings
attributes.description:
The currently active set of map settings. Even though this property is marked as read-only, the members of the dictionary that is returned can be modified mid-game.

This does not contain difficulty settings, use [LuaGameScript::difficulty_settings](runtime:LuaGameScript::difficulty_settings) instead.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: player
attributes.description:
This property is only populated inside [custom command](runtime:LuaCommandProcessor) handlers and when writing [Lua console commands](https://wiki.factorio.com/Console#Scripting_and_cheat_commands). Returns the player that is typing the command, `nil` in all other instances.

See [LuaGameScript::players](runtime:LuaGameScript::players) for accessing all players.

attributes.name: players
attributes.description:
Get a table of all the players that currently exist. This sparse table allows you to find players by indexing it with either their `name` or `index`. Iterating this table with `pairs()` will provide the `index`es as the keys. Iterating with `ipairs()` will not work at all.

If only a single player is required, [LuaGameScript::get_player](runtime:LuaGameScript::get_player) should be used instead, as it avoids the unnecessary overhead of passing the whole table to Lua.

attributes.name: simulation
attributes.description: Simulation-related functions, or `nil` if the current game is not a simulation.

attributes.name: speed
attributes.description: Speed to update the map at. 1.0 is normal speed -- 60 UPS. Minimum value is 0.01.

attributes.name: surfaces
attributes.description: Get a table of all the surfaces that currently exist. This sparse table allows you to find surfaces by indexing it with either their `name` or `index`. Iterating this table with `pairs()` will provide the `name`s as the keys. Iterating with `ipairs()` will not work at all.

attributes.name: technology_notifications_enabled
attributes.description: True by default. Can be used to prevent the game engine from printing certain messages.

attributes.name: tick
attributes.description: Current map tick.

attributes.name: tick_paused
attributes.description: If the tick has been paused. This means that entity update has been paused.

attributes.name: ticks_played
attributes.description:
The number of ticks since this game was created using either "new game" or "new game from scenario". Notably, this number progresses even when the game is [tick_paused](runtime:LuaGameScript::tick_paused).

This differs from [LuaGameScript::tick](runtime:LuaGameScript::tick) in that creating a game from a scenario always starts with this value at `0`, even if the scenario has its own level data where the `tick` has progressed past `0`.

attributes.name: ticks_to_run
attributes.description:
The number of ticks to be run while the tick is paused.

When [LuaGameScript::tick_paused](runtime:LuaGameScript::tick_paused) is true, ticks_to_run behaves the following way: While this is > 0, the entity update is running normally and this value is decremented every tick. When this reaches 0, the game will pause again.

classes.name: LuaGenericOnOffControlBehavior
classes.description: An abstract base class for behaviors that support switching the entity on or off based on some condition.

attributes.name: circuit_condition
attributes.description: The circuit condition. Writing `nil` clears the circuit condition.

attributes.name: circuit_enable_disable
attributes.description: `true` if this entity enable/disable state is controlled by circuit condition

attributes.name: connect_to_logistic_network
attributes.description: `true` if this should connect to the logistic network.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If the entity is currently disabled because of the control behavior.

attributes.name: logistic_condition
attributes.description: The logistic condition. Writing `nil` clears the logistic condition.

attributes.name: group
attributes.description: The parent group.

attributes.name: localised_name
attributes.description: Localised name of the group.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: The string used to alphabetically sort these prototypes. It is a simple string that has no additional semantic meaning.

attributes.name: order_in_recipe
attributes.description: The additional order value used in recipe ordering.

attributes.name: subgroups
attributes.description: Subgroups of this group.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

classes.name: LuaGui
classes.description:
The root of the GUI. This type houses the root elements, `top`, `left`, `center`,  `goal`, and `screen`, to which other elements can be added to be displayed on screen.

Every player can have a different GUI state.

attributes.name: center
attributes.description: The center part of the GUI. It is a flow element.

attributes.name: children
attributes.description: The children GUI elements mapped by name <> element.

attributes.name: goal
attributes.description: The flow used in the objectives window. It is a flow element. The objectives window is only visible when the flow is not empty or the objective text is set.

attributes.name: left
attributes.description: The left part of the GUI. It is a flow element inside a scroll pane element.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: player
attributes.description: The player who owns this gui.

attributes.name: relative
attributes.description: For showing a GUI somewhere relative to one of the game GUIs. It is an empty-widget element.

attributes.name: screen
attributes.description: For showing a GUI somewhere on the entire screen. It is an empty-widget element.

attributes.name: top
attributes.description: The top part of the GUI. It is a flow element inside a scroll pane element.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

classes.name: LuaGuiElement
classes.description:
An element of a custom GUI. This type is used to represent [any kind](runtime:GuiElementType) of a GUI element - labels, buttons and frames are all instances of this type. Just like [LuaEntity](runtime:LuaEntity), different kinds of elements support different attributes; attempting to access an attribute on an element that doesn't support it (for instance, trying to access the `column_count` of a `textfield`) will result in a runtime error.

For information on all supported GUI elements, see [GuiElementType](runtime:GuiElementType).

Each GUI element allows access to its children by having them as attributes. Thus, one can use the `parent.child` syntax to refer to children. Lua also supports the `parent["child"]` syntax to refer to the same element. This can be used in cases where the child has a name that isn't a valid Lua identifier.
examples:
```
-- This will add a label called "greeting" to the top flow.
-- Immediately after, it will change its text to illustrate accessing child elements.
game.player.gui.top.add{type="label", name="greeting", caption="Hi"}
game.player.gui.top.greeting.caption = "Hello there!"
game.player.gui.top["greeting"].caption = "Actually, never mind, I don't like your face"
```

methods.name: add
methods.description: Add a new child element to this GuiElement.

parameters.name: anchor
parameters.description: Where to position the child element when in the `relative` element.

parameters.name: caption
parameters.description: Text displayed on the child element. For frames, this is their title. For other elements, like buttons or labels, this is the content. Whilst this attribute may be used on all elements, it doesn't make sense for tables and flows as they won't display it.

parameters.name: elem_tooltip
parameters.description: Elem tooltip of the child element. Will be displayed above `tooltip`.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether the child element is enabled. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: game_controller_interaction
parameters.description: How the element should interact with game controllers. Defaults to [defines.game_controller_interaction.normal](runtime:defines.game_controller_interaction.normal).

parameters.name: ignored_by_interaction
parameters.description: Whether the child element is ignored by interaction. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Location in its parent that the child element should slot into. By default, the child will be appended onto the end.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the child element. It must be unique within the parent element.

parameters.name: raise_hover_events
parameters.description: Whether this element will raise [on_gui_hover](runtime:on_gui_hover) and [on_gui_leave](runtime:on_gui_leave). Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: The name of the style prototype to apply to the new element.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: [Tags](runtime:Tags) associated with the child element.

parameters.name: tooltip
parameters.description: Tooltip of the child element.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The kind of element to add, which potentially has its own attributes as listed below.

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: Whether the child element is visible. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: auto_toggle
parameters.description: Whether the button will automatically toggle when clicked. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: mouse_button_filter
parameters.description: Which mouse buttons the button responds to. Defaults to `"left-and-right"`.

parameters.name: toggled
parameters.description: The initial toggled state of the button. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position the camera centers on.

parameters.name: surface_index
parameters.description: The surface that the camera will render. Defaults to the player's current surface.

parameters.name: zoom
parameters.description: The initial camera zoom. Defaults to `0.75`.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The initial checked-state of the checkbox.

parameters.name: achievement
parameters.description: If type is `"achievement"` - the default value for the button.

parameters.name: decorative
parameters.description: If type is `"decorative"` - the default value for the button.

parameters.name: elem_filters
parameters.description: Filters describing what to show in the selection window. The applicable filter depends on the `elem_type`.

parameters.name: elem_type
parameters.description: The type of the button.

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: If type is `"entity"` - the default value for the button.

parameters.name: entity-with-quality
parameters.description: If type is `"entity-with-quality"` - the default value for the button.

parameters.name: equipment
parameters.description: If type is `"equipment"` - the default value for the button.

parameters.name: equipment-with-quality
parameters.description: If type is `"equipment-with-quality"` - the default value for the button.

parameters.name: fluid
parameters.description: If type is `"fluid"` - the default value for the button.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: If type is `"item"` - the default value for the button.

parameters.name: item-group
parameters.description: If type is `"item-group"` - the default value for the button.

parameters.name: item-with-quality
parameters.description: If type is `"item-with-quality"` - the default value for the button.

parameters.name: recipe
parameters.description: If type is `"recipe"` - the default value for the button.

parameters.name: recipe-with-quality
parameters.description: If type is `"recipe-with-quality"` - the default value for the button.

parameters.name: signal
parameters.description: If type is `"signal"` - the default value for the button.

parameters.name: technology
parameters.description: If type is `"technology"` - the default value for the button.

parameters.name: tile
parameters.description: If type is `"tile"` - the default value for the button.

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: The initial items in the dropdown.

parameters.name: selected_index
parameters.description: The index of the initially selected item. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The initial direction of the flow's layout. Defaults to `"horizontal"`.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The initial direction of the frame's layout. Defaults to `"horizontal"`.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The initial direction of the line. Defaults to `"horizontal"`.

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: The initial items in the listbox.

parameters.name: selected_index
parameters.description: The index of the initially selected item. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: chart_player_index
parameters.description: The player index the map should use. Defaults to the current player.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force this minimap should use. Defaults to the player's current force.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position the minimap centers on. Defaults to the player's current position.

parameters.name: surface_index
parameters.description: The surface the camera will render. Defaults to the player's current surface.

parameters.name: zoom
parameters.description: The initial camera zoom. Defaults to `0.75`.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The initial value of the progressbar, in the range `[0, 1]`. Defaults to `0`.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The initial checked-state of the radiobutton.

parameters.name: horizontal_scroll_policy
parameters.description: Policy of the horizontal scroll bar. Defaults to `"auto"`.

parameters.name: vertical_scroll_policy
parameters.description: Policy of the vertical scroll bar. Defaults to `"auto"`.

parameters.name: discrete_values
parameters.description: Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: maximum_value
parameters.description: The maximum value for the slider. Defaults to `30`.

parameters.name: minimum_value
parameters.description: The minimum value for the slider. Defaults to `0`.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The initial value for the slider. Defaults to `minimum_value`.

parameters.name: value_step
parameters.description: The minimum value the slider can move. Defaults to `1`.

parameters.name: resize_to_sprite
parameters.description: Whether the widget should resize according to the sprite in it. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: sprite
parameters.description: Path to the image to display.

parameters.name: auto_toggle
parameters.description: Whether the button will automatically toggle when clicked. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: clicked_sprite
parameters.description: Path to the image to display on the button when it is clicked.

parameters.name: hovered_sprite
parameters.description: Path to the image to display on the button when it is hovered.

parameters.name: mouse_button_filter
parameters.description: The mouse buttons that the button responds to. Defaults to `"left-and-right"`.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number shown on the button.

parameters.name: show_percent_for_small_numbers
parameters.description: Formats small numbers as percentages. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: sprite
parameters.description: Path to the image to display on the button.

parameters.name: toggled
parameters.description: The initial toggled state of the button. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: allow_none_state
parameters.description: Whether the switch can be set to a middle state. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: switch_state
parameters.description: If set to "none", `allow_none_state` must be `true`. Defaults to `"left"`.

parameters.name: badge_text
parameters.description: The text to display after the normal tab text (designed to work with numbers).

parameters.name: column_count
parameters.description: Number of columns. This can't be changed after the table is created.

parameters.name: draw_horizontal_line_after_headers
parameters.description: Whether the table should draw a single horizontal grid line after the headers. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: draw_horizontal_lines
parameters.description: Whether the table should draw horizontal grid lines. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: draw_vertical_lines
parameters.description: Whether the table should draw vertical grid lines. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: vertical_centering
parameters.description: Whether the content of the table should be vertically centered. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: icon_selector
parameters.description: Whether to add the rich text icon selector to the text box. This attribute can't be changed after creating the widget. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The initial text contained in the text-box.

parameters.name: allow_decimal
parameters.description: Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: allow_negative
parameters.description: Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: icon_selector
parameters.description: Whether to add the rich text icon selector to the text field. This attribute can't be changed after creating the widget. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: is_password
parameters.description: Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: lose_focus_on_confirm
parameters.description: Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: numeric
parameters.description: Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The initial text contained in the textfield.

methods.variant_parameter_description: Other attributes may be specified depending on `type`:

return_values.description: The GUI element that was added.

methods.name: add_item
methods.description: Inserts a string at the end or at the given index of this dropdown or listbox.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index at which to insert the item.

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: The text to insert.

methods.name: add_tab
methods.description: Adds the given tab and content widgets to this tabbed pane as a new tab.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The content to show when this tab is selected. Can be any type of GUI element.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: The tab to add, must be a GUI element of type "tab".

methods.name: bring_to_front
methods.description:
Moves this GUI element to the "front" so it will draw over other elements.

Only works for elements in [LuaGui::screen](runtime:LuaGui::screen).

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Remove children of this element. Any [LuaGuiElement](runtime:LuaGuiElement) objects referring to the destroyed elements become invalid after this operation.
examples:
```
game.player.gui.top.clear()
```

methods.name: clear_items
methods.description: Removes the items in this dropdown or listbox.

methods.name: close_dropdown
methods.description: Closes the dropdown list if this is a dropdown and it is open.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description:
Remove this element, along with its children. Any [LuaGuiElement](runtime:LuaGuiElement) objects referring to the destroyed elements become invalid after this operation.

The top-level GUI elements - [LuaGui::top](runtime:LuaGui::top), [LuaGui::left](runtime:LuaGui::left), [LuaGui::center](runtime:LuaGui::center) and [LuaGui::screen](runtime:LuaGui::screen) - can't be destroyed.
examples:
```
game.player.gui.top.greeting.destroy()
```

methods.name: focus
methods.description: Focuses this GUI element if possible.

methods.name: force_auto_center
methods.description: Forces this frame to re-auto-center. Only works on frames stored directly in [LuaGui::screen](runtime:LuaGui::screen).

methods.name: get_index_in_parent
methods.description:
Gets the index that this element has in its parent element.

This iterates through the children of the parent of this element, meaning this has a non-free cost to get, but is faster than doing the equivalent in Lua.

methods.name: get_item
methods.description: Gets the item at the given index from this dropdown or listbox.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to get

methods.name: get_mod
methods.description:
The mod that owns this Gui element or `nil` if it's owned by the scenario script.

This has a not-super-expensive, but non-free cost to get.

methods.name: get_slider_discrete_values
methods.description: Returns whether this slider only allows discrete values.

methods.name: get_slider_maximum
methods.description: Gets this sliders maximum value.

methods.name: get_slider_minimum
methods.description: Gets this sliders minimum value.

methods.name: get_slider_value_step
methods.description: Gets the minimum distance this slider can move.

methods.name: remove_item
methods.description: Removes the item at the given index from this dropdown or listbox.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index

methods.name: remove_tab
methods.description:
Removes the given tab and its associated content from this tabbed pane.

Removing a tab does not destroy the tab or the tab contents. It just removes them from the view.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: The tab to remove or `nil` to remove all tabs.

methods.name: scroll_to_bottom
methods.description: Scrolls this scroll bar to the bottom.

methods.name: scroll_to_element
methods.description: Scrolls this scroll bar such that the specified GUI element is visible to the player.

parameters.name: element
parameters.description: The element to scroll to.

parameters.name: scroll_mode
parameters.description: Where the element should be positioned in the scroll-pane. Defaults to `"in-view"`.

methods.name: scroll_to_item
methods.description: Scrolls the scroll bar such that the specified listbox item is visible to the player.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The item index to scroll to.

parameters.name: scroll_mode
parameters.description: Where the item should be positioned in the list-box. Defaults to `"in-view"`.

methods.name: scroll_to_left
methods.description: Scrolls this scroll bar to the left.

methods.name: scroll_to_right
methods.description: Scrolls this scroll bar to the right.

methods.name: scroll_to_top
methods.description: Scrolls this scroll bar to the top.

methods.name: select
methods.description: Selects a range of text in this textbox.
examples:
```
-- Select the characters "amp" from "example":
textbox.select(3, 5)
```

```
-- Move the cursor to the start of the text box:
textbox.select(1, 0)
```

parameters.name: end_index
parameters.description: The index of the last character to select

parameters.name: start_index
parameters.description: The index of the first character to select

methods.name: select_all
methods.description: Selects all the text in this textbox.

methods.name: set_item
methods.description: Sets the given string at the given index in this dropdown or listbox.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index whose text to replace.

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: The text to set at the given index.

methods.name: set_slider_discrete_values
methods.description: Sets whether this slider only allows discrete values.

methods.name: set_slider_minimum_maximum
methods.description: Sets this sliders minimum and maximum values. The minimum can't be >= the maximum.

methods.name: set_slider_value_step
methods.description: Sets the minimum distance this slider can move. The minimum distance can't be > (max - min).

methods.name: swap_children
methods.description: Swaps the children at the given indices in this element.

parameters.name: index_1
parameters.description: The index of the first child.

parameters.name: index_2
parameters.description: The index of the second child.

attributes.name: allow_decimal
attributes.description: Whether this textfield (when in numeric mode) allows decimal numbers.

attributes.name: allow_negative
attributes.description: Whether this textfield (when in numeric mode) allows negative numbers.

attributes.name: allow_none_state
attributes.description:
Whether the `"none"` state is allowed for this switch.

This can't be set to false if the current switch_state is 'none'.

attributes.name: anchor
attributes.description: The anchor for this relative widget, if any. Setting `nil` clears the anchor.

attributes.name: auto_center
attributes.description: Whether this frame auto-centers on window resize when stored in [LuaGui::screen](runtime:LuaGui::screen).

attributes.name: auto_toggle
attributes.description: Whether this button will automatically toggle when clicked.

attributes.name: badge_text
attributes.description: The text to display after the normal tab text (designed to work with numbers)

attributes.name: caption
attributes.description:
The text displayed on this element. For frames, this is the "heading". For other elements, like buttons or labels, this is the content.

Whilst this attribute may be used on all elements without producing an error, it doesn't make sense for tables and flows as they won't display it.

attributes.name: children
attributes.description: The child-elements of this GUI element.

attributes.name: children_names
attributes.description: Names of all the children of this element. These are the identifiers that can be used to access the child as an attribute of this element.

attributes.name: clicked_sprite
attributes.description: The sprite to display on this sprite-button when it is clicked.

attributes.name: column_count
attributes.description: The number of columns in this table.

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description: Direction of this element's layout.

attributes.name: drag_target
attributes.description:
The `frame` that is being moved when dragging this GUI element, if any. This element needs to be a child of the `drag_target` at some level.

Only top-level elements in [LuaGui::screen](runtime:LuaGui::screen) can be `drag_target`s.

attributes.name: draw_horizontal_line_after_headers
attributes.description: Whether this table should draw a horizontal grid line below the first table row.

attributes.name: draw_horizontal_lines
attributes.description: Whether this table should draw horizontal grid lines.

attributes.name: draw_vertical_lines
attributes.description: Whether this table should draw vertical grid lines.

attributes.name: elem_filters
attributes.description:
The elem filters of this choose-elem-button, if any. The compatible type of filter is determined by `elem_type`.

Writing to this field does not change or clear the currently selected element.
examples:
```
-- This will configure a choose-elem-button of type "entity" to only show items of type "furnace".
button.elem_filters = {{filter = "type", type = "furnace"}}
```

```
-- Then, there are some types of filters that work on a specific kind of attribute. The following will configure a
--   choose-elem-button of type "entity" to only show entities that have their "hidden" flags set.
button.elem_filters = {{filter = "hidden"}}
```

```
-- Lastly, these filters can be combined at will, taking care to specify how they should be combined (either "and" or "or").
--   The following will filter for any entities that are "furnaces" and that are not "hidden".
button.elem_filters = {{filter = "type", type = "furnace"}, {filter = "hidden", invert = true, mode = "and"}}
```

attributes.name: elem_tooltip

The `"with-quality"` types operate with [PrototypeWithQuality](runtime:PrototypeWithQuality).

The remaining types use strings.

It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: word_wrap

Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

classes.name: LuaHelpers
classes.description: Provides various helper and utility functions. It is accessible through the global object named `helpers`.

methods.name: check_prototype_translations
methods.description:
Goes over all items, entities, tiles, recipes, technologies among other things and logs if the locale is incorrect.

Also prints true/false if called from the console.

methods.name: create_profiler
methods.description:
Creates a [LuaProfiler](runtime:LuaProfiler), which is used for measuring script performance.

LuaProfiler cannot be serialized.

parameters.name: stopped
parameters.description: Create the timer stopped

methods.name: decode_string
methods.description: Base64 decodes and inflates the given string.

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: The string to decode.

return_values.description: The decoded string or `nil` if the decode failed.

methods.name: direction_to_string
methods.description: Converts the given direction into the string version of the direction.

methods.name: encode_string
methods.description: Deflates and base64 encodes the given string.

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: The string to encode.

return_values.description: The encoded string or `nil` if the encode failed.

methods.name: evaluate_expression
methods.description: Evaluate an expression, substituting variables as provided.
examples:
```
-- Calculate the number of research units required to unlock mining productivity level 10
local formula = game.forces["player"].technologies["mining-productivity-4"].research_unit_count_formula
local units = helpers.evaluate_expression(formula, { L = 10, l = 10 })
```

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The expression to evaluate.

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description: Variables to be substituted.

methods.name: is_valid_sound_path
methods.description: Checks if the given SoundPath is valid.

parameters.name: sound_path
parameters.description: Path to the sound.

methods.name: is_valid_sprite_path
methods.description: Checks if the given SpritePath is valid and contains a loaded sprite. The existence of the image is not checked for paths of type `file`.

parameters.name: sprite_path
parameters.description: Path to the image.

methods.name: json_to_table
methods.description: Convert a JSON string to a table.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: The string to convert.

return_values.description: The returned object, or `nil` if the JSON string was invalid.

methods.name: parse_map_exchange_string
methods.description: Convert a map exchange string to map gen settings and map settings.

methods.name: remove_path
methods.description: Remove a file or directory in the `script-output` folder, located in the game's [user data directory](https://wiki.factorio.com/User_data_directory). Can be used to remove files created by [LuaHelpers::write_file](runtime:LuaHelpers::write_file).

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to the file or directory to remove, relative to `script-output`.

methods.name: table_to_json
methods.description: Convert a table to a JSON string

methods.name: write_file
methods.description: Write a file to the `script-output` folder, located in the game's [user data directory](https://wiki.factorio.com/User_data_directory). The name and file extension of the file can be specified via the `filename` parameter.

parameters.name: append
parameters.description: If `true`, `data` will be appended to the end of the file. Defaults to `false`, which will overwrite any pre-existing file with the new `data`.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The content to write to the file.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: The name of the file. Providing a directory path (ex. `"save/here/example.txt"`) will create the necessary folder structure in `script-output`.

parameters.name: for_player
parameters.description: If given, the file will only be written for this `player_index`. Providing `0` will only write to the server's output if present.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: circuit_hand_read_mode
attributes.description: The hand read mode for the inserter.

attributes.description: `true` if the contents of the inserter hand should be sent to the circuit network

attributes.name: circuit_set_filters
attributes.description: `true` if filters are set from circuit network

attributes.name: circuit_set_stack_size
attributes.description: If the stack size of the inserter is set through the circuit network or not.

attributes.name: circuit_stack_control_signal
attributes.description: The signal used to set the stack size of the inserter.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

methods.name: can_insert
methods.description: Can at least some items be inserted?

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: Items that would be inserted.

return_values.description: `true` if at least a part of the given items could be inserted into this inventory.

methods.name: can_set_filter
methods.description: If the given inventory slot filter can be set to the given filter.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The item filter

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The item stack index

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Make this inventory empty.

methods.name: count_empty_stacks
methods.description: Counts the number of empty stacks.

parameters.name: include_bar
parameters.description: If true, slots blocked by the current bar will be included. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: include_filtered
parameters.description: If true, filtered slots will be included. Defaults to false.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description:
Destroys this inventory.

Only inventories created by [LuaGameScript::create_inventory](runtime:LuaGameScript::create_inventory) can be destroyed this way.

methods.name: find_empty_stack
methods.description: Finds the first empty stack. Filtered slots are excluded unless a filter item is given.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: If given, empty stacks that are filtered for this item will be included.

return_values.description: The first empty stack, or `nil` if there aren't any empty stacks.
The stack index of the matching stack, if any is found.

methods.name: find_item_stack
methods.description: Finds the first LuaItemStack in the inventory that matches the given item name.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The item to find

return_values.description: The first matching stack, or `nil` if none match.
The stack index of the matching stack, if any is found.

methods.name: get_bar
methods.description:
Get the current bar. This is the index at which the red area starts.

Only useable if this inventory supports having a bar.

methods.name: get_contents
methods.description: Get counts of all items in this inventory.

return_values.description: List of all items in the inventory.

methods.name: get_filter
methods.description: Gets the filter for the given item stack index.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The item stack index

return_values.description: The current filter or `nil` if none.

methods.name: get_insertable_count
methods.description:
Gets the number of the given item that can be inserted into this inventory.

This is a "best guess" number; things like assembling machine filtered slots, module slots, items with durability, and items with mixed health will cause the result to be inaccurate. The main use for this is in checking how many of a basic item can fit into a basic inventory.

This accounts for the 'bar' on the inventory.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The item to check.

methods.name: get_item_count
methods.description: Get the number of all or some items in this inventory.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The item to count. If not specified, count all items.

methods.name: insert
methods.description: Insert items into this inventory.

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: Items to insert.

return_values.description: Number of items actually inserted.

methods.name: is_empty
methods.description: Does this inventory contain nothing?

methods.name: is_filtered
methods.description: If this inventory supports filters and has at least 1 filter set.

methods.name: is_full
methods.description: Is every stack in this inventory full? Ignores stacks blocked by the current bar.

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Remove items from this inventory.

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: Items to remove.

return_values.description: Number of items actually removed.

methods.name: resize
methods.description:
Resizes the inventory.

Items in slots beyond the new capacity are deleted.

Only inventories created by [LuaGameScript::create_inventory](runtime:LuaGameScript::create_inventory) can be resized.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: New size of a inventory

methods.name: set_bar
methods.description:
Set the current bar.

Only useable if this inventory supports having a bar.

parameters.name: bar
parameters.description: The new limit. Omitting this parameter will clear the limit.

methods.name: set_filter
methods.description:
Sets the filter for the given item stack index.

Some inventory slots don't allow some filters (gun ammo can't be filtered for non-ammo).

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The new filter. `nil` erases any existing filter.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The item stack index.

return_values.description: If the filter was allowed to be set.

methods.name: sort_and_merge
methods.description: Sorts and merges the items in this inventory.

methods.name: supports_bar
methods.description:
Does this inventory support a bar? Bar is the draggable red thing, found for example on chests, that limits the portion of the inventory that may be manipulated by machines.

"Supporting a bar" doesn't mean that the bar is set to some nontrivial value. Supporting a bar means the inventory supports having this limit at all. The character's inventory is an example of an inventory without a bar; the wooden chest's inventory is an example of one with a bar.

methods.name: supports_filters
methods.description: If this inventory supports filters.

attributes.name: entity_owner

attributes.description: The inventory index this inventory uses, if any.

attributes.name: mod_owner
attributes.description: The mod that owns this inventory, if any.

attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: player_owner
attributes.description: The player that owns this inventory, if any.

attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

operators.name: index
examples:
```
-- Will get the first item in the player's inventory.
game.player.get_main_inventory()[1]
```

examples:
```
-- Will print the number of slots in the player's main inventory.
game.player.print(#game.player.get_main_inventory())
```

methods.name: build_blueprint
methods.description:
Build this blueprint at the given location.

Built entities can be come invalid between the building of the blueprint and the function returning if by_player or raise_built is used and one of those events invalidates the entity.

parameters.name: build_mode
parameters.description: If `normal`, blueprint will not be built if any one thing can't be built. If `forced`, anything that can be built is built and obstructing nature entities will be deconstructed. If `superforced`, all obstructions will be deconstructed and the blueprint will be built.

parameters.name: by_player
parameters.description: The player to use if any. If provided [defines.events.on_built_entity](runtime:defines.events.on_built_entity) will also be fired on successful entity creation.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction to use when building

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force to use for the building

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position to build at

parameters.name: raise_built
parameters.description: If true; [defines.events.script_raised_built](runtime:defines.events.script_raised_built) will be fired on successful entity creation. Note: this is ignored if by_player is provided.

parameters.name: skip_fog_of_war
parameters.description: If chunks covered by fog-of-war are skipped.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Surface to build on

return_values.description: Array of created ghosts

methods.name: set_mapper
methods.description:
Sets the module filter at the given index for this upgrade item.

In contrast to [LuaItemCommon::get_mapper](runtime:LuaItemCommon::get_mapper), indices past the upgrade item's current size are valid and expand the list of mappings accordingly, if within reasonable bounds.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the mapper to set.

parameters.name: mapper
parameters.description: The mapper to set or `nil`

methods.name: set_tag
methods.description: Sets the tag with the given name and value.

methods.name: set_tile_filter
methods.description: Sets the tile filter at the given index for this deconstruction item.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Writing `nil` removes the filter.

return_values.description: Whether the new filter was successfully set (meaning it was valid).

attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.
