classes.name: LuaItemStack
classes.description:
A reference to an item and count owned by some external entity.

In most instances this is a simple reference as in: it points at a specific slot in an inventory and not the item in the slot.

In the instance this references an item on a [LuaTransportLine](runtime:LuaTransportLine) the reference is only guaranteed to stay valid (and refer to the same item) as long as nothing changes the transport line.

methods.name: add_ammo
methods.description: Add ammo to this ammo item.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount of ammo to add.

methods.name: add_durability
methods.description: Add durability to this tool item.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount of durability to add.

methods.name: can_set_stack
methods.description: Would a call to [LuaItemStack::set_stack](runtime:LuaItemStack::set_stack) succeed?

parameters.name: stack
parameters.description: Stack that would be set, possibly `nil`.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clear this item stack.

methods.description: Creates the equipment grid for this item if it doesn't exist and this is an item-with-entity-data that supports equipment grids.

return_values.description: The exported string

methods.name: import_stack
methods.description: Import a supported item (blueprint, blueprint-book, deconstruction-planner, upgrade-planner, item-with-tags) from a string.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The string to import

return_values.description: 0 if the import succeeded with no errors. -1 if the import succeeded with errors. 1 if the import failed.

methods.name: set_stack
methods.description: Set this item stack to another item stack.

parameters.name: stack
parameters.description: Item stack to set it to. Omitting this parameter or passing `nil` will clear this item stack, as if [LuaItemStack::clear](runtime:LuaItemStack::clear) was called.

return_values.description: Whether the stack was set successfully. Returns `false` if this stack was not [valid for write](runtime:LuaItemStack::can_set_stack).

methods.name: spoil
methods.description: Spoils this item if the item can spoil.

methods.name: swap_stack
methods.description: Swaps this item stack with the given item stack if allowed.

return_values.description: Whether the 2 stacks were swapped successfully.

methods.name: transfer_stack
methods.description: Transfers the given item stack into this item stack.

return_values.description: `true` if the full stack was transferred.

classes.name: LuaLazyLoadedValue
classes.description:
A lazily loaded value. For performance reasons, we sometimes return a custom lazily-loaded value type instead of the native Lua value. This custom type lazily constructs the necessary value when [LuaLazyLoadedValue::get](runtime:LuaLazyLoadedValue::get) is called, therefore preventing its unnecessary construction in some cases.

An instance of LuaLazyLoadedValue is only valid during the event it was created from and cannot be saved.

classes.name: LuaLogisticNetwork
classes.description: A single logistic network of a given force on a given surface.

methods.name: can_satisfy_request
methods.description: Can the network satisfy a request for a given item and count.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Count to check. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: include_buffers
parameters.description: Should buffers be considered? Defaults to false.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: Item name to check.

return_values.description: Whether the network can satisfy the request.

methods.name: find_cell_closest_to
methods.description: Find logistic cell closest to a given position.

return_values.description: `nil` if no cell was found.

methods.name: get_contents
methods.description: Get item counts for the entire network, similar to how [LuaInventory::get_contents](runtime:LuaInventory::get_contents) does.

return_values.description: List of all items in the network.

methods.name: get_item_count
methods.description: Count given or all items in the network or given members.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: Item name to count. If not given, gives counts of all items in the network.

parameters.name: member
parameters.description: Logistic members to check. If not given, gives count in the entire network.

methods.name: get_supply_counts
methods.description: Get the amount of items of the given type indexed by the storage member.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: Item name to check.

methods.name: get_supply_points
methods.description: Gets the logistic points with of the given type indexed by the storage member.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: Item name to check.

methods.name: insert
methods.description: Insert items into the logistic network. This will actually insert the items into some logistic chests.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: What to insert.

parameters.name: members
parameters.description: Which logistic members to insert the items to. `"storage-empty"` inserts into storage chests that are completely empty, `"storage-empty-slot"` inserts into storage chests that have an empty slot. If not specified, inserts items into the logistic network in the usual order.

return_values.description: Number of items actually inserted.

methods.name: remove_item
methods.description: Remove items from the logistic network. This will actually remove the items from some logistic chests.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: What to remove.

parameters.name: members
parameters.description: Which logistic members to remove from. If not specified, removes from the network in the usual order.

return_values.description: Number of items removed.

methods.name: select_drop_point
methods.description: Find a logistic point to drop the specific item stack.

parameters.name: members
parameters.description: When given, it will find from only the specific type of member. If not specified, selects with normal priorities.

parameters.name: stack
parameters.description: Name of the item to drop off.

return_values.description: `nil` if no point was found.

methods.name: select_pickup_point
methods.description: Find the 'best' logistic point with this item ID and from the given position or from given chest type.

parameters.name: include_buffers
parameters.description: Whether to consider buffer chests or not. Defaults to false. Only considered if selecting with position.

parameters.name: members
parameters.description: When given, it will find from only the specific type of member. If not specified, selects with normal priorities. Not considered if position is specified.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the item to pick up.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: When given, it will find the storage 'best' storage point from this position.

return_values.description: `nil` if no point was found.

attributes.name: passive_provider_points
attributes.description: All passive provider points in this network.

attributes.name: provider_points
attributes.description: All things that have provider points in this network.

attributes.name: providers
attributes.description: All entities that have logistic provider points in this network.

attributes.name: requester_points
attributes.description: All things that have requester points in this network.

attributes.name: requesters
attributes.description: All entities that have logistic requester points in this network.

attributes.name: robot_limit
attributes.description: Maximum number of robots the network can work with. Currently only used for the personal roboport.

attributes.name: robots
attributes.description: All robots in this logistic network.

attributes.name: storage_points
attributes.description: All things that have storage points in this network.

attributes.name: storages
attributes.description: All entities that have logistic storage points in this network.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

classes.name: LuaLogisticPoint
classes.description: Logistic point of a particular [LuaEntity](runtime:LuaEntity). A "Logistic point" is the name given for settings and properties used by requester, provider, and storage points in a given logistic network. These "points" don't have to be a logistic container but often are. One other entity that can own several points is the "character" character type entity.

methods.name: add_section
methods.description: Adds a new logistic section to this logistic point if possible.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: The group to assign this section to.

return_values.description: The added logistic section.

methods.name: get_section
methods.description: Gets section on the selected index, if it exists

parameters.name: section_index
parameters.description: Index of the section

methods.name: remove_section
methods.description: Removes the given logistic section if possible. Removal may fail if the section index is out of range or the section is not [manual](runtime:LuaLogisticSection::is_manual).

parameters.name: section_index
parameters.description: Index of the section

return_values.description: Whether section was removed.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description:
Whether this logistic point is active, related to disabling logistics on player/spidertron.

When the logistic point is disabled it won't request and auto trash will do nothing.

attributes.name: exact
attributes.description: If this logistic point is using the exact mode. In exact mode robots never over-deliver requests.

attributes.name: filters
attributes.description:
The logistic filters for this logistic point, if this uses any.

The returned array will always have an entry for each filter and will be indexed in sequence when not `nil`.

attributes.name: force
attributes.description:
The force of this logistic point.

This will always be the same as the [LuaLogisticPoint::owner](runtime:LuaLogisticPoint::owner) force.

attributes.name: logistic_member_index
attributes.description: The Logistic member index of this logistic point.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The logistic mode.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: owner
attributes.description: The [LuaEntity](runtime:LuaEntity) owner of this LuaLogisticPoint.

attributes.name: sections
attributes.description: All logistic sections of this logistic point.

attributes.name: sections_count
attributes.description: Amount of logistic sections this logistic point has.

attributes.name: targeted_items_deliver
attributes.description: Items targeted to be dropped off into this logistic point by robots.

attributes.name: targeted_items_pickup
attributes.description: Items targeted to be picked up from this logistic point by robots.

attributes.name: trash_not_requested
attributes.description: Whether this logistic point is set to trash unrequested items.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

classes.name: LuaLogisticSection
classes.description: Logistic section of a particular [LuaLogisticPoint](runtime:LuaLogisticPoint) or [LuaConstantCombinatorControlBehavior](runtime:LuaConstantCombinatorControlBehavior).

methods.name: clear_slot
methods.description:
Clears the logistic request and auto-trash from the given slot.

This can only be called when the section [is manual](runtime:LuaLogisticSection::is_manual).

parameters.name: slot_index
parameters.description: Index of a slot to clear.

methods.name: get_slot
methods.description: Gets current settings of logistic request and auto-trash from the given slot.

parameters.name: slot_index
parameters.description: Index of a slot to read.

methods.name: set_slot
methods.description:
Sets logistic request and auto-trash slot to the given value.

This will silently fail if personal logistics are not researched yet.

This can only be called when the section [is manual](runtime:LuaLogisticSection::is_manual).

raises.name: on_entity_logistic_slot_changed
raises.description: Raised if setting of logistic slot was successful.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The details of the filter to set.

parameters.name: slot_index
parameters.description: Index of a slot to set.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Whether this section is active. This can only be written to when the section [is manual](runtime:LuaLogisticSection::is_manual).

attributes.name: filters
attributes.description:
The logistic filters for this section.

This can only be written to when the section [is manual](runtime:LuaLogisticSection::is_manual).

attributes.name: filters_count
attributes.description: Amount of filters this section has

attributes.name: group
attributes.description:
The group this section belongs to.

An empty string when in no group.

This can only be written to when the section [is manual](runtime:LuaLogisticSection::is_manual).

attributes.name: index

attributes.name: is_manual

attributes.name: multiplier
attributes.description: Multiplier applied to all filters before they are used by game. This can only be written to when the section [is manual](runtime:LuaLogisticSection::is_manual).

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: owner
attributes.description: The [LuaEntity](runtime:LuaEntity) owner of this LuaLogisticSection.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of this logistic section. Sections that are not manual are controlled by game itself and may not be allowed to be changed by script.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

classes.name: LuaPermissionGroup

return_values.description: Whether the value was successfully applied.

classes.name: LuaPlanet
classes.description: The runtime values of a planet

methods.name: associate_surface
methods.description:
Associates the given surface with this planet. Surface must not already be associated with a planet and the planet must not already have an associated surface.

Planet must not be using [entities_require_heating](runtime:LuaSpaceLocationPrototype::entities_require_heating).

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: The surface to be associated.

methods.name: create_surface
methods.description: Creates the associated surface if one doesn't already exist.

methods.name: reset_map_gen_settings
methods.description: Resets the map gen settings on this planet to the default from-prototype state.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The planets name.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: surface
attributes.description:
The surface for this planet if one currently exists.

Planets do not default generate their surface. [LuaPlanet::create_surface](runtime:LuaPlanet::create_surface) can be used to force the surface to exist.

[LuaPlanet::associate_surface](runtime:LuaPlanet::associate_surface) can be used to create an association with an existing surface.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

classes.name: LuaPlayer
classes.description: A player in the game. Pay attention that a player may or may not have a character, which is the [LuaEntity](runtime:LuaEntity) of the little guy running around the world doing things.

methods.name: activate_paste
methods.description: Gets a copy of the currently selected blueprint in the clipboard queue into the player's cursor, as if the player activated Paste.

methods.name: add_alert
methods.description: Adds an alert to this player for the given entity of the given alert type.

methods.name: add_custom_alert
methods.description: Adds a custom alert to this player.

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: If the alert is clicked, the map will open at the position of this entity.

methods.name: add_pin
methods.description: Adds a pin to this player for the given pin specification. Either entity, player, or surface and position must be defined.

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: The entity to pin.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to pin.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where to create the pin. Required when surface is defined.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: The surface to create the pin on.

methods.name: add_recipe_notification
methods.description: Adds the given recipe to the list of recipe notifications for this player.

parameters.name: recipe
parameters.description: Recipe to add.

methods.name: add_to_clipboard
methods.description: Adds the given blueprint to this player's clipboard queue.

parameters.name: blueprint
parameters.description: The blueprint to add.

methods.name: associate_character
methods.description:
Associates a character with this player.

The character must not be connected to any controller.

If this player is currently disconnected (see [LuaPlayer::connected](runtime:LuaPlayer::connected)) the character will be immediately "logged off".

See [LuaPlayer::get_associated_characters](runtime:LuaPlayer::get_associated_characters) for more information.

parameters.name: character
parameters.description: The character entity.

methods.name: build_from_cursor
methods.description: Builds whatever is in the cursor on the surface the player is on. The cursor stack will automatically be reduced as if the player built normally.

raises.name: on_built_entity
raises.description: Raised if the cursor was successfully built.

raises.name: on_pre_build
raises.description: Raised if the cursor was successfully built.

parameters.name: build_mode
parameters.description: Which build mode should be used instead of normal build. Defaults to normal.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction the entity would be placed

parameters.name: mirror
parameters.description: Whether to mirror the entity

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where the entity would be placed

parameters.name: skip_fog_of_war
parameters.description: If chunks covered by fog-of-war are skipped.

parameters.name: terrain_building_size
parameters.description: The size for building terrain if building terrain. Defaults to 2.

methods.name: can_build_from_cursor
methods.description: Checks if this player can build what ever is in the cursor on the surface the player is on.

parameters.name: build_mode
parameters.description: Which build mode should be used instead of normal build. Defaults to normal.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction the entity would be placed

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where the entity would be placed

parameters.name: skip_fog_of_war
parameters.description: If chunks covered by fog-of-war are skipped.

parameters.name: terrain_building_size
parameters.description: The size for building terrain if building terrain. Defaults to 2.

methods.name: can_place_entity
methods.description: Checks if this player can build the given entity at the given location on the surface the player is on.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction the entity would be placed. Defaults to `north`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the entity to check.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where the entity would be placed.

methods.name: clear_console
methods.description: Clear the chat console.

methods.name: clear_cursor
methods.description: Invokes the "clear cursor" action on the player as if the user pressed it.

raises.name: on_player_cursor_stack_changed
raises.description: Raised when the cursor was successfully cleared.

return_values.description: Whether the cursor is now empty.

methods.name: clear_inventory_highlights
methods.description: Clears the blinking of the inventory based on insertion of items

methods.name: clear_local_flying_texts
methods.description: Clear any active flying texts for this player.

methods.name: clear_recipe_notification
methods.description: Clears the given recipe from the list of recipe notifications for this player.

parameters.name: recipe
parameters.description: Recipe to clear.

methods.name: clear_recipe_notifications
methods.description: Clears all recipe notifications for this player.

methods.name: clear_selection
methods.description: Clears the player's selection tool selection position.

methods.name: connect_to_server
methods.description:
Asks the player if they would like to connect to the given server.

This only does anything when used on a multiplayer peer. Single player and server hosts will ignore the prompt.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The server (address:port) if port is not given the default Factorio port is used.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the server.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password if different from the one used to join this game. Note, if the current password is not empty but the one required to join the new server is an empty string should be given for this field.

methods.name: create_character
methods.description:
Creates and attaches a character entity to this player.

The player must not have a character already connected and must be online (see [LuaPlayer::connected](runtime:LuaPlayer::connected)).

parameters.name: character
parameters.description: The character to create else the default is used.

return_values.description: Whether the character was created.

methods.name: create_local_flying_text
methods.description:
Spawn flying text that is only visible to this player. Either `position` or `create_at_cursor` are required. When `create_at_cursor` is `true`, all parameters other than `text` are ignored.

If no custom `speed` is set and the text is longer than 25 characters, its `time_to_live` and `speed` are dynamically adjusted to give the player more time to read it.

Local flying text is not saved, which means it will disappear after a save/load-cycle.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color of the flying text. Defaults to white text.

parameters.name: create_at_cursor
parameters.description: If `true`, the flying text is created at the player's cursor. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The location on the map at which to show the flying text.

parameters.name: speed
parameters.description: The speed at which the text rises upwards in tiles/second. Can't be a negative value.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: The surface which this text will be shown on. Defaults to player surface.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The flying text to show.

parameters.name: time_to_live
parameters.description: The amount of ticks that the flying text will be shown for. Defaults to `80`.

methods.name: disable_alert
methods.description: Disables alerts for the given alert category.

return_values.description: Whether the alert type was disabled (false if it was already disabled).

methods.name: disable_recipe_groups
methods.description: Disable recipe groups.

methods.name: disable_recipe_subgroups
methods.description: Disable recipe subgroups.

methods.name: disassociate_character
methods.description:
Disassociates a character from this player. This is functionally the same as setting [LuaEntity::associated_player](runtime:LuaEntity::associated_player) to `nil`.

See [LuaPlayer::get_associated_characters](runtime:LuaPlayer::get_associated_characters) for more information.

parameters.name: character
parameters.description: The character entity

methods.name: drag_wire
methods.description: Start/end wire dragging at the specified location, wire type is based on the cursor contents

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Position at which cursor was clicked. Used only to decide which side of arithmetic combinator, decider combinator or power switch is to be connected. Entity itself to be connected is based on the player's selected entity.

return_values.description: `true` if the action did something

methods.name: enable_alert
methods.description: Enables alerts for the given alert category.

return_values.description: Whether the alert type was enabled (false if it was already enabled).

methods.name: enable_recipe_groups
methods.description: Enable recipe groups.

methods.name: enable_recipe_subgroups
methods.description: Enable recipe subgroups.

methods.name: enter_space_platform
methods.description: Enters the given space platform if possible.

return_values.description: If the player entered the platform.

methods.name: exit_cutscene
methods.description: Exit the current cutscene. Errors if not in a cutscene.

methods.name: get_active_quick_bar_page
methods.description: Gets which quick bar page is being used for the given screen page or `nil` if not known.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The screen page. Index 1 is the top row in the gui. Index can go beyond the visible number of bars on the screen to account for the interface config setting change.

methods.name: get_alerts
methods.description: Get all alerts matching the given filters, or all alerts if no filters are given.

return_values.description: A mapping of surface index to an array of arrays of [alerts](runtime:Alert) indexed by the [alert type](runtime:defines.alert_type).

methods.name: get_associated_characters
methods.description:
The characters associated with this player.

The array will always be empty when the player is disconnected (see [LuaPlayer::connected](runtime:LuaPlayer::connected)) regardless of there being associated characters.

Characters associated with this player will be logged off when this player disconnects but are not controlled by any player.

methods.name: get_goal_description
methods.description: Get the current goal description, as a localised string.

methods.name: get_infinity_inventory_filter
methods.description: Gets the filter for this map editor infinity filters at the given index or `nil` if the filter index doesn't exist or is empty.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to get.

methods.name: get_quick_bar_slot
methods.description: Gets the quick bar filter for the given slot or `nil`.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The slot index. 1 for the first slot of page one, 2 for slot two of page one, 11 for the first slot of page 2, etc.

methods.name: is_alert_enabled
methods.description: If the given alert type is currently enabled.

methods.name: is_alert_muted
methods.description: If the given alert type is currently muted.

methods.name: is_shortcut_available
methods.description: Is a custom Lua shortcut currently available?

parameters.name: prototype_name
parameters.description: Prototype name of the custom shortcut.

methods.name: is_shortcut_toggled
methods.description: Is a custom Lua shortcut currently toggled?

parameters.name: prototype_name
parameters.description: Prototype name of the custom shortcut.

methods.name: jump_to_cutscene_waypoint
methods.description: Jump to the specified cutscene waypoint. Only works when the player is viewing a cutscene.

methods.name: land_on_planet
methods.description: Ejects this player from the current space platform and lands on the current planet.

return_values.description: If the player successfully landed on the planet.

methods.name: leave_space_platform
methods.description: Ejects this player from the current space platform if in a platform. The player is left on the platform at the position of the hub.

methods.name: mute_alert
methods.description: Mutes alerts for the given alert category.

return_values.description: Whether the alert type was muted (false if it was already muted).

methods.name: pipette_entity
methods.description: Invokes the "smart pipette" action on the player as if the user pressed it.

raises.name: on_player_pipette
raises.description: Raised if the entity was successfully pipetted.

parameters.name: allow_ghost
parameters.description: Defaults to false.

return_values.description: Whether the smart pipette found something to place.

methods.name: play_sound
methods.description:
Play a sound for this player.

The sound is not played if its location is not [charted](runtime:LuaForce::chart) for this player.

parameters.name: override_sound_type
parameters.description: The volume mixer to play the sound through. Defaults to the default mixer for the given sound type.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The sound to play.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where the sound should be played. If not given, it's played globally on the player's controller's surface.

parameters.name: volume_modifier
parameters.description: The volume of the sound to play. Must be between 0 and 1 inclusive.

methods.name: print
methods.description:
Print text to the chat console.

By default, messages that are identical to a message sent in the last 60 ticks are not printed again.

methods.name: print_entity_statistics
methods.description: Print entity statistics to the player's console.

parameters.name: entities
parameters.description: Entity prototypes to get statistics for. If not specified or empty, display statistics for all entities.

methods.name: print_lua_object_statistics
methods.description: Print LuaObject counts per mod.

methods.name: print_robot_jobs
methods.description: Print construction robot job counts to the player's console.

methods.name: remove_alert
methods.description: Removes all alerts matching the given filters or if an empty filters table is given all alerts are removed.

methods.name: request_translation
methods.description:
Requests a translation for the given localised string. If the request is successful, the [on_string_translated](runtime:on_string_translated) event will be fired with the results.

Does nothing if this player is not connected (see [LuaPlayer::connected](runtime:LuaPlayer::connected)).

raises.name: on_string_translated
raises.description: Raised if the request was successfully sent.

return_values.description: The unique ID for the requested translation.

methods.name: request_translations
methods.description:
Requests translation for the given set of localised strings. If the request is successful, a [on_string_translated](runtime:on_string_translated) event will be fired for each string with the results.

Does nothing if this player is not connected (see [LuaPlayer::connected](runtime:LuaPlayer::connected)).

raises.name: on_string_translated
raises.description: Raised if the request was successfully sent.

return_values.description: The unique IDs for the requested translations.

methods.name: set_active_quick_bar_page
methods.description: Sets which quick bar page is being used for the given screen page.

parameters.name: page_index
parameters.description: The new quick bar page.

parameters.name: screen_index
parameters.description: The screen page. Index 1 is the top row in the gui. Index can go beyond the visible number of bars on the screen to account for the interface config setting change.

methods.name: set_controller
methods.description:
Set the controller type of the player.

Setting a player to [defines.controllers.editor](runtime:defines.controllers.editor) auto promotes the player to admin and enables cheat mode. Setting a player to [defines.controllers.editor](runtime:defines.controllers.editor) also requires the calling player be an admin.

parameters.name: character
parameters.description: Entity to control. Mandatory when `type` is [defines.controllers.character](runtime:defines.controllers.character), ignored otherwise.

parameters.name: chart_mode_cutoff
parameters.description: If specified and `type` is [defines.controllers.cutscene](runtime:defines.controllers.cutscene), the game will switch to chart-mode (map zoomed out) rendering when the zoom level is less than this value.

parameters.name: final_transition_time
parameters.description: If specified and `type` is [defines.controllers.cutscene](runtime:defines.controllers.cutscene), it is the time in ticks it will take for the camera to pan from the final waypoint back to the starting position. If not given the camera will not pan back to the start position/zoom.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: If specified and `type` is [defines.controllers.remote](runtime:defines.controllers.remote), the position the remote controller will be centered on.

parameters.name: start_position
parameters.description: If specified and `type` is [defines.controllers.cutscene](runtime:defines.controllers.cutscene), the cutscene will start at this position. If not given the start position will be the player position.

parameters.name: start_zoom
parameters.description: If specified and `type` is [defines.controllers.cutscene](runtime:defines.controllers.cutscene), the cutscene will start at this zoom level. If not given the start zoom will be the player's zoom.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: If specified and `type` is [defines.controllers.remote](runtime:defines.controllers.remote), the surface the remote controller will be put on.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Which controller to use.

parameters.name: waypoints
parameters.description: List of waypoints for the cutscene controller. This parameter is mandatory when `type` is [defines.controllers.cutscene](runtime:defines.controllers.cutscene).

methods.name: set_ending_screen_data
methods.description: Setup the screen to be shown when the game is finished.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: Path to image to be shown.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Message to be shown.

methods.name: set_goal_description
methods.description: Set the text in the goal window (top left).

parameters.name: only_update
parameters.description: When `true`, won't play the "goal updated" sound.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to display. Lines can be delimited with `\n`. Passing an empty string or omitting this parameter entirely will make the goal window disappear.

methods.name: set_infinity_inventory_filter
methods.description: Sets the filter for this map editor infinity filters at the given index.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The new filter or `nil` to clear the filter.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to set.

methods.name: set_quick_bar_slot
methods.description: Sets the quick bar filter for the given slot. If a [LuaItemStack](runtime:LuaItemStack) is provided, the slot will be set to that particular item instance if it has extra data, for example a specific blueprint or spidertron remote. Otherwise, it will be set to all items of that prototype, for example iron plates.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter or `nil` to clear it.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The slot index. 1 for the first slot of page one, 2 for slot two of page one, 11 for the first slot of page 2, etc.

methods.name: set_shortcut_available
methods.description: Make a custom Lua shortcut available or unavailable.

parameters.name: prototype_name
parameters.description: Prototype name of the custom shortcut.

methods.name: set_shortcut_toggled
methods.description: Toggle or untoggle a custom Lua shortcut

parameters.name: prototype_name
parameters.description: Prototype name of the custom shortcut.

methods.name: start_selection
methods.description: Starts selection with selection tool from the specified position. Does nothing if the player's cursor is not a selection tool.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position to start selection from.

parameters.name: selection_mode
parameters.description: The type of selection to start.

methods.name: toggle_map_editor
methods.description: Toggles this player into or out of the map editor. Does nothing if this player isn't an admin or if the player doesn't have permission to use the map editor.

raises.name: on_player_toggled_map_editor
raises.description: Raised if the map editor was successfully toggled.

raises.name: on_pre_player_toggled_map_editor
raises.description: Raised if the map editor was successfully toggled.

methods.name: unlock_achievement
methods.description: Unlock the achievements of the given player. This has any effect only when this is the local player, the achievement isn't unlocked so far and the achievement is of the type "achievement".

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: name of the achievement to unlock

methods.name: unmute_alert
methods.description: Unmutes alerts for the given alert category.

return_values.description: Whether the alert type was unmuted (false if it was wasn't muted).

methods.name: use_from_cursor
methods.description: Uses the current item in the cursor if it's a capsule or does nothing if not.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where the item would be used.

attributes.name: admin
attributes.description:
`true` if the player is an admin.

Trying to change player admin status from the console when you aren't an admin does nothing.

attributes.name: afk_time
attributes.description: How many ticks since the last action of this player.

attributes.name: auto_sort_main_inventory
attributes.description: If the main inventory will be auto sorted.

attributes.name: blueprint_to_setup
attributes.description: The item stack containing a blueprint to be setup.

attributes.name: blueprints
attributes.description: Records contained in the player's blueprint library.

attributes.name: centered_on
attributes.description:
The entity being centered on in remote view.

When writing, the player will be switched to remote view (if not already in it) and centered on the given entity.

attributes.name: character
attributes.description: The character attached to this player, if any. Returns `nil` when the player is disconnected (see [LuaPlayer::connected](runtime:LuaPlayer::connected)).

attributes.name: chat_color
attributes.description: The color used when this player talks in game.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: The color associated with the player. This will be used to tint the player's character as well as their buildings and vehicles.

attributes.name: connected
attributes.description: `true` if the player is currently connected to the game.

attributes.name: cursor_stack_temporary
attributes.description: Returns true if the current item stack in cursor will be destroyed after clearing the cursor. Manually putting it into inventory still preserves the item. If the cursor stack is not one of the supported types (blueprint, blueprint-book, deconstruction-planner, upgrade-planner), write operation will be silently ignored.

attributes.name: cutscene_character
attributes.description: When in a cutscene; the character this player would be using once the cutscene is over, if any. Returns `nil` when the player is disconnected (see [LuaPlayer::connected](runtime:LuaPlayer::connected)).

attributes.name: display_density_scale
attributes.description:
The display density scale for this player. The display density scale is the factor of [LuaPlayer::display_scale](runtime:LuaPlayer::display_scale) that is determined by the physical DPI of the screen that Factorio is running on. In most cases, the default value is 1. If the player is playing on a high-density display, this value may be 2 or greater.

During [on_player_created](runtime:on_player_created), this attribute will always return a scale of `1`. To get the actual scale, listen to the [on_player_display_density_scale_changed](runtime:on_player_display_density_scale_changed) event raised shortly afterwards.

attributes.name: display_resolution
attributes.description:
The display resolution for this player.

During [on_player_created](runtime:on_player_created), this attribute will always return a resolution of `{width=1920, height=1080}`. To get the actual resolution, listen to the [on_player_display_resolution_changed](runtime:on_player_display_resolution_changed) event raised shortly afterwards.

attributes.name: display_scale
attributes.description:
The display scale for this player.

During [on_player_created](runtime:on_player_created), this attribute will always return a scale of `1`. To get the actual scale, listen to the [on_player_display_scale_changed](runtime:on_player_display_scale_changed) event raised shortly afterwards.

attributes.name: drag_target
attributes.description: The wire drag target for this player, if any.

attributes.name: entity_copy_source
attributes.description: The source entity used during entity settings copy-paste, if any.

attributes.name: game_view_settings
attributes.description: The player's game view settings.

attributes.name: hand_location
attributes.description: The original location of the item in the cursor, marked with a hand. `nil` if the cursor stack is empty. When writing, the specified inventory slot must be empty and the cursor stack must not be empty.

attributes.name: index
attributes.description: This player's index in [LuaGameScript::players](runtime:LuaGameScript::players) (unique ID). It is assigned when a player is created, and remains so (even when the player is not [connected](runtime:LuaPlayer::connected)) until the player is irreversibly [removed](runtime:on_player_removed). Indexes of removed players can be reused.

attributes.name: infinity_inventory_filters
attributes.description: The filters for this map editor infinity inventory settings.

attributes.name: input_method
attributes.description: The input method of the player, mouse and keyboard or game controller

attributes.name: last_online
attributes.description: At what tick this player was last online.

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description:
The active locale for this player.

During [on_player_created](runtime:on_player_created), this attribute will be `en`. To get the actual value, listen to the [on_player_locale_changed](runtime:on_player_locale_changed) event raised shortly afterwards.

attributes.name: map_view_settings
attributes.description: The player's map view settings. To write to this, use a table containing the fields that should be changed.

attributes.name: minimap_enabled
attributes.description: `true` if the minimap is visible.

attributes.name: mod_settings
attributes.description:
The current per-player settings for the this player, indexed by prototype name. Returns the same structure as [LuaSettings::get_player_settings](runtime:LuaSettings::get_player_settings). This table becomes invalid if its associated player does.

Even though this attribute is marked as read-only, individual settings can be changed by overwriting their [ModSetting](runtime:ModSetting) table. Mods can only change their own settings. Using the in-game console, all player settings can be changed.
examples:
```
-- Change the value of the "active_lifestyle" setting
player.mod_settings["active_lifestyle"] = {value = true}
```

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The player's username.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: online_time
attributes.description: How many ticks did this player spend playing this save (all sessions combined).

attributes.name: opened_self
attributes.description: `true` if the player opened itself. I.e. if they opened the character or god-controller GUI.

attributes.name: permission_group
attributes.description: The permission group this player is part of, if any.

attributes.name: physical_controller_type
attributes.description: The player's "physical" controller. When a player is in the remote controller, this specifies the controller they will return to. When the player is not in the remote controller, this is equivalent to [LuaPlayer::controller_type](runtime:LuaPlayer::controller_type).

attributes.name: physical_position
attributes.description: The current position of this player's physical controller.

attributes.name: physical_surface
attributes.description: The surface this player's physical controller is on.

attributes.name: physical_surface_index
attributes.description: Unique ID associated with the surface this player's physical controller is currently on.

attributes.name: physical_vehicle
attributes.description: The current vehicle of this player's physical controller.

attributes.name: remove_unfiltered_items
attributes.description: If items not included in this map editor infinity inventory filters should be removed.

attributes.name: render_mode
attributes.description: The render mode of the player, like map or zoom to world.

attributes.name: show_on_map
attributes.description: If `true`, circle and name of given player is rendered on the map/chart.

attributes.name: spectator
attributes.description: If `true`, zoom-to-world noise effect will be disabled and environmental sounds will be based on zoom-to-world view instead of position of player's character.

attributes.name: spidertron_remote_selection
attributes.description: All SpiderVehicles currently selected by the player, if they are holding a spidertron remote.

attributes.name: stashed_controller_type
attributes.description: The stashed controller type, if any. This is mainly useful when a player is in the map editor.

attributes.name: tag
attributes.description: The tag that is shown after the player in chat, on the map and above multiplayer selection rectangles.

attributes.name: ticks_to_respawn
attributes.description:
The number of ticks until this player will respawn. `nil` if this player is not waiting to respawn.

Set to `nil` to immediately respawn the player.

Set to any positive value to trigger the respawn state for this player.

attributes.name: undo_redo_stack
attributes.description: The undo and redo stack for this player.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: zoom
attributes.description: The player's zoom-level. Must be positive.

classes.name: LuaProcessionLayerInheritanceGroupPrototype
classes.description: Prototype of a procession inheritance group which synchronizes offsets between procession steps.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

classes.name: LuaProfiler
classes.description:
An object used to measure script performance.

Since performance is non-deterministic, these objects don't allow reading the raw time values from Lua. They can be used anywhere a [LocalisedString](runtime:LocalisedString) is used, except for [LuaGuiElement::add](runtime:LuaGuiElement::add)'s LocalisedString arguments, [LuaSurface::create_entity](runtime:LuaSurface::create_entity)'s `text` argument, and [LuaEntity::add_market_item](runtime:LuaEntity::add_market_item).

methods.name: add
methods.description:
Add the duration of another timer to this timer. Useful to reduce start/stop overhead when accumulating time onto many timers at once.

If other is running, the time to now will be added.

parameters.name: other
parameters.description: The timer to add to this timer.

methods.name: divide
methods.description:
Divides the current duration by a set value. Useful for calculating the average of many iterations.

Does nothing if this isn't stopped.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number to divide by. Must be > 0.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resets the clock, also restarting it.

methods.name: restart
methods.description: Start the clock again, without resetting it.

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops the clock.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: factoriopedia_description
attributes.description: Provides additional description used in factoriopedia.

attributes.name: group
attributes.description: Group of this prototype.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of this prototype.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: The string used to alphabetically sort these prototypes. It is a simple string that has no additional semantic meaning.

attributes.name: subgroup
attributes.description: Subgroup of this prototype.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type of this prototype.

classes.name: LuaPrototypes
classes.description: Provides read-only access to prototypes. It is accessible through the global object named `prototypes`.

methods.name: get_achievement_filtered
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaAchievementPrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
```
-- Get every achievement prototype that is not allowed to be completed on the peaceful difficulty setting.
local prototypes = prototypes.get_achievement_filtered{{filter="allowed-without-fight", invert=true}}
```

methods.name: get_decorative_filtered
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaDecorativePrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
```
-- Get every decorative prototype that is auto-placed.
local prototypes = prototypes.get_decorative_filtered{{filter="autoplace"}}
```

methods.name: get_entity_filtered
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaEntityPrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
```
-- Get every entity prototype that can craft recipes involving fluids in the way some assembling machines can
local prototypes = prototypes.get_entity_filtered{{filter="crafting-category", crafting_category="crafting-with-fluid"}}
```

methods.name: get_equipment_filtered
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaEquipmentPrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
```
-- Get every equipment prototype that functions as a battery.
local prototypes = prototypes.get_equipment_filtered{{filter="type", type="battery-equipment"}}
```

methods.name: get_fluid_filtered
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaFluidPrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
```
-- Get every fluid prototype that has a heat capacity of exactly `100`.
local prototypes = prototypes.get_fluid_filtered{{filter="heat-capacity", comparison="=", value=100}}
```

methods.name: get_history
methods.description: Gets the prototype history for the given type and name.

methods.name: get_item_filtered
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaItemPrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
```
-- Get every item prototype that has a fuel top speed multiplier larger than 1.
local prototypes = prototypes.get_item_filtered{{filter = "fuel-top-speed-multiplier", comparison = ">", value = 1}}
```

methods.name: get_mod_setting_filtered
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaModSettingPrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
```
-- Get every mod setting prototype that belongs to the specified mod.
local prototypes = prototypes.get_mod_setting_filtered{{filter="mod", mod="space-exploration"}}
```

methods.name: get_recipe_filtered
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaRecipePrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
```
-- Get every recipe prototype that takes less than half a second to craft (at crafting speed `1`).
local prototypes = prototypes.get_recipe_filtered{{filter="energy", comparison="<", value=0.5}}
```

methods.name: get_technology_filtered
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaTechnologyPrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
```
-- Get every technology prototype that can be researched at the start of the game.
local prototypes = prototypes.get_technology_filtered{{filter="has-prerequisites", invert=true}}
```

methods.name: get_tile_filtered
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaTilePrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
```
-- Get every tile prototype that improves a player's walking speed by at least 50%.
local prototypes = prototypes.get_tile_filtered{{filter="walking-speed-modifier", comparison="≥", value=1.5}}
```

attributes.name: achievement
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaAchievementPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: active_trigger
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaActiveTriggerPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: airborne_pollutant
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaAirbornePollutantPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: ammo_category
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaAmmoCategoryPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: asteroid_chunk
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaAsteroidChunkPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: autoplace_control
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaAutoplaceControlPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: burner_usage
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaBurnerUsagePrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: collision_layer
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaCollisionLayerPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: custom_event
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every defined custom event, indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: custom_input
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaCustomInputPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: damage
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaDamagePrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: decorative
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaDecorativePrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: entity
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaEntityPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: equipment
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaEquipmentPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: equipment_category
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaEquipmentCategoryPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: equipment_grid
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaEquipmentGridPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: fluid
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaFluidPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: font
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaFontPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: fuel_category
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaFuelCategoryPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: item
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaItemPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: item_group
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every ItemGroup indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: item_subgroup

A dictionary containing every MapGenPreset indexed by `name`.

A MapGenPreset is an exact copy of the prototype table provided from the data stage.

attributes.name: mod_setting

attributes.name: module_category
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaModuleCategoryPrototype indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: named_noise_expression
attributes.description: A dictionary containing every LuaNamedNoiseExpression indexed by `name`.

attributes.name: named_noise_function

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: particle

attributes.name: procession

classes.name: LuaRailEnd
classes.description: Utility object that binds to a rail entity and rail_direction to allow easier traversal over rails

methods.name: flip_direction
methods.description: Moves to opposite end on the rail this object points to

methods.name: get_rail_extensions
methods.description: Returns all possible rail extensions from this position as defined by the planner item.

parameters.name: planner_item
parameters.description: Rail planner that defines possible rail extensions

methods.name: make_copy
methods.description: Creates a copy of this LuaRailEnd object.

methods.name: move_forward
methods.description: Moves forward by 1 rail to the specified connection direction

return_values.description: If the move was successful. False if there is no rail connected in given connection_direction

methods.name: move_natural
methods.description: Moves forward by 1 rail in the natural direction. Natural direction is a move in the direction taken by the train over rail connection related to this rail end. If there are no trains, the natural direction is straight if straight connected rail exists, otherwise it is right if right connected rail exists, otherwise it is left if left connected rail exists. Natural direction is not defined if there are no rails connected to this end and this method will fail.

return_values.description: If the move was successful. False only when there are no rails connected on this end

methods.name: move_to_segment_end
methods.description: Moves forward until a rail segment boundary is reached. If this rail end is at the segment boundary, it will not move at all. When a rail segment is cyclical, it will reach the rail segment boundary at some arbitrary position unless the segment boundary is well defined by presence of rail signals, train stop or other rails connecting to the rails loop.

attributes.name: alternative_in_signal_location

classes.name: LuaRandomGenerator
classes.description:
A deterministic random generator independent from the core games random generator that can be seeded and re-seeded at will. This random generator can be saved and loaded and will maintain its state.

Note this is entirely different from calling [math.random](libraries.html)() and you should be sure you actually want to use this over calling `math.random()`. If you aren't sure if you need to use this over calling `math.random()` then you probably don't need to use this.
examples:
```
-- Create a generator and use it to print a random number.
storage.generator = game.create_random_generator()
game.player.print(storage.generator())
```

methods.name: re_seed
methods.description:
Re-seeds the random generator with the given value.

Seeds that are close together will produce similar results. Seeds from 0 to 341 will produce the same results.

operators.name: call
operators.description: Generates a random number. If no parameters are given a number in the `[0, 1)` range is returned. If a single parameter is given a floored number in the `[1, N]` range is returned. If 2 parameters are given a floored number in the `[N1, N2]` range is returned.

parameters.name: lower
parameters.description: Inclusive lower bound on the result

parameters.name: upper
parameters.description: Inclusive upper bound on the result

classes.name: LuaRecord
classes.description: A reference to a record in the blueprint library. Records in the "my blueprints" shelf are read-only, but records in the "game blueprints" shelf are read/write.

methods.name: build_blueprint
methods.description:
Build this blueprint at the given location.

Built entities can be come invalid between the building of the blueprint and the function returning if by_player or raise_built is used and one of those events invalidates the entity.

parameters.name: build_mode
parameters.description: If `normal`, blueprint will not be built if any one thing can't be built. If `forced`, anything that can be built is built and obstructing nature entities will be deconstructed. If `superforced`, all obstructions will be deconstructed and the blueprint will be built.

parameters.name: by_player
parameters.description: The player to use if any. If provided [defines.events.on_built_entity](runtime:defines.events.on_built_entity) will also be fired on successful entity creation.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction to use when building

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force to use for the building

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position to build at

parameters.name: raise_built
parameters.description: If true; [defines.events.script_raised_built](runtime:defines.events.script_raised_built) will be fired on successful entity creation. Note: this is ignored if by_player is provided.

parameters.name: skip_fog_of_war
parameters.description: If chunks covered by fog-of-war are skipped.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Surface to build on

return_values.description: Array of created ghosts

methods.name: cancel_deconstruct_area
methods.description: Cancel deconstruct the given area with this deconstruction planner.

parameters.name: area
parameters.description: The area to deconstruct

parameters.name: by_player
parameters.description: The player to use if any.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force to use for canceling deconstruction

parameters.name: skip_fog_of_war
parameters.description: If chunks covered by fog-of-war are skipped. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: super_forced
parameters.description: If the cancel deconstruction is super-forced. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Surface to cancel deconstruct on

methods.name: clear_blueprint
methods.description: Clears this blueprint.

methods.name: clear_deconstruction_data
methods.description: Clears all settings/filters on this deconstruction planner, resetting it to default values.

methods.name: clear_upgrade_data
methods.description: Clears all settings/filters on this upgrade planner, resetting it to default values.

methods.name: create_blueprint
methods.description: Sets up this blueprint using the found blueprintable entities/tiles on the surface.

parameters.name: always_include_tiles
parameters.description: When true, blueprintable tiles are always included in the blueprint. When false they're only included if no entities exist in the setup area. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: area
parameters.description: The bounding box

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force to use for the creation

parameters.name: include_entities
parameters.description: When true, entities are included in the blueprint. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: include_fuel
parameters.description: When true, train fuel is included in the blueprint, Defaults to true.

parameters.name: include_modules
parameters.description: When true, modules are included in the blueprint. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: include_station_names
parameters.description: When true, station names are included in the blueprint. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: include_trains
parameters.description: When true, trains are included in the blueprint. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Surface to create from

return_values.description: The blueprint entity index to source entity mapping.

methods.name: deconstruct_area
methods.description: Deconstruct the given area with this deconstruction planner.

parameters.name: area
parameters.description: The area to deconstruct

parameters.name: by_player
parameters.description: The player to use if any.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force to use for the deconstruction

parameters.name: skip_fog_of_war
parameters.description: If chunks covered by fog-of-war are skipped. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: super_forced
parameters.description: If the deconstruction is super-forced. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Surface to deconstruct on

methods.name: get_active_index
methods.description: The active index of this BlueprintBookRecord. For records in "my blueprints", the result will be the same regardless of the player, but records in "game blueprints" may have different active indices per player.

In contrast to [LuaRecord::set_mapper](runtime:LuaRecord::set_mapper), indices past the upgrade item's current size are considered to be out of bounds.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the mapper to read.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: `"from"` or `"to"`.

methods.description: Gets the tile filter at the given index for this deconstruction planner.

methods.description: Set new entities to be a part of this blueprint.

parameters.name: entities
parameters.description: The new blueprint entities.

methods.name: set_blueprint_entity_tag
methods.description: Sets the given tag on the given blueprint entity index in this blueprint blueprint.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The entity index.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: The tag to set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The tag value to set or `nil` to clear the tag.

methods.name: set_blueprint_entity_tags
methods.description: Sets the tags on the given blueprint entity index in this blueprint.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The entity index

methods.name: set_blueprint_tiles
methods.description: Set specific tiles in this blueprint.

parameters.name: tiles
parameters.description: Tiles to be a part of the blueprint.

methods.name: set_entity_filter
methods.description: Sets the entity filter at the given index for this deconstruction planner.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Writing `nil` removes the filter.

return_values.description: Whether the new filter was successfully set (ie. was valid).

methods.name: set_mapper
methods.description:
Sets the module filter at the given index for this upgrade item.

In contrast to [LuaRecord::get_mapper](runtime:LuaRecord::get_mapper), indices past the upgrade item's current size are valid and expand the list of mappings accordingly, if within reasonable bounds.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the mapper to set.

parameters.name: mapper
parameters.description: The mapper to set or `nil`

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: `"from"` or `"to"`.

methods.name: set_tile_filter
methods.description: Sets the tile filter at the given index for this deconstruction planner.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Setting to nil erases the filter.

return_values.description: Whether the new filter was successfully set (ie. was valid).

attributes.name: blueprint_absolute_snapping
attributes.description: If absolute snapping is enabled on this blueprint.

attributes.name: blueprint_position_relative_to_grid
attributes.description: The offset from the absolute grid. `nil` if absolute snapping is not enabled.

attributes.name: blueprint_snap_to_grid
attributes.description: The snapping grid size in this blueprint. `nil` if snapping is not enabled.

attributes.name: contents
attributes.description: The contents of this BlueprintBookRecord. This is sparse array - it may have gaps, so using `#` will not be reliable. Use [LuaRecord::contents_size](runtime:LuaRecord::contents_size) or `pairs()` to iterate this table.

attributes.name: contents_size
attributes.description: The highest populated index in the contents of this BlueprintBookRecord.

attributes.name: cost_to_build
attributes.description: List of raw materials required to build this blueprint.

attributes.name: default_icons
attributes.description: The default icons for a blueprint blueprint.

attributes.name: entity_filter_count
attributes.description: The number of entity filters this deconstruction planner supports.

attributes.name: entity_filter_mode
attributes.description: The blacklist/whitelist entity filter mode for this deconstruction planner.

attributes.name: entity_filters
attributes.description: The entity filters for this deconstruction planner. The attribute is a sparse array with the keys representing the index of the filter. All prototypes in this array must not have the `"not-deconstructable"` flag set and are either a `cliff` or marked as `minable`.

attributes.name: is_blueprint_preview
attributes.description: Is this blueprint record a preview? A preview record must be synced by the player before entity and tile data can be read.

attributes.name: mapper_count
attributes.description: The current count of mappers in the upgrade item.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: preview_icons
attributes.description: The preview icons for this record.

attributes.name: tile_filter_count
attributes.description: The number of tile filters this deconstruction planner supports.

attributes.name: tile_filter_mode
attributes.description: The blacklist/whitelist tile filter mode for this deconstruction planner.

attributes.name: tile_filters
attributes.description: The tile filters for this deconstruction planner. The attribute is a sparse array with the keys representing the index of the filter. Reading filters always returns an array of strings which are the tile prototype names.

attributes.name: tile_selection_mode
attributes.description: The tile selection mode for this deconstruction planner.

attributes.name: trees_and_rocks_only
attributes.description: If this deconstruction planner, is set to allow trees and rocks only.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of this blueprint record.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: valid_for_write
attributes.description: Is this record valid for writing? A record is invalid for write if it is a BlueprintRecord preview or if it is in the "My blueprints" shelf.

classes.name: LuaRemote
classes.description: Registry of interfaces between scripts. An interface is simply a dictionary mapping names to functions. A script or mod can then register an interface with [LuaRemote](runtime:LuaRemote), after that any script can call the registered functions, provided it knows the interface name and the desired function name. An instance of LuaRemote is available through the global object named `remote`.
examples:
```
-- Will register a remote interface containing two functions. Later, it will call these functions through `remote`.
remote.add_interface("human interactor",
  {
    hello = function() game.player.print("Hi!") end,
    bye = function(name) game.player.print("Bye " .. name) end
  })
-- Some time later, possibly in a different mod...
remote.call("human interactor", "hello")
remote.call("human interactor", "bye", "dear reader")
```

methods.name: add_interface
methods.description: Add a remote interface.

parameters.name: functions
parameters.description: List of functions that are members of the new interface.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the interface. If the name matches any existing interface, an error is thrown.

methods.name: call
methods.description:
Call a function of an interface.

Providing an unknown interface or function name will result in a script error.

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: Function name that belongs to the `interface`.

parameters.name: interface
parameters.description: Interface to look up `function` in.

variadic_parameter.description: Arguments to pass to the called function. Note that any arguments passed through the interface are a copy of the original, not a reference. Metatables are not retained, while references to LuaObjects stay intact.

methods.name: remove_interface
methods.description: Removes an interface with the given name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the interface.

return_values.description: Whether the interface was removed. `false` if the interface didn't exist.

attributes.name: interfaces
attributes.description: List of all registered interfaces. For each interface name, `remote.interfaces[name]` is a dictionary mapping the interface's registered functions to `true`.
examples:
```
-- Assuming the "human interactor" interface is registered as above
game.player.print(tostring(remote.interfaces["human interactor"]["hello"]))        -- prints true
game.player.print(tostring(remote.interfaces["human interactor"]["nonexistent"]))  -- prints nil
```
