classes.name: LuaRendering
classes.description:
Allows rendering of geometric shapes, text and sprites in the game world through the global object named `rendering`. Each render object is identified by an id that is universally unique for the lifetime of a whole game.

If an entity target of an object is destroyed or changes surface, then the object is also destroyed.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Destroys all render objects.

parameters.name: mod_name
parameters.description: If provided, only the render objects created by this mod are destroyed. An empty string (`""`) refers to all objects not belonging to a mod, such as those created using console commands.

methods.name: draw_animation
methods.description: Create an animation.

parameters.name: animation
parameters.description: Name of an [AnimationPrototype](prototype:AnimationPrototype).

parameters.name: animation_offset
parameters.description: Offset of the animation in frames. Default is 0.

parameters.name: animation_speed
parameters.description: How many frames the animation goes forward per tick. Default is 1.

parameters.name: forces
parameters.description: The forces that this object is rendered to. Passing `nil` or an empty table will render it to all forces.

parameters.name: only_in_alt_mode
parameters.description: If this should only be rendered in alt mode. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: orientation
parameters.description: The orientation of the animation. Default is 0.

parameters.name: orientation_target
parameters.description: If given, the animation rotates so that it faces this target. Note that `orientation` is still applied to the animation.

parameters.name: oriented_offset
parameters.description: Offsets the center of the animation if `orientation_target` is given. This offset will rotate together with the animation.

parameters.name: players
parameters.description: The players that this object is rendered to. Passing `nil` or an empty table will render it to all players.

parameters.name: render_layer
parameters.description: Render layer of the animation. Defaults to `"arrow"`.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Center of the animation.

parameters.name: time_to_live
parameters.description: In ticks. Defaults to living forever.

parameters.name: use_target_orientation
parameters.description: Only used if `orientation_target` is a LuaEntity.

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: If this is rendered to anyone at all. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: x_scale
parameters.description: Horizontal scale of the animation. Default is 1.

parameters.name: y_scale
parameters.description: Vertical scale of the animation. Default is 1.

methods.description:
Create a light.

The base game uses the utility sprites `light_medium` and `light_small` for lights.

parameters.name: color

parameters.name: forces
parameters.description: The forces that this object is rendered to. Passing `nil` or an empty table will render it to all forces.

parameters.name: intensity
parameters.description: Default is 1.

parameters.name: minimum_darkness
parameters.description: The minimum darkness at which this light is rendered. Default is 0.

parameters.name: only_in_alt_mode
parameters.description: If this should only be rendered in alt mode. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: orientation
parameters.description: The orientation of the light. Default is 0.

parameters.name: oriented
parameters.description: If this light has the same orientation as the entity target, default is false. Note that `orientation` is still applied to the sprite.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: Default is 1.

methods.name: draw_line
methods.description: Create a line.
examples:
```
-- Draw a white and 2 pixel wide line from {0, 0} to {2, 2}.
rendering.draw_line{surface = game.player.surface, from = {0, 0}, to = {2, 2}, color = {1, 1, 1}, width = 2}
```

```
-- Draw a red and 3 pixel wide line from {0, 0} to {0, 5}. The line has 1 tile long dashes and gaps.
rendering.draw_line{surface = game.player.surface, from = {0, 0}, to = {0, 5}, color = {r = 1}, width = 3, gap_length = 1, dash_length = 1}
```

parameters.name: dash_length
parameters.description: Length of the dashes that this line has. Used only if gap_length > 0. Default is 0.

parameters.name: dash_offset
parameters.description: Starting offset to apply to dashes. Cannot be greater than dash_length + gap_length. Default is 0.

parameters.name: draw_on_ground
parameters.description: If this should be drawn below sprites and entities. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: forces
parameters.description: The forces that this object is rendered to. Passing `nil` or an empty table will render it to all forces.

parameters.name: gap_length
parameters.description: Length of the gaps that this line has, in tiles. Default is 0.

parameters.name: only_in_alt_mode

parameters.name: players
parameters.description: The players that this object is rendered to. Passing `nil` or an empty table will render it to all players.

parameters.name: time_to_live
parameters.description: In ticks. Defaults to living forever.

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: If this is rendered to anyone at all. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: In pixels (32 per tile).

examples:
```
-- Draw a white and 1 pixel wide square outline with the corners {0, 0} and {2, 2}.
rendering.draw_rectangle{surface = game.player.surface, left_top = {0, 0}, right_bottom = {2, 2}, color = {1, 1, 1}}
```

parameters.name: draw_on_ground
parameters.description: If this should be drawn below sprites and entities. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: filled
parameters.description: If the rectangle should be filled. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: forces
parameters.description: The forces that this object is rendered to. Passing `nil` or an empty table will render it to all forces.

parameters.name: only_in_alt_mode

parameters.name: players
parameters.description: The players that this object is rendered to. Passing `nil` or an empty table will render it to all players.

parameters.name: time_to_live
parameters.description: In ticks. Defaults to living forever.

parameters.name: visible

parameters.name: width

methods.name: draw_sprite
methods.description: Create a sprite.
examples:
```
-- This will draw an iron plate icon at the character's feet. The sprite will move together with the character.
rendering.draw_sprite{sprite = "item.iron-plate", target = game.player.character, surface = game.player.surface}
```

```
-- This will draw an iron plate icon at the character's head. The sprite will move together with the character.
rendering.draw_sprite{sprite = "item.iron-plate", target = {entity = game.player.character, offset = {0, -2}}, surface = game.player.surface}
```

parameters.name: forces

classes.name: LuaSchedule
classes.description: The schedule of a particular [LuaTrain](runtime:LuaTrain) or [LuaSpacePlatform](runtime:LuaSpacePlatform).

methods.name: activate_interrupt
methods.description: Activates the interrupt at the given index, if the index is valid.

methods.name: add_interrupt
methods.description: Adds the given interrupt to the schedule if an interrupt with the given name does not already exist.

methods.name: add_record
methods.description: Adds the given record to the end of the current schedule or at the given index using the provided data.

return_values.description: The index the record was added at.

methods.name: add_wait_condition
methods.description: Adds the given wait condition to the given record.

methods.name: change_interrupt
methods.description: Changes the interrupt at the given index to the provided values. Note, the names must match.

methods.name: change_wait_condition
methods.description: Changes the wait condition on the given record to the new values.

methods.name: clear_interrupts
methods.description: Removes all interrupts.

parameters.name: interrupt_index
parameters.description: If provided, clears the records for this interrupt.

methods.name: copy_record
methods.description: Copies the record from the given schedule at the given index into this schedule at the given index.

parameters.name: interrupt_index
parameters.description: The interrupt to operate on, if any.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The record to change.

methods.name: get_record_count
methods.description: If the given index is invalid, `nil` is returned.

parameters.name: interrupt_index
parameters.description: If provided, the record count in this interrupt is read.

parameters.name: interrupt_index
parameters.description: If provided, gets the records for this interrupt.

methods.name: get_wait_condition
methods.description: Gets the wait condition at the given index if one exists.

methods.name: get_wait_condition_count
methods.description: The number of wait conditions in the given schedule record.

methods.name: get_wait_conditions
methods.description: Gets the wait conditions at the given index if they exist.

parameters.name: schedule_index
parameters.description: The schedule index

methods.name: remove_interrupt
methods.description: Removes the interrupt at the given index, if the index is valid.

methods.name: remove_record
methods.description: Removes the record at the given index, if the index is valid.

methods.name: remove_wait_condition
methods.description: Removes the given wait condition from the given record.

parameters.name: new_name

classes.name: LuaSettings
classes.description: Object containing mod settings of three distinct types: `startup`, `global`, and `player`. An instance of LuaSettings is available through the global object named `settings`.

methods.name: get_player_settings
methods.description:
Gets the current per-player settings for the given player, indexed by prototype name. Returns the same structure as [LuaPlayer::mod_settings](runtime:LuaPlayer::mod_settings). This table becomes invalid if its associated player does.

Even though this attribute is a getter, individual settings can be changed by overwriting their [ModSetting](runtime:ModSetting) table. Mods can only change their own settings. Using the in-game console, all player settings can be changed.
examples:
```
-- Change the value of the "active_lifestyle" setting
settings.get_player_settings(player_index)["active_lifestyle"] = {value = true}
```

attributes.name: global
attributes.description:
The current global mod settings, indexed by prototype name.

Even though this attribute is marked as read-only, individual settings can be changed by overwriting their [ModSetting](runtime:ModSetting) table. Mods can only change their own settings. Using the in-game console, all player settings can be changed.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: player_default
attributes.description:
The **default** player mod settings for this map, indexed by prototype name. Changing these settings only affects the default settings for future players joining the game.

Individual settings can be changed by overwriting their [ModSetting](runtime:ModSetting) table. Mods can only change their own settings. Using the in-game console, all player settings can be changed.

attributes.description: The technology that needs to be researched once (in any save) for this shortcut to be unlocked (in all saves).

Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

parameters.name: invert
parameters.description: If the filters should be inverted.

methods.name: find_asteroid_chunks_filtered
methods.description:
Find asteroid chunks of a given name in a given area.

If no filters are given, returns all asteroid chunks in the search area. If multiple filters are specified, returns only asteroid chunks matching every given filter. If no area and no position are given, the entire surface is searched.
examples:
```
game.surfaces[1].find_asteroid_chunks_filtered{area = {{-10, -10}, {10, 10}}, name = "carbonic-asteroid"} -- gets all asteroids with the given name in the rectangle
game.surfaces[1].find_asteroid_chunks_filtered{area = {{-10, -10}, {10, 10}}, limit = 5}  -- gets the first 5 asteroid chunks in the rectangle
```

parameters.name: invert
parameters.description: If the filters should be inverted.

It is represented as a number in range `[0, 1]`, with 0 being [LuaSpaceConnectionPrototype::from](runtime:LuaSpaceConnectionPrototype::from) and 1 being [LuaSpaceConnectionPrototype::to](runtime:LuaSpaceConnectionPrototype::to).

classes.name: LuaStyle
classes.description: Style of a GUI element. All of the attributes listed here may be `nil` if not available for a particular GUI element.

attributes.name: bottom_cell_padding
attributes.description: Space between the table cell contents bottom and border.

attributes.name: cell_padding
attributes.description: Space between the table cell contents and border. Sets top/right/bottom/left cell paddings to this value.

attributes.name: column_alignments
attributes.description: Array containing the alignment for every column of this table element. Even though this property is marked as read-only, the alignment can be changed by indexing the LuaCustomTable, like so:
examples:
```
table_element.style.column_alignments[1] = "center"
```

attributes.name: extra_margin_when_activated
attributes.description:
Sets `extra_top/right/bottom/left_margin_when_activated` to this value.

An array with two values sets top/bottom margin to the first value and left/right margin to the second value. An array with four values sets top, right, bottom, left margin respectively.

attributes.name: extra_padding_when_activated
attributes.description:
Sets `extra_top/right/bottom/left_padding_when_activated` to this value.

An array with two values sets top/bottom padding to the first value and left/right padding to the second value. An array with four values sets top, right, bottom, left padding respectively.

attributes.name: gui
attributes.description: Gui of the [LuaGuiElement](runtime:LuaGuiElement) of this style.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Sets both minimal and maximal height to the given value.

attributes.name: horizontal_align
attributes.description: Horizontal align of the inner content of the widget, if any.

attributes.name: horizontal_spacing
attributes.description: Horizontal space between individual cells.

attributes.name: horizontally_squashable
attributes.description:
Whether the GUI element can be squashed (by maximal width of some parent element) horizontally. `nil` if this element does not support squashing.

This is mainly meant to be used for scroll-pane. The default value is false.

attributes.name: horizontally_stretchable
attributes.description: Whether the GUI element stretches its size horizontally to other elements. `nil` if this element does not support stretching.

attributes.name: left_cell_padding
attributes.description: Space between the table cell contents left and border.

attributes.name: margin
attributes.description:
Sets top/right/bottom/left margins to this value.

An array with two values sets top/bottom margin to the first value and left/right margin to the second value. An array with four values sets top, right, bottom, left margin respectively.

attributes.name: maximal_height
attributes.description: Maximal height ensures, that the widget will never be bigger than than that size. It can't be stretched to be bigger.

attributes.name: maximal_width
attributes.description: Maximal width ensures, that the widget will never be bigger than than that size. It can't be stretched to be bigger.

attributes.name: minimal_height
attributes.description: Minimal height ensures, that the widget will never be smaller than than that size. It can't be squashed to be smaller.

attributes.name: minimal_width
attributes.description: Minimal width ensures, that the widget will never be smaller than than that size. It can't be squashed to be smaller.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of this style.

attributes.name: natural_height
attributes.description: Natural height specifies the height of the element tries to have, but it can still be squashed/stretched to have a smaller or bigger size.

attributes.name: natural_width
attributes.description: Natural width specifies the width of the element tries to have, but it can still be squashed/stretched to have a smaller or bigger size.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: padding
attributes.description:
Sets top/right/bottom/left paddings to this value.

An array with two values sets top/bottom padding to the first value and left/right padding to the second value. An array with four values sets top, right, bottom, left padding respectively.

attributes.name: rich_text_setting
attributes.description: How this GUI element handles rich text.

attributes.name: right_cell_padding
attributes.description: Space between the table cell contents right and border.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Sets both width and height to the given value. Also accepts an array with two values, setting width to the first and height to the second one.

attributes.name: top_cell_padding
attributes.description: Space between the table cell contents top and border.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: vertical_align
attributes.description: Vertical align of the inner content of the widget, if any.

attributes.name: vertical_spacing
attributes.description: Vertical space between individual cells.

attributes.name: vertically_squashable
attributes.description:
Whether the GUI element can be squashed (by maximal height of some parent element) vertically. `nil` if this element does not support squashing.

This is mainly meant to be used for scroll-pane. The default (parent) value for scroll pane is true, false otherwise.

attributes.name: vertically_stretchable
attributes.description: Whether the GUI element stretches its size vertically to other elements. `nil` if this element does not support stretching.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Sets both minimal and maximal width to the given value.

methods.name: clone_area
methods.description:
Clones the given area.

Entities are cloned in an order such that they can always be created, eg rails before trains.

raises.name: on_area_cloned
raises.description: Raised after the individual `on_entity_cloned` events.

raises.name: on_entity_cloned
raises.description: Raised for every entity that was cloned.

parameters.name: clone_tiles
parameters.description: If tiles should be cloned

parameters.name: create_build_effect_smoke
parameters.description: If true, the building effect smoke will be shown around the new entities. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: expand_map
parameters.description: If the destination surface should be expanded when destination_area is outside current bounds. Defaults to `false`.

methods.name: clone_brush
methods.description:
Clones the given area.

[defines.events.on_entity_cloned](runtime:defines.events.on_entity_cloned) is raised for each entity, and then [defines.events.on_area_cloned](runtime:defines.events.on_area_cloned) is raised.

Entities are cloned in an order such that they can always be created, eg rails before trains.

parameters.name: clear_destination_decoratives

parameters.name: clear_destination_entities
parameters.description: If the destination entities should be cleared

parameters.name: clone_decoratives
parameters.description: If decoratives should be cloned

parameters.name: clone_entities
parameters.description: If entities should be cloned

parameters.name: clone_tiles
parameters.description: If tiles should be cloned

parameters.name: create_build_effect_smoke
parameters.description: If true, the building effect smoke will be shown around the new entities.

parameters.name: expand_map
parameters.description: If the destination surface should be expanded when destination_area is outside current bounds. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: manual_collision_mode
parameters.description: If manual-style collision checks should be done.

methods.name: clone_entities
methods.description:
Clones the given entities.

Entities are cloned in an order such that they can always be created, eg rails before trains.

raises.name: on_entity_cloned
raises.description: Raised for every entity that was cloned.

parameters.name: create_build_effect_smoke
parameters.description: If true, the building effect smoke will be shown around the new entities.

methods.name: count_entities_filtered
methods.description:
Count entities of given type or name in a given area. Works just like [LuaSurface::find_entities_filtered](runtime:LuaSurface::find_entities_filtered), except this only returns the count. As it doesn't construct all the wrapper objects, this is more efficient if one is only interested in the number of entities.

- If no `area` or `position` are given, the entire surface is searched.

- If `position` is given, this returns the entities colliding with that position (i.e the given position is within the entity's collision box).

- If `position` and `radius` are given, this returns entities in the radius of the position.

- If `area` is specified, this returns entities colliding with that area.

methods.name: count_tiles_filtered
methods.description:
Count tiles of a given name in a given area. Works just like [LuaSurface::find_tiles_filtered](runtime:LuaSurface::find_tiles_filtered), except this only returns the count. As it doesn't construct all the wrapper objects, this is more efficient if one is only interested in the number of tiles.

If no `area` or `position` and `radius` is given, the entire surface is searched. If `position` and `radius` are given, only tiles within the radius of the position are included.

methods.name: create_decoratives
methods.description:
Adds the given decoratives to the surface.

This will merge decoratives of the same type that already exist effectively increasing the "amount" field.

parameters.name: check_collision
parameters.description: If collision should be checked against entities/tiles.

methods.name: create_entity
methods.description: Create an entity on this surface.
examples:
```
game.surfaces[1].create_entity{name = "big-biter", position = {15, 3}, force = game.forces.player} -- Friendly biter
game.surfaces[1].create_entity{name = "medium-biter", position = {15, 3}, force = game.forces.enemy} -- Enemy biter
```

```
-- Creates a basic inserter at the player's location facing north
game.surfaces[1].create_entity{name = "inserter", position = game.player.position, direction = defines.direction.north}
```

raises.name: script_raised_built
raises.description: Raised if the `raise_built` flag was set and the entity was successfully created.

parameters.name: cause
parameters.description: Cause entity / force. The entity or force that triggered the chain of events that led to this entity being created. Used for beams, projectiles, stickers, etc. so that the damage receiver can know which entity or force to retaliate against.

parameters.name: character
parameters.description: If fast_replace is true simulate fast replace using this character.

parameters.name: create_build_effect_smoke
parameters.description: If false, the building effect smoke will not be shown around the new entity. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Desired orientation of the entity after creation.

parameters.name: fast_replace
parameters.description: If true, building will attempt to simulate fast-replace building. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force of the entity, default is enemy.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: If provided, the entity will attempt to pull stored values from this item (for example; creating a spidertron from a previously named and mined spidertron)

parameters.name: item_index
parameters.description: The index of the undo item to add this action to. An index of `0` creates a new undo item for it. Defaults to putting it into the appropriate undo item automatically if not specified.

parameters.name: move_stuck_players
parameters.description: If true, any characters that are in the way of the entity are teleported out of the way.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The entity prototype name to create.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: If given set the last_user to this player. If fast_replace is true simulate fast replace using this player. Also the player whose undo queue this action should be added to.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where to create the entity.

parameters.name: preserve_ghosts_and_corpses
parameters.description: If true, colliding ghosts and corpses will not be removed by the creation of some entity types. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: Quality of the entity to be created. Defaults to `normal`.

parameters.name: raise_built
parameters.description: If true; [defines.events.script_raised_built](runtime:defines.events.script_raised_built) will be fired on successful entity creation. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: snap_to_grid
parameters.description: If false the exact position given is used to instead of snapping to the normal entity grid. This only applies if the entity normally snaps to the grid.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source entity. Used for beams, projectiles, and highlight-boxes.

parameters.name: spawn_decorations
parameters.description: If true, entity types that have [spawn_decoration](runtime:LuaEntityPrototype::spawn_decorations) property will apply triggers defined in the property. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: spill
parameters.description: If false while fast_replace is true and player is nil any items from fast-replacing will be deleted instead of dropped on the ground. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Entity with health for the new entity to target.

parameters.name: speed
parameters.description: Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: If set, beam will be destroyed after this value of ticks.

parameters.name: max_length
parameters.description: If set, beam will be destroyed when distance between source and target is greater than this value.

parameters.name: source_offset
parameters.description: Source position will be offset by this value when rendering the beam.

parameters.name: source_position
parameters.description: Absolute source position that can be used instead of source entity (entity has precedence if both entity and position are defined).

parameters.name: target_position
parameters.description: Absolute target position that can be used instead of target entity (entity has precedence if both entity and position are defined).

parameters.name: cliff_orientation
parameters.description: If not specified, `direction` will be used instead.

parameters.name: bar
parameters.description: Inventory index where the red limiting bar should be set.

parameters.name: auto_connect
parameters.description: True by default. If set to false, created electric pole will not auto connect to neighbour electric poles.

parameters.name: inner_name
parameters.description: The prototype name of the entity contained in the ghost.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: The [LuaEntity::tags](runtime:LuaEntity::tags) associated with this entity ghost.

parameters.name: initial_ground_flame_count
parameters.description: With how many small flames should the fire on ground be created. Defaults to the initial flame count of the prototype.

parameters.name: blink_interval
parameters.description: The blink interval for this highlight box. Makes it be shown every `blink_interval` ticks. Defaults to `0` (constantly shown).

parameters.name: bounding_box
parameters.description: The bounding box defining the highlight box using absolute map coordinates. If specified, the general `position` parameter still needs to be present, but will be ignored. If not specified, the game falls back to the `source` parameter first, then the `target` parameter second. One of these three parameters need to be specified.

parameters.name: box_type
parameters.description: Specifies the graphical appearance (color) of the highlight box. Defaults to `"electricity"`.

parameters.name: render_player_index
parameters.description: The player to render the highlight box for. If not provided, it will be rendered for all players.

parameters.name: time_to_live
parameters.description: The amount of time in ticks that the highlight box will exist for. Defaults to existing forever.

parameters.name: stack
parameters.description: The stack of items to create.

parameters.name: modules
parameters.description: The stacks of items to be delivered to target entity from logistic network.

parameters.name: removal_plan
parameters.description: Specification of items to be removed from the target entity by the logistic network.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target items are to be delivered to.

parameters.name: always_on
parameters.description: Defaults to false.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Defaults to white.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Defaults to `"input"`.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Defaults to `"input"`.

parameters.name: snap_to_train_stop
parameters.description: Whether the locomotive should snap to an adjacent train stop. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: tick_grown
parameters.description: The tick the plant will be fully grown. If not specified, the plants normal growth time is used.

parameters.name: max_range
parameters.description: Defaults to 1000.

parameters.name: speed
parameters.description: Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: rail_layer
parameters.description: Defaults to [defines.rail_layer.ground](runtime:defines.rail_layer.ground).

parameters.name: rail_layer
parameters.description: Defaults to [defines.rail_layer.ground](runtime:defines.rail_layer.ground).

parameters.name: enable_cliff_removal
parameters.description: If colliding cliffs are removed. Default is true.

parameters.name: enable_tree_removal
parameters.description: If colliding trees are removed normally for this resource entity based off the prototype tree removal values. Default is true.

parameters.name: snap_to_tile_center
parameters.description: If true, the resource entity will be placed to center of a tile as map generator would place it, otherwise standard non-resource grid alignment rules will apply. Default is true.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color of this rolling stock, if it supports colors.

parameters.name: orientation
parameters.description: The orientation of this rolling stock.

parameters.name: source_position
parameters.description: Absolute source position that can be used instead of source entity (entity has precedence if both entity and position are defined).

parameters.name: target_position
parameters.description: Absolute target position that can be used instead of target entity (entity has precedence if both entity and position are defined).

parameters.name: inner_name
parameters.description: The prototype name of the tile contained in the ghost.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Defaults to `"input"`.

methods.name: find_decoratives_filtered
methods.description:
Find decoratives of a given name in a given area.

If no filters are given, returns all decoratives in the search area. If multiple filters are specified, returns only decoratives matching every given filter. If no area and no position are given, the entire surface is searched.
examples:
```
game.surfaces[1].find_decoratives_filtered{area = {{-10, -10}, {10, 10}}, name = "sand-decal"} -- gets all sand-decals in the rectangle
game.surfaces[1].find_decoratives_filtered{area = {{-10, -10}, {10, 10}}, limit = 5}  -- gets the first 5 decoratives in the rectangle
```

parameters.name: exclude_soft
parameters.description: Soft decoratives can be drawn over rails.

parameters.name: invert
parameters.description: If the filters should be inverted.

methods.name: find_enemy_units
methods.description:
Find enemy units (entities with type "unit") of a given force within an area.

This is more efficient than [LuaSurface::find_entities](runtime:LuaSurface::find_entities).
examples:
```
-- Find all units who would be interested to attack the player, within 100-tile area.
local enemies = game.player.surface.find_enemy_units(game.player.position, 100)
```

parameters.name: center
parameters.description: Center of the search area

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force to find enemies of. If not given, uses the player force.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Radius of the circular search area

methods.name: find_entities
methods.description:
Find entities in a given area.

If no area is given all entities on the surface are returned.
examples:
```
-- Will evaluate to a list of all entities within given area.
game.surfaces["nauvis"].find_entities({{-10, -10}, {10, 10}})
```

methods.name: find_entities_filtered
methods.description:
Find all entities of the given type or name in the given area.

If no filters (`name`, `type`, `force`, etc.) are given, this returns all entities in the search area. If multiple filters are specified, only entities matching all given filters are returned.

- If no `area` or `position` are given, the entire surface is searched.

- If `position` is given, this returns the entities colliding with that position (i.e the given position is within the entity's collision box).

- If `position` and `radius` are given, this returns the entities within the radius of the position. Looks for the center of entities.

- If `area` is specified, this returns the entities colliding with that area.
examples:
```
game.surfaces[1].find_entities_filtered{area = {{-10, -10}, {10, 10}}, type = "resource"} -- gets all resources in the rectangle
game.surfaces[1].find_entities_filtered{area = {{-10, -10}, {10, 10}}, name = "iron-ore"} -- gets all iron ores in the rectangle
game.surfaces[1].find_entities_filtered{area = {{-10, -10}, {10, 10}}, name = {"iron-ore", "copper-ore"}} -- gets all iron ore and copper ore in the rectangle
game.surfaces[1].find_entities_filtered{area = {{-10, -10}, {10, 10}}, force = "player"}  -- gets player owned entities in the rectangle
game.surfaces[1].find_entities_filtered{area = {{-10, -10}, {10, 10}}, limit = 5}  -- gets the first 5 entities in the rectangle
game.surfaces[1].find_entities_filtered{position = {0, 0}, radius = 10}  -- gets all entities within 10 tiles of the position [0,0].
```

methods.name: find_entity
methods.description: Find an entity of the given name at the given position. This checks both the exact position and the bounding box of the entity.
examples:
```
game.player.selected.surface.find_entity('filter-inserter', {0,0})
```

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: Name of the entity to look for.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Coordinates to look at.

return_values.description: `nil` if no such entity is found.

parameters.name: force

parameters.name: position

return_values.description: The nearest enemy military target or `nil` if no enemy could be found within the given area.

methods.name: find_nearest_enemy_entity_with_owner

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force the result will be an enemy of. Uses the player force if not specified.

parameters.name: max_distance
parameters.description: Radius of the circular search area.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Center of the search area.

return_values.description: The nearest enemy entity-with-owner or `nil` if no enemy could be found within the given area.

methods.name: find_non_colliding_position
methods.description:
Find a non-colliding position within a given radius.

Special care needs to be taken when using a radius of `0`. The game will not stop searching until it finds a suitable position, so it is important to make sure such a position exists. One particular case where it would not be able to find a solution is running it before any chunks have been generated.

parameters.name: center
parameters.description: Center of the search area.

parameters.name: force_to_tile_center
parameters.description: Will only check tile centers. This can be useful when your intent is to place a building at the resulting position, as they must generally be placed at tile centers. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Prototype name of the entity to find a position for. (The bounding box for the collision checking is taken from this prototype.)

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The step length from the given position as it searches, in tiles. Minimum value is `0.01`.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Max distance from `center` to search in. A radius of `0` means an infinitely-large search area.

return_values.description: The non-colliding position. May be `nil` if no suitable position was found.

methods.name: find_non_colliding_position_in_box
methods.description: Find a non-colliding position within a given rectangle.

parameters.name: force_to_tile_center
parameters.description: Will only check tile centers. This can be useful when your intent is to place a building at the resulting position, as they must generally be placed at tile centers. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Prototype name of the entity to find a position for. (The bounding box for the collision checking is taken from this prototype.)

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The step length from the given position as it searches, in tiles. Minimum value is 0.01.

parameters.name: search_space
parameters.description: The rectangle to search inside.

return_values.description: The non-colliding position. May be `nil` if no suitable position was found.

methods.name: find_tiles_filtered
methods.description:
Find all tiles of the given name in the given area.

If no filters are given, this returns all tiles in the search area.

If no `area` or `position` and `radius` is given, the entire surface is searched. If `position` and `radius` are given, only tiles within the radius of the position are included.

methods.name: find_units
methods.description:
Find units (entities with type "unit") of a given force and force condition within a given area.

This is more efficient than [LuaSurface::find_entities](runtime:LuaSurface::find_entities).
examples:
```
-- Find friendly units to "player" force
local friendly_units = game.player.surface.find_units({area = {{-10, -10},{10, 10}}, force = "player", condition = "friend")
```

```
-- Find units of "player" force
local units = game.player.surface.find_units({area = {{-10, -10},{10, 10}}, force = "player", condition = "same"})
```

parameters.name: area
parameters.description: Box to find units within.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: Only forces which meet the condition will be included in the search.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force performing the search.

methods.name: request_path
methods.description:
Generates a path with the specified constraints (as an array of [PathfinderWaypoints](runtime:PathfinderWaypoint)) using the unit pathfinding algorithm. This path can be used to emulate pathing behavior by script for non-unit entities, such as vehicles. If you want to command actual units (such as biters or spitters) to move, use [LuaCommandable::set_command](runtime:LuaCommandable::set_command) via [LuaEntity::commandable](runtime:LuaEntity::commandable) instead.

The resulting path is ultimately returned asynchronously via [on_script_path_request_finished](runtime:on_script_path_request_finished).

parameters.name: bounding_box
parameters.description: The dimensions of the object that's supposed to travel the path.

parameters.name: can_open_gates
parameters.description: Whether the path request can open gates. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: collision_mask
parameters.description: The collision mask the `bounding_box` collides with.

parameters.name: entity_to_ignore
parameters.description: Makes the pathfinder ignore collisions with this entity if it is given.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force for which to generate the path, determining which gates can be opened for example.

parameters.name: goal
parameters.description: The position to find a path to.

parameters.name: max_attack_distance
parameters.description: Defines the maximum allowed distance between the last traversable path waypoint and an obstacle entity to be destroyed. Only used when finding a discontiguous path, i.e. when `max_gap_size` > 0. This field filters out paths that are blocked by obstacles that are outside the entity's attack range. Allowed values are `0` or greater. Defaults to `max_gap_size`.

parameters.name: max_gap_size
parameters.description: Defines the maximum allowed distance between path waypoints. 0 means that paths must be contiguous (as they are for biters). Values greater than 0 will produce paths with "gaps" that are suitable for spiders. Allowed values are from `0` to `31`. Defaults to `0`.

parameters.name: path_resolution_modifier
parameters.description: Defines how coarse the pathfinder's grid is, where smaller values mean a coarser grid. Defaults to `0`, which equals a resolution of `1x1` tiles, centered on tile centers. Values range from `-8` to `8` inclusive, where each integer increment doubles/halves the resolution. So, a resolution of `-8` equals a grid of `256x256` tiles, and a resolution of `8` equals `1/256` of a tile.

parameters.name: pathfind_flags
parameters.description: Flags that affect pathfinder behavior.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: How close the pathfinder needs to get to its `goal` (in tiles). Defaults to `1`.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The position from which to start pathfinding.

return_values.description: A unique handle to identify this call when [on_script_path_request_finished](runtime:on_script_path_request_finished) fires.

methods.name: request_to_generate_chunks
methods.description: Request that the game's map generator generate chunks at the given position for the given radius on this surface. If the radius is `0`, then only the chunk at the given position is generated.

parameters.name: position

parameters.name: radius

Set double hidden tile for the specified position. During normal gameplay, only [non-mineable](runtime:LuaTilePrototype::mineable_properties) tiles can become double hidden.

Does nothing if hidden tile at specified position does not exist.

methods.name: set_hidden_tile
methods.description: Set the hidden tile for the specified position. While during normal gameplay only [non-mineable](runtime:LuaTilePrototype::mineable_properties) or [foundation](runtime:LuaTilePrototype::is_foundation) tiles can become hidden, this method allows any kind of tile to be set as the hidden one.

parameters.name: position

return_values.description: Number of units actually sent. May be less than `count` if not enough units were available.

methods.name: set_tiles
methods.description:
Set tiles at specified locations. Can automatically correct the edges around modified tiles.

Placing a [mineable](runtime:LuaTilePrototype::mineable_properties) tile on top of a non-mineable or [foundation](runtime:LuaTilePrototype::is_foundation) one will turn the latter into the [LuaTile::hidden_tile](runtime:LuaTile::hidden_tile) for that tile. Placing a mineable non-foundation tile on a mineable non-foundation one or a mineable foundation tile on a mineable foundation one will not modify the hidden tile. This restriction can however be circumvented by using [LuaSurface::set_hidden_tile](runtime:LuaSurface::set_hidden_tile). Placing a non-foundation tile on top of a foundation one when there already exists a hidden tile will push hidden tile to [double hidden](runtime:LuaTile::double_hidden_tile), and foundation tile will turn into hidden. Placing a mineable foundation tile over a mineable non-foundation tile with hidden mineable foundation tile, the hidden tile will be replaced by previously double hidden tile and double hidden tile will be erased. Placing a non-mineable tile will erase hidden and double hidden tiles.

It is recommended to call this method once for all the tiles you want to change rather than calling it individually for every tile. As the tile correction is used after every step, calling it one by one could cause the tile correction logic to redo some of the changes. Also, many small API calls are generally more performance intensive than one big one.

raises.name: script_raised_set_tiles
raises.description: Raised if the `raise_event` flag was set.

parameters.name: correct_tiles
parameters.description: If `false`, the correction logic is not applied to the changed tiles. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player whose undo queue to add these actions to.

parameters.name: raise_event
parameters.description: Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: remove_colliding_decoratives
parameters.description: Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: remove_colliding_entities
parameters.description: Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: undo_index
parameters.description: The index of the undo item to add this action to. An index of `0` creates a new undo item for it. Defaults to putting it into the appropriate undo item automatically if not specified.

methods.name: spill_item_stack

parameters.name: allow_belts
parameters.description: Whether items can be spilled onto belts. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: enable_looted
parameters.description: When true, each created item will be flagged with the [LuaEntity::to_be_looted](runtime:LuaEntity::to_be_looted) flag. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: When provided (and not `nil`) the items will be marked for deconstruction by this force.

parameters.name: max_radius
parameters.description: Max radius from the specified `position` to spill items.

parameters.name: position

parameters.name: stack

parameters.name: use_start_position_on_failure
parameters.description: Allow spilling items at `position` if no non-colliding position is found. Note: Setting to false might cause some items not to be spilled. Defaults to `true`.

return_values.description: The created item-on-ground entities.

attributes.name: always_day
attributes.description: When set to true, the sun will always shine.

attributes.name: brightness_visual_weights
attributes.description:
Defines how surface daytime brightness influences each color channel of the current color lookup table (LUT).

The LUT is multiplied by `((1 - weight) + brightness * weight)` and result is clamped to range `[0, 1]`.

Default is `{0, 0, 0}`, which means no influence.
examples:
```
-- Makes night on the surface pitch black, LuaSurface::min_brightness is set to default value 0.15.
game.surfaces[1].brightness_visual_weights = { 1 / 0.85, 1 / 0.85, 1 / 0.85 }
```

attributes.name: darkness
attributes.description: Amount of darkness at the current time, as a number in range `[0, 1]`.

attributes.name: dawn
attributes.description: The daytime when dawn starts.

attributes.name: daytime
attributes.description: Current time of day, as a number in range `[0, 1)`.

attributes.name: deletable
attributes.description: If this surface can be deleted.

attributes.name: dusk
attributes.description: The daytime when dusk starts.

attributes.name: evening
attributes.description: The daytime when evening starts.

attributes.name: freeze_daytime

attributes.name: generate_with_lab_tiles

attributes.name: global_effect

attributes.name: has_global_electric_network

attributes.name: localised_name

Value may be ignored if a surface has a SpacePlatform or Planet object attached to it, which take the precedence.

attributes.name: map_gen_settings
attributes.description: The generation settings for this surface. These can be modified after surface generation, but note that this will not retroactively update the surface. To manually regenerate it, [LuaSurface::regenerate_entity](runtime:LuaSurface::regenerate_entity), [LuaSurface::regenerate_decorative](runtime:LuaSurface::regenerate_decorative), and [LuaSurface::delete_chunk](runtime:LuaSurface::delete_chunk) can be used.

attributes.name: min_brightness
attributes.description: The minimal brightness during the night. Defaults to `0.15`. This has an effect on both rendering and game mechanics such as biter spawns and solar power.

attributes.name: morning

attributes.name: name
attributes.description:
The name of this surface. Names are unique among surfaces.

The default surface can't be renamed.

attributes.name: object_name

attributes.name: peaceful_mode

It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.description: Back end of the train: Rail and direction on that rail where the train will go when moving backward

attributes.name: back_stock
attributes.description: The back stock of this train, if any. The back of the train is at the opposite end of the [front](runtime:LuaTrain::front_stock).

attributes.name: cargo_wagons
attributes.description: The cargo carriages the train contains.

attributes.name: carriages
attributes.description: The rolling stocks this train is composed of, with the numbering starting at the [front](runtime:LuaTrain::front_stock) of the train.

attributes.name: fluid_wagons
attributes.description: The fluid carriages the train contains.

attributes.name: front_end
attributes.description: Front end of the train: Rail and direction on that rail where the train will go when moving forward

attributes.name: front_stock
attributes.description: The front stock of this train, if any. The front of the train is in the direction that a majority of locomotives are pointing in. If it's a tie, the North and West directions take precedence.

attributes.name: group
attributes.description:
The group this train belongs to.

Setting the group will apply the schedule of the group to this train.

attributes.name: has_path
attributes.description: If this train has a path.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The unique train ID.

attributes.name: kill_count
attributes.description: The total number of kills by this train.

attributes.name: killed_players
attributes.description:
The players killed by this train.

The keys are the player indices, the values are how often this train killed that player.

attributes.name: locomotives
attributes.description: Locomotives of the train.
examples:
```
-- called on a LuaTrain with 3 locomotives, it returns 3 LuaEntities:
train.locomotives -- => {front_movers = {loco1, loco2}, back_movers = {loco3}}
```

parameters.name: back_movers
parameters.description: Array of locomotives.

parameters.name: front_movers
parameters.description: Array of locomotives.

attributes.name: manual_mode
attributes.description: When `true`, the train is explicitly controlled by the player or script. When `false`, the train moves autonomously according to its schedule.

attributes.name: max_backward_speed
attributes.description: Current max speed when moving backwards, depends on locomotive prototype and fuel.

attributes.name: max_forward_speed
attributes.description: Current max speed when moving forward, depends on locomotive prototype and fuel.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: passengers
attributes.description:
The player passengers on the train

This does *not* index using player index. See [LuaPlayer::index](runtime:LuaPlayer::index) on each player instance for the player index.

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: The path this train is using, if any.

attributes.name: path_end_rail
attributes.description: The destination rail this train is currently pathing to, if any.

attributes.name: path_end_stop
attributes.description: The destination train stop this train is currently pathing to, if any.

attributes.name: riding_state
attributes.description: The riding state of this train.

attributes.name: schedule
attributes.description:
This train's current schedule, if any. Set to `nil` to clear.

The schedule can't be changed by modifying the returned table. Instead, changes must be made by assigning a new table to this attribute.

attributes.name: signal
attributes.description: The signal this train is arriving or waiting at, if any.

attributes.name: speed
attributes.description:
Current speed.

Changing the speed of the train is potentially an unsafe operation because train uses the speed for its internal calculations of break distances, etc.

attributes.name: state
attributes.description: This train's current state.

attributes.name: station
attributes.description: The train stop this train is stopped at, if any.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: weight
attributes.description: The weight of this train.

classes.name: LuaTrainManager
classes.description:
The train manager manages all the train in the game. LuaTrainManager allows to perform some direct queries to the train manager.

There is always exactly one train manager instance in a game, it can be obtained from [LuaGameScript::train_manager](runtime:LuaGameScript::train_manager). This object is always valid and is equal to any other instance of LuaTrainManager from this game.

methods.name: get_train_by_id
methods.description: Searches for a train with given ID.

parameters.name: train_id
parameters.description: Train ID to search

return_values.description: Train if found

methods.name: get_train_stops
methods.description: Gets all train stops that pass given filter

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters the train stop must pass in order to be returned here

methods.name: get_trains
methods.description: Gets all trains that pass given filter

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters the train must pass in order to be returned here

methods.name: request_train_path
methods.description: Direct access to train pathfinder. Allows to search rail paths or querying which stops are accessible

parameters.name: in_chain_signal_section
parameters.description: Defaults to `false`. If set to true, pathfinder will not return a path that cannot have its start immediately reserved. A path that cannot have its start immediately reserved could cause a train to stop inside of an intersection.

parameters.name: return_path
parameters.description: Only relevant if request type is `"path"`. Returning a full path is expensive due to multiple LuaEntity created. In order for path to be returned, true must be provided here. Defaults to false in which case a path will not be provided.

parameters.name: search_direction
parameters.description: Only relevant if `starts` was not provided in which case 2 starts (front and back) are deduced from the train. Selects which train ends should be considered as starts. Defaults to `"any-direction-with-locomotives"`.

parameters.name: shortest_path
parameters.description: Defaults to `false`. If set to true, only length of rails is added to penalties causing search to look for shortest path (not smallest penalty)

parameters.name: starts
parameters.description: Manually provided starting positions.

parameters.name: steps_limit
parameters.description: Maximum amount of steps pathfinder is allowed to perform.

parameters.name: train
parameters.description: Mandatory if `starts` is not provided, optional otherwise. Selects a context for the pathfinder to decide which train to exclude from penalties and which signals are considered possible to reacquire. If `starts` is not provided, then it is also used to collect front and back ends for the search

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Request type. Determines the return type of the method. Defaults to `"path"`.

return_values.description: The type of the returned value depends on `type`.

classes.name: LuaTransportLine
classes.description: One line on a transport belt.

methods.name: can_insert_at
methods.description: Can an item be inserted at a given position?

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where to insert an item.

methods.description: Can an item be inserted at the back of this line?

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Remove all items from this transport line.

methods.name: force_insert_at
methods.description: Force insert item at a given position. Inserts item onto a transport line. If a position is out of range, it is clamped to a closest valid position on the transport line. Item will be inserted regardless of other items nearby, possibly forcing items to become squashed.

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: Items to insert.

parameters.name: position

return_values.description: List of all items on this line.

methods.name: get_detailed_contents

methods.name: get_item_count
methods.description: Count some or all items on this line, similar to how [LuaInventory::get_item_count](runtime:LuaInventory::get_item_count) does.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: If not specified, count all items.

methods.name: line_equals

Returns whether the associated internal transport line of this line is the same as the others associated internal transport line.

This can return true even when the [LuaTransportLine::owner](runtime:LuaTransportLine::owner)s are different (so `this == other` is false), because the internal transport lines can span multiple tiles.

classes.name: LuaWireConnector
classes.description: A wire connector of a given entity. Allows to find wires, add or remove wires and do some basic operations specific to those connectors.

methods.name: can_wire_reach
methods.description: Checks if a wire can reach from this connector to the other connector.

parameters.description: Origin of the wire. Defaults to `defines.wire_origin.player`.

parameters.description: True by default. For wires out of reach or on different surfaces, `false` must be provided.

parameters.description: Other connector to which a wire should be added.

return_values.description: Whether a connection was made.

methods.name: disconnect_all
methods.description: Removes all wires going out of this wire connector.

parameters.description: Origin of the wires to remove. Defaults to `defines.wire_origin.player`.

return_values.description: True if any wire was removed.

methods.description: Disconnects this connector from other wire connector.

parameters.name: target

return_values.description: Whether a connection was removed.

methods.description: Checks if this and other wire connector have a common neighbour.

parameters.description: Other connector to check for common neighbour.

attributes.name: connection_count
attributes.description: Amount of wires going out of this connector. It includes all wires (ghost wires and real wires).

attributes.name: connections
attributes.description: All wire connectors this connector is connected to.

attributes.name: is_ghost
attributes.description: If this connector is owned by an entity inside of a ghost. If any of 2 ends of a wire attaches to a ghost connector, then a wire is considered to be a ghost.

attributes.name: network_id
attributes.description: Index of a CircuitNetwork or ElectricSubNetwork which is going through this wire connector. Returns 0 if there is no network associated with this wire connector right now. CircuitNetwork indexes are independent of indexes of ElectricSubNetwork so they may collide with each other.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: owner
attributes.description: The entity this wire connector belongs to. May return entity ghost instead if this wire connector belongs to inner entity.

attributes.name: real_connection_count
attributes.description: Amount of real wires going out of this connector. It only includes wires for which both wire connectors are real.

attributes.name: real_connections

Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: wire_type
attributes.description: The type of wires that can be connected to this connector.

events.name: CustomInputEvent
events.description: Called when a [CustomInputPrototype](prototype:CustomInputPrototype) is activated.
examples:
```
-- This will be raised when a custom input with the name "my-potato-control" and action "lua" is pressed
script.on_event("my-potato-control", function(event)
  game.print("Keyboard shortcut pressed on tick: " ..tostring(event.tick))
end)
```
