events.description:
Called when a biter migration builds a base.

This will be called multiple times for each migration, once for every biter that is sacrificed to build part of the new base.

events.name: on_brush_cloned
events.description: Called when a set of positions on the map is cloned.

events.name: on_build_base_arrived
events.description: Called when a [defines.command.build_base](runtime:defines.command.build_base) command reaches its destination, and before building starts.

data.name: group
data.description: The unit group the command was assigned to.

data.name: unit
data.description: The unit the command was assigned to.

events.name: on_built_entity
events.description: Called when player builds something.

data.name: tags
data.description: The tags associated with this entity if any.

events.name: on_cancelled_deconstruction
events.description: Called when the deconstruction of an entity is canceled.

events.name: on_cancelled_upgrade
events.description: Called when the upgrade of an entity is canceled.

events.name: on_cargo_pod_delivered_cargo
events.description: Called after a cargo pod has delivered its cargo.

data.name: spawned_container
data.description: The spawned container if any. Created when destination type is [surface](runtime:defines.cargo_destination.surface).

events.name: on_cargo_pod_finished_ascending
events.description: Called when a cargo pod departs a surface.

data.name: launched_by_rocket
data.description: True for pods spawned on a rocket. This event triggers for platform and modded pods as well, but only when true will the pod count towards rocket launch statistics and trigger 'rocket-launched' achievement with objective_condition.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player that is riding the cargo pod, if any.

events.name: on_cargo_pod_finished_descending
events.description: Called when a cargo pods lands on a surface, either at a station or on the ground.

data.name: launched_by_rocket
data.description: True for pods spawned on a rocket.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player that is riding the cargo pod, if any.

events.name: on_character_corpse_expired
events.description:
Called when a character corpse expires due to timeout or all of the items being removed from it.

this is not called if the corpse is mined. See [defines.events.on_pre_player_mined_item](runtime:defines.events.on_pre_player_mined_item) to detect that.

events.name: on_chart_tag_added
events.description: Called when a chart tag is created.

events.name: on_chart_tag_modified
events.description: Called when a chart tag is modified by a player.

events.name: on_chart_tag_removed
events.description: Called just before a chart tag is deleted.

events.name: on_chunk_charted
events.description: Called when a chunk is charted or re-charted.

events.name: on_chunk_deleted
events.description: Called when one or more chunks are deleted using [LuaSurface::delete_chunk](runtime:LuaSurface::delete_chunk).

events.name: on_chunk_generated
events.description: Called when a chunk is generated.

data.name: surface
data.description: The surface the chunk is on.

events.name: on_combat_robot_expired
events.description: Called when a combat robot expires through a lack of energy, or timeout.

data.name: owner
data.description: The entity that owns the robot if any.

events.name: on_console_chat
events.description:
Called when a message is sent to the in-game console, either by a player or through the server interface.

This event only fires for plain messages, not for any commands (including `/shout` or `/whisper`).

data.name: message
data.description: The chat message that was sent.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player doing the chatting, if any.

events.name: on_console_command
events.description: Called when someone enters a command-like message regardless of it being a valid command.

data.name: command
data.description: The command as typed without the preceding forward slash ('/').

events.name: on_cutscene_cancelled
events.description: Called when a cutscene is cancelled by the player or by script.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player the cutscene was shown to.

events.name: on_cutscene_finished
events.description: Called when a cutscene finishes naturally (was not cancelled).

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player the cutscene was shown to.

events.name: on_cutscene_started
events.description: Called when a cutscene starts.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player the cutscene is being shown to.

events.name: on_cutscene_waypoint_reached
events.description:
Called when a cutscene is playing, each time it reaches a waypoint in that cutscene.

This refers to an index in the table previously passed to set_controller which started the cutscene.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player index of the player viewing the cutscene.

data.name: waypoint_index
data.description: The index of the waypoint we just completed.

events.name: on_entity_cloned
events.description: Called when an entity is cloned. The filter applies to the source entity.

events.name: on_entity_color_changed
events.description:
Called after an entity has been recolored either by the player or through script.

Automatic recoloring due to [LuaPlayer::color](runtime:LuaPlayer::color) will not raise events, as that is a separate mechanism.

events.name: on_entity_damaged
events.description: Called when an entity is damaged. This is not called when an entities health is set directly by another mod.

data.name: cause
data.description: The entity that originally triggered the events that led to this damage, if available (e.g. the character, turret, etc. that pulled the trigger).

data.name: final_health
data.description: The health of the entity after the damage was applied.

data.name: force
data.description: The force that did the attacking if any.

data.name: source
data.description: The entity that is directly dealing the damage, if available (e.g. the projectile, flame, sticker, grenade, laser beam, etc.).

events.name: on_entity_died
events.description: Called when an entity dies.

data.name: cause
data.description: The entity that did the killing if available.

data.name: force
data.description: The force that did the killing if any.

data.name: loot
data.description: The loot generated by this entity if any.

events.name: on_entity_logistic_slot_changed
events.description: Called when one of an entity's logistic slots changes.

data.name: entity
data.description: The entity for whom a logistic slot was changed.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player who changed the slot, or `nil` if changed by script.

data.name: slot_index
data.description: The slot index that was changed.

events.name: on_entity_renamed
events.description: Called after an entity has been renamed either by the player or through script.

data.name: player_index
data.description: If by_script is true this will not be included.

events.name: on_entity_settings_pasted
events.description: Called after entity copy-paste is done.

data.name: destination
data.description: The destination entity settings were copied to.

data.name: source
data.description: The source entity settings were copied from.

events.name: on_entity_spawned
events.description: Called when an entity is spawned by a EnemySpawner

events.name: on_equipment_inserted
events.description: Called after equipment is inserted into an equipment grid.

events.name: on_equipment_removed
events.description: Called after equipment is removed from an equipment grid.

events.name: on_force_cease_fire_changed
events.description: Called when the a forces cease fire values change.

data.name: added
data.description: If the other force was added or removed.

data.name: force
data.description: The force who's cease fire changed.

data.name: other_force
data.description: Which force was added or removed.

events.name: on_force_created
events.description:
Called when a new force is created using `game.create_force()`

This is not called when the default forces (`'player'`, `'enemy'`, `'neutral'`) are created as they will always exist.

events.name: on_force_friends_changed
events.description: Called when the a forces friends change.

data.name: added
data.description: If the other force was added or removed.

data.name: other_force
data.description: Which force was added or removed.

events.name: on_force_reset
events.description: Called when [LuaForce::reset](runtime:LuaForce::reset) is finished.

events.name: on_forces_merged
events.description:
Called after two forces have been merged using `game.merge_forces()`.

The source force is invalidated before this event is called and the name can be re-used in this event if desired.

data.name: destination
data.description: The force entities where reassigned to.

data.name: source_index
data.description: The index of the destroyed force.

events.name: on_forces_merging
events.description: Called when two forces are about to be merged using `game.merge_forces()`.

data.name: destination
data.description: The force to reassign entities to.

events.name: on_game_created_from_scenario
events.description:
Called when a game is created from a scenario. This is fired for every mod, even when the scenario's save data already includes it. In those cases however, [LuaBootstrap::on_init](runtime:LuaBootstrap::on_init) is not fired.

This event is not fired when the scenario is loaded via the map editor.

events.name: on_gui_checked_state_changed
events.description: Called when [LuaGuiElement](runtime:LuaGuiElement) checked state is changed (related to checkboxes and radio buttons).

data.name: element
data.description: The element whose checked state changed.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player who did the change.

events.name: on_gui_click
events.description: Called when [LuaGuiElement](runtime:LuaGuiElement) is clicked.

data.name: button
data.description: The mouse button used if any.

data.name: cursor_display_location
data.description: The display location of the player's cursor.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player who did the clicking.

events.name: on_gui_closed
events.description:
Called when the player closes the GUI they have open.

This can only be raised when the GUI's player controller is still valid. If a GUI is thus closed due to the player disconnecting, dying, or becoming a spectator in other ways, it won't cause this event to be raised.

It's not advised to open any other GUI during this event because if this is run as a request to open a different GUI the game will force close the new opened GUI without notice to ensure the original requested GUI is opened.

data.name: element
data.description: The custom GUI element that was open

data.name: gui_type
data.description: The GUI type that was open.

data.name: inventory
data.description: The script inventory that was open

data.name: other_player
data.description: The other player that was open

data.name: technology
data.description: The technology that was automatically selected when opening the research GUI

data.name: tile_position
data.description: The tile position that was open

events.name: on_gui_confirmed
events.description: Called when a [LuaGuiElement](runtime:LuaGuiElement) is confirmed, for example by pressing Enter in a textfield.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player who did the confirming.

events.name: on_gui_elem_changed
events.description: Called when [LuaGuiElement](runtime:LuaGuiElement) element value is changed (related to choose element buttons).

data.name: element
data.description: The element whose element value changed.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player who did the change.

events.name: on_gui_hover
events.description:
Called when [LuaGuiElement](runtime:LuaGuiElement) is hovered by the mouse.

Only fired for events whose [LuaGuiElement::raise_hover_events](runtime:LuaGuiElement::raise_hover_events) is `true`.

data.name: element
data.description: The element that is being hovered over.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player whose cursor is hovering.

events.name: on_gui_leave
events.description:
Called when the player's cursor leaves a [LuaGuiElement](runtime:LuaGuiElement) that was previously hovered.

Only fired for events whose [LuaGuiElement::raise_hover_events](runtime:LuaGuiElement::raise_hover_events) is `true`.

data.name: element
data.description: The element that was being hovered.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player whose cursor was hovering.

events.name: on_gui_location_changed
events.description: Called when [LuaGuiElement](runtime:LuaGuiElement) element location is changed (related to frames in `player.gui.screen`).

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player who did the change.

events.name: on_gui_opened
events.description: Called when the player opens a GUI.

data.name: element
data.description: The custom GUI element that was opened

data.name: gui_type
data.description: The GUI type that was opened.

data.name: inventory
data.description: The script inventory that was opened

data.name: other_player
data.description: The other player that was opened

events.name: on_gui_selected_tab_changed
events.description: Called when [LuaGuiElement](runtime:LuaGuiElement) selected tab is changed (related to tabbed-panes).

data.name: element
data.description: The tabbed pane whose selected tab changed.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player who did the change.

events.name: on_gui_selection_state_changed
events.description: Called when [LuaGuiElement](runtime:LuaGuiElement) selection state is changed (related to drop-downs and listboxes).

data.name: element
data.description: The element whose selection state changed.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player who did the change.

events.name: on_gui_switch_state_changed
events.description: Called when [LuaGuiElement](runtime:LuaGuiElement) switch state is changed (related to switches).

data.name: element
data.description: The switch whose switch state changed.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player who did the change.

events.name: on_gui_text_changed
events.description: Called when [LuaGuiElement](runtime:LuaGuiElement) text is changed by the player.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player who did the edit.

data.name: text
data.description: The new text in the element.

events.name: on_gui_value_changed
events.description: Called when [LuaGuiElement](runtime:LuaGuiElement) slider value is changed (related to the slider element).

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player who did the change.

events.name: on_land_mine_armed
events.description: Called when a land mine is armed.

events.name: on_lua_shortcut
events.description: Called when a custom [Lua shortcut](prototype:ShortcutPrototype) is pressed.

data.name: prototype_name
data.description: Shortcut prototype name of the shortcut that was clicked.

events.name: on_marked_for_deconstruction
events.description: Called when an entity is marked for deconstruction with the Deconstruction planner or via script.

events.name: on_marked_for_upgrade
events.description: Called when an entity is marked for upgrade with the Upgrade planner or via script.

events.name: on_market_item_purchased
events.description: Called after a player purchases some offer from a `market` entity.

data.name: offer_index
data.description: The index of the offer purchased.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player who did the purchasing.

events.name: on_mod_item_opened
events.description: Called when the player uses the 'Open item GUI' control on an item defined with the 'mod-openable' flag

events.name: on_multiplayer_init
events.description: Called when [LuaGameScript::is_multiplayer](runtime:LuaGameScript::is_multiplayer) changes to true. May also be raised when it was already true but a game was loaded from a save file and with hosting.

events.name: on_object_destroyed
events.description:
Called after an object is destroyed which was registered with [LuaBootstrap::register_on_object_destroyed](runtime:LuaBootstrap::register_on_object_destroyed) previously.

Depending on when a given object is destroyed, this event will be fired at the end of the current tick or at the end of the next tick. The event's timing is independent of the in-world object being destroyed.

data.name: registration_number
data.description: The number returned by [register_on_object_destroyed](runtime:LuaBootstrap::register_on_object_destroyed) to uniquely identify this object during this event.

data.name: type
data.description: Type of the object that was destroyed. Same as third value returned by [LuaBootstrap::register_on_object_destroyed](runtime:LuaBootstrap::register_on_object_destroyed)

data.name: useful_id
data.description: The [useful identifier](runtime:RegistrationTarget) of the object. Same as second value returned by [LuaBootstrap::register_on_object_destroyed](runtime:LuaBootstrap::register_on_object_destroyed)

events.name: on_permission_group_added
events.description: Called directly after a permission group is added.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player that added the group or `nil` if by a mod.

events.name: on_permission_group_deleted
events.description: Called directly after a permission group is deleted.

data.name: id
data.description: The group id that was deleted.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player doing the deletion or `nil` if by a mod.

events.name: on_permission_group_edited
events.description: Called directly after a permission group is edited in some way.

data.name: action
data.description: The action when the `type` is `"add-permission"` or `"remove-permission"`.

data.name: new_name
data.description: The new group name when the `type` is `"rename"`.

data.name: old_name
data.description: The old group name when the `type` is `"rename"`.

data.name: other_player_index
data.description: The other player when the `type` is `"add-player"` or `"remove-player"`.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player that did the editing or `nil` if by a mod.

events.name: on_permission_string_imported
events.description: Called directly after a permission string is imported.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player that imported the string.

events.name: on_picked_up_item
events.description: Called when a player picks up an item.

events.name: on_player_alt_reverse_selected_area
events.description: Called after a player alt-reverse-selects an area with a selection-tool item.

data.name: item
data.description: The item used to select the area.

events.name: on_player_alt_selected_area
events.description: Called after a player alt-selects an area with a selection-tool item.

data.name: item
data.description: The item used to select the area.

data.name: quality
data.description: The item quality used to select the area.

events.name: on_player_ammo_inventory_changed
events.description: Called after a players ammo inventory changed in some way.

events.name: on_player_armor_inventory_changed
events.description: Called after a players armor inventory changed in some way.

events.name: on_player_banned
events.description: Called when a player is banned.

data.name: by_player
data.description: The player that did the banning if any.

events.name: on_player_built_tile
events.description: Called after a player builds tiles.

data.name: inventory
data.description: The inventory containing the items used to build the tiles.

data.name: item
data.description: The item type used to build the tiles

data.name: quality
data.description: The quality of the item used to build the tiles

data.name: surface_index
data.description: The surface the tile(s) were built on.

data.name: tile
data.description: The tile prototype that was placed.

events.name: on_player_cancelled_crafting
events.description: Called when a player cancels crafting.

data.name: cancel_count
data.description: The number of crafts that have been cancelled.

data.name: items
data.description: The crafting items returned to the player's inventory.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player that did the crafting.

data.name: recipe
data.description: The recipe that has been cancelled.

events.name: on_player_changed_force
events.description: Called after a player changes forces.

events.name: on_player_changed_position
events.description: Called when the tile position a player is located at changes.

events.name: on_player_changed_surface
events.description: Called after a player changes surfaces.

data.name: surface_index
data.description: The surface index the player was on - may be `nil` if the surface no longer exists.

events.name: on_player_cheat_mode_disabled
events.description: Called when cheat mode is disabled on a player.

events.name: on_player_cheat_mode_enabled
events.description: Called when cheat mode is enabled on a player.

events.name: on_player_clicked_gps_tag
events.description: Called when a player clicks a gps tag

data.name: position
data.description: Map position contained in gps tag

data.name: surface
data.description: Surface name contained in gps tag, even when such surface does not exists

events.name: on_player_configured_blueprint
events.description: Called when a player clicks the "confirm" button in the configure Blueprint GUI.

events.name: on_player_controller_changed
events.description: Called after a player changes controller types.

events.name: on_player_crafted_item
events.description: Called when the player finishes crafting an item. This event fires just before the results are inserted into the player's inventory, not when the crafting is queued (see [on_pre_player_crafted_item](runtime:on_pre_player_crafted_item)).

data.name: item_stack
data.description: The item that has been crafted.

data.name: recipe
data.description: The recipe used to craft this item.

events.name: on_player_created
events.description: Called after the player was created.

events.name: on_player_cursor_stack_changed
events.description:
Called after a player's [cursor stack](runtime:LuaControl::cursor_stack) changed in some way.

This is fired in the same tick that the change happens, but not instantly.

events.name: on_player_deconstructed_area
events.description: Called when a player selects an area with a deconstruction planner.

data.name: alt
data.description: If normal selection or alt selection was used.

data.name: item
data.description: The item used to select the area.

data.name: quality
data.description: The item quality used to select the area.

data.name: record
data.description: The record that was used to select the area.

data.name: stack
data.description: The item stack used to select the area.

events.name: on_player_demoted
events.description: Called when a player is demoted.

events.name: on_player_died
events.description: Called after a player dies.

events.name: on_player_display_density_scale_changed
events.description: Called when the display density scale changes for a given player. The display density scale is the scale value automatically applied based on the player's display DPI. This is only relevant on platforms that support high-density displays.

events.name: on_player_display_resolution_changed
events.description: Called when the display resolution changes for a given player.

events.name: on_player_display_scale_changed
events.description: Called when the display scale changes for a given player.

events.name: on_player_driving_changed_state
events.description:
Called when the player's driving state has changed, meaning a player has either entered or left a vehicle.

This event is not raised when the player is ejected from a vehicle due to it being destroyed.

events.name: on_player_dropped_item
events.description: Called when a player drops an item on the ground.

events.name: on_player_fast_transferred
events.description: Called when a player fast-transfers something to or from an entity.

data.name: entity
data.description: The entity transferred from or to.

data.name: from_player
data.description: Whether the transfer was from player to entity. If `false`, the transfer was from entity to player.

data.name: is_split
data.description: Whether the transfer was a split action (half stack).

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player transferred from or to.

events.name: on_player_flipped_entity
events.description:
Called when the player flips an entity. This event is only fired when the entity actually changes its orientation or mirroring, so it won't be triggered when pressing the flip keys on an entity that can't be flipped.

This event reflects a change in the [LuaEntity::mirroring](runtime:LuaEntity::mirroring) property.

data.name: horizontal
data.description: The enacted flip. `true` means a horizontal flip, `false` a vertical one.

events.name: on_player_flushed_fluid
events.description: Called after player flushed fluid

data.name: amount
data.description: Amount of fluid that was removed

data.name: entity
data.description: Entity from which flush was performed

data.name: fluid
data.description: Name of a fluid that was flushed

data.name: only_this_entity
data.description: True if flush was requested only on this entity

events.name: on_player_gun_inventory_changed
events.description: Called after a players gun inventory changed in some way.

events.name: on_player_input_method_changed
events.description: Called when a player's input method changes. See [LuaPlayer::input_method](runtime:LuaPlayer::input_method).

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player whose input method changed.

events.name: on_player_joined_game
events.description: Called after a player joins the game. This is not called when loading a save file in singleplayer, as the player doesn't actually leave the game, and the save is just on pause until they rejoin.

events.name: on_player_kicked
events.description: Called when a player is kicked.

data.name: by_player
data.description: The player that did the kicking if any.

events.name: on_player_left_game
events.description: Called after a player leaves the game. This is not called when closing a save file in singleplayer, as the player doesn't actually leave the game, and the save is just on pause until they rejoin.

events.name: on_player_locale_changed
events.description: Called when a player's active locale changes. See [LuaPlayer::locale](runtime:LuaPlayer::locale).

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player whose locale was changed.

events.name: on_player_main_inventory_changed
events.description: Called after a players main inventory changed in some way.

events.name: on_player_mined_entity
events.description:
Called after the results of an entity being mined are collected just before the entity is destroyed.

After this event any items in the buffer will be transferred into the player as if they came from mining the entity.

The buffer inventory is special in that it's only valid during this event and has a dynamic size expanding as more items are transferred into it.

data.name: buffer
data.description: The temporary inventory that holds the result of mining the entity.

data.name: entity
data.description: The entity that has been mined.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The index of the player doing the mining.

events.name: on_player_mined_item
events.description: Called when the player mines something.

data.name: item_stack
data.description: The item given to the player

events.name: on_player_mined_tile
events.description: Called after a player mines tiles.

data.name: surface_index
data.description: The surface the tile(s) were mined from.

events.name: on_player_muted
events.description: Called when a player is muted.

events.name: on_player_pipette
events.description: Called when a player invokes the "smart pipette" over an entity.

data.name: item
data.description: The item put in the cursor

data.name: quality
data.description: The item quality put in the cursor

data.name: used_cheat_mode
data.description: If cheat mode was used to give a free stack of the item.

events.name: on_player_placed_equipment
events.description: Called after the player puts equipment in an equipment grid

data.name: equipment
data.description: The equipment put in the equipment grid.

data.name: grid
data.description: The equipment grid the equipment was put in.

events.name: on_player_promoted
events.description: Called when a player is promoted.

events.name: on_player_removed
events.description: Called when a player is removed (deleted) from the game. This is markedly different from a player temporarily [leaving](runtime:on_player_left_game) the game, and instead behaves like the player never existed in the save file.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The index of the removed player.

events.name: on_player_removed_equipment
events.description: Called after the player removes equipment from an equipment grid

events.name: on_player_repaired_entity
events.description: Called when a player repairs an entity.

events.name: on_player_respawned
events.description: Called after a player respawns.

data.name: player_port
data.description: The player port used to respawn if one was used.

events.name: on_player_reverse_selected_area
events.description: Called after a player reverse-selects an area with a selection-tool item.

data.name: item
data.description: The item used to select the area.

events.name: on_player_rotated_entity
events.description:
Called when the player rotates an entity. This event is only fired when the entity actually changes its orientation -- pressing the rotate key on an entity that can't be rotated won't fire this event.

Entities being flipped will not fire this event, even if the flip involves rotating. See [on_player_flipped_entity](runtime:on_player_flipped_entity).

Called after the results of an entity being mined are collected just before the entity is destroyed.

The buffer inventory is special in that it's only valid during this event and has a dynamic size expanding as more items are transferred into it.

This event is only raised if a mod does so with [LuaBootstrap::raise_event](runtime:LuaBootstrap::raise_event) or [LuaBootstrap::raise_script_built](runtime:LuaBootstrap::raise_script_built), or when `raise_built` is passed to [LuaSurface::create_entity](runtime:LuaSurface::create_entity).

data.name: entity
data.description: The entity that has been built.

events.name: script_raised_destroy
events.description: A static event mods can use to tell other mods they destroyed something by script. This event is only raised if a mod does so with [LuaBootstrap::raise_event](runtime:LuaBootstrap::raise_event) or [LuaBootstrap::raise_script_destroy](runtime:LuaBootstrap::raise_script_destroy), or when `raise_destroy` is passed to [LuaEntity::destroy](runtime:LuaEntity::destroy).

events.name: script_raised_revive
events.description: A static event mods can use to tell other mods they revived something by script. This event is only raised if a mod does so with [LuaBootstrap::raise_event](runtime:LuaBootstrap::raise_event) or [LuaBootstrap::raise_script_revive](runtime:LuaBootstrap::raise_script_revive), or when `raise_revive` is passed to [LuaEntity::revive](runtime:LuaEntity::revive).

data.name: tags
data.description: The tags associated with this entity, if any.

events.name: script_raised_set_tiles
events.description: A static event mods can use to tell other mods they changed tiles on a surface by script. This event is only raised if a mod does so with [LuaBootstrap::raise_event](runtime:LuaBootstrap::raise_event) or [LuaBootstrap::raise_script_set_tiles](runtime:LuaBootstrap::raise_script_set_tiles), or when `raise_event` is passed to [LuaSurface::set_tiles](runtime:LuaSurface::set_tiles).

data.name: surface_index
data.description: The surface whose tiles were changed.

events.name: script_raised_teleported
events.description: A static event mods can use to tell other mods they teleported something by script. This event is only raised if a mod does so with [LuaBootstrap::raise_event](runtime:LuaBootstrap::raise_event) or [LuaBootstrap::raise_script_teleported](runtime:LuaBootstrap::raise_script_teleported), or when `raise_teleported` is passed to [LuaControl::teleport](runtime:LuaControl::teleport).

data.name: old_position
data.description: The entity's position before the teleportation.

data.name: old_surface_index
data.description: The entity's surface before the teleportation.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The condition to filter on.

parameters.name: invert
parameters.description: Inverts the condition. Default is `false`.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: How to combine this with the previous filter. Defaults to `"or"`. When evaluating the filters, `"and"` has higher precedence than `"or"`.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The prototype type, or a list of acceptable types.

type.variant_parameter_description: Other attributes may be specified depending on `filter`:

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If index is not given, the record is appended.

parameters.name: rail_direction
parameters.description: When `rail` is given, this can be provided to further narrow down direction from which that rail should be approached.

parameters.name: station
parameters.description: One of station or rail must be given.

parameters.name: icon
parameters.description: The SignalID used for a custom alert. Only present for custom alerts.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message for a custom alert. Only present for custom alerts.

parameters.name: tick
parameters.description: The tick this alert was created.

concepts.name: Alignment
concepts.description: A [string](runtime:string) that specifies where a GUI element should be.

parameters.name: clamp_position
parameters.description: When `true`, the gun will be able to shoot even when the target is out of range. Only applies when `target_type` is `position`. The gun will fire at the maximum range in the direction of the target position. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: energy_consumption
parameters.description: Energy consumption of a single shot, if applicable. Defaults to `0`.

concepts.name: Any
concepts.description: Any basic type (string, number, boolean), table, or LuaObject.

concepts.name: AnyBasic
concepts.description: Any basic type (string, number, boolean) or table.

parameters.name: first_constant
parameters.description: Constant to use as the first argument of the operation. Has no effect when `first_signal` is set. Defaults to `0`.

parameters.name: first_signal
parameters.description: First signal to use in an operation. If not specified, the second argument will be the value of `first_constant`.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: When not specified, defaults to `"*"`.

parameters.name: output_signal
parameters.description: Specifies the signal to output.

parameters.name: second_constant
parameters.description: Constant to use as the second argument of the operation. Has no effect when `second_signal` is set. Defaults to `0`.

parameters.name: second_signal
parameters.description: Second signal to use in an operation. If not specified, the second argument will be the value of `second_constant`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the asteroid chunk prototype.

concepts.name: AsteroidChunkID
concepts.description: An asteroid chunk prototype may be specified in one of two ways.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The condition to filter on.

parameters.name: invert
parameters.description: Inverts the condition. Default is `false`.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: How to combine this with the previous filter. Defaults to `"or"`. When evaluating the filters, `"and"` has higher precedence than `"or"`.

type.variant_parameter_description: Other attributes may be specified depending on `filter`:

concepts.name: AsteroidMapSettings
concepts.description: Used by [MapSettings](runtime:MapSettings) and [MapAndDifficultySettings](runtime:MapAndDifficultySettings).

parameters.name: damage_modifier
parameters.description: Multiplier applied to the damage of an attack.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Name of the [LuaFluidPrototype](runtime:LuaFluidPrototype).

parameters.name: ammo_categories
parameters.description: List of the names of compatible [LuaAmmoCategoryPrototypes](runtime:LuaAmmoCategoryPrototype).

parameters.name: ammo_consumption_modifier
parameters.description: Multiplier applied to the ammo consumption of an attack.

parameters.name: cooldown
parameters.description: Minimum amount of ticks between shots. If this is less than `1`, multiple shots can be performed per tick.

parameters.name: damage_modifier
parameters.description: Multiplier applied to the damage of an attack.

parameters.name: fire_penalty
parameters.description: When searching for the nearest enemy to attack, `fire_penalty` is added to the enemy's distance if they are on fire.

parameters.name: health_penalty
parameters.description: When searching for an enemy to attack, a higher `health_penalty` will discourage targeting enemies with high health. A negative penalty will do the opposite.

parameters.name: min_attack_distance
parameters.description: If less than `range`, the entity will choose a random distance between `range` and `min_attack_distance` and attack from that distance. Used for spitters.

parameters.name: min_range
parameters.description: Minimum range of attack. Used with flamethrower turrets to prevent self-immolation.

parameters.name: range
parameters.description: Maximum range of attack.

parameters.name: range_mode
parameters.description: Defines how the range is determined.

parameters.name: rotate_penalty
parameters.description: When searching for an enemy to attack, a higher `rotate_penalty` will discourage targeting enemies that would take longer to turn to face.

parameters.name: turn_range
parameters.description: The arc that the entity can attack in as a fraction of a circle. A value of `1` means the full 360 degrees.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of AttackParameter.

parameters.name: warmup
parameters.description: Number of ticks it takes for the weapon to actually shoot after it has been ordered to do so.

type.variant_parameter_description: Other attributes may be specified depending on `type`:

parameters.name: frequency
parameters.description: For things that are placed as spots such as ores and enemy bases, frequency is generally proportional to number of spots placed per unit area. For continuous features such as forests, frequency is how compressed the probability function is over distance, i.e. the inverse of 'scale'. When the [LuaAutoplaceControlPrototype](runtime:LuaAutoplaceControlPrototype) is of the category `"terrain"`, then scale is shown in the map generator GUI instead of frequency.

parameters.name: richness
parameters.description: Has different effects for different things, but generally affects the 'health' or density of a thing that is placed without affecting where it is placed. For trees, richness affects tree health.  For ores, richness multiplies the amount of ore at any given tile in a patch. Metadata about autoplace controls (such as whether or not 'richness' does anything for them) can be found in the [LuaAutoplaceControlPrototype](runtime:LuaAutoplaceControlPrototype) by looking up `prototypes.autoplace_control[(control prototype name)]`, e.g. `prototypes.autoplace_control["enemy-base"].richness` is false, because enemy base autoplacement doesn't use richness.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: For things that are placed as spots, size is proportional to the area of each spot. For continuous features, size affects how much of the map is covered with the thing, and is called 'coverage' in the GUI.

parameters.name: settings
parameters.description: Always defined when reading autoplace settings.

parameters.name: treat_missing_as_default

Describes a single wire in the blueprint. The members of the tuple are, in order:

examples:
```

```

concepts.name: CargoDestination
concepts.description: The destination of a cargo pod.

parameters.name: hatch
parameters.description: Only used if `type` is [station](runtime:defines.cargo_destination.station). Must be connected to the station and not reserved.

parameters.name: land_at_exact_position
parameters.description: Only used if `type` is [surface](runtime:defines.cargo_destination.surface) and `position` is specified. Determines whether to land at `position` exactly or at a random location nearby. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Only used if `type` is [surface](runtime:defines.cargo_destination.surface). Determines the position on the surface to land near. If not provided, cargo pod will switch destination type from [surface](runtime:defines.cargo_destination.surface) to [station](runtime:defines.cargo_destination.station) before starting descent if there is a station available, and will land at {0, 0} if there is no station available.

parameters.name: space_platform

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Only used if `type` is [surface](runtime:defines.cargo_destination.surface).

parameters.name: transform_launch_products
parameters.description: Only used if `type` is [station](runtime:defines.cargo_destination.station) or [surface](runtime:defines.cargo_destination.surface). If true, items with [rocket_launch_products](prototype:ItemPrototype::rocket_launch_products) defined will be transformed into their products before starting descent. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of destination.

concepts.description: Either `icon`, `text`, or both must be provided.

concepts.name: ChunkPosition
concepts.description: Coordinates of a chunk in a [LuaSurface](runtime:LuaSurface) where each integer `x`/`y` represents a different chunk. This uses the same format as [MapPosition](runtime:MapPosition), meaning it can be specified either with or without explicit keys. A [MapPosition](runtime:MapPosition) can be translated to a ChunkPosition by dividing the `x`/`y` values by 32.

concepts.name: ChunkPositionAndArea
concepts.description: A [ChunkPosition](runtime:ChunkPosition) with an added bounding box for the area of the chunk.

parameters.name: comparator
parameters.description: Specifies how the inputs should be compared. If not specified, defaults to `"<"`.

parameters.name: constant
parameters.description: Constant to compare `first_signal` to. Has no effect when `second_signal` is set. When neither `second_signal` nor `constant` are specified, the effect is as though `constant` were specified with the value `0`.

parameters.name: first_signal
parameters.description: Defaults to blank

parameters.name: second_signal
parameters.description: What to compare `first_signal` to. If not specified, `first_signal` will be compared to `constant`.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: TODOC CircuitConditionDefinition now extends CircuitCondition, all fields of CircuitCondition should be pasted here directly

parameters.name: fulfilled

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the [LuaEntityPrototype](runtime:LuaEntityPrototype).

parameters.name: cliff_elevation_0
parameters.description: Elevation at which the first row of cliffs is placed. The default is `10`, and this cannot be set from the map generation GUI.

parameters.name: cliff_elevation_interval
parameters.description: Elevation difference between successive rows of cliffs. This is inversely proportional to 'frequency' in the map generation GUI. Specifically, when set from the GUI the value is `40 / frequency`.

parameters.name: cliff_smoothing
parameters.description: Smoothing makes cliffs straighter on rough elevation but makes placement inaccurate. 0 is no smoothing, 1 is full smoothing. Values outside of 0-1 are possible for specific effects but not recommended.

parameters.name: control
parameters.description: Name of the autoplace control prototype.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the cliff prototype.

parameters.name: richness
parameters.description: Corresponds to 'continuity' in the GUI. This value is not used directly, but is used by the 'cliffiness' noise expression, which in combination with elevation and the two cliff elevation properties drives cliff placement (cliffs are placed when elevation crosses the elevation contours defined by `cliff_elevation_0` and `cliff_elevation_interval` when 'cliffiness' is greater than `0.5`). The default 'cliffiness' expression interprets this value such that larger values result in longer unbroken walls of cliffs, and smaller values (between `0` and `1`) result in larger gaps in cliff walls.

concepts.name: CollisionLayerID
concepts.description: The name of a [LuaCollisionLayerPrototype](runtime:LuaCollisionLayerPrototype).
examples:
```
"is_lower_object"
```

concepts.name: CollisionMask
examples:
```
-- Most common collision mask of buildings:
collision_mask = {layers = {item = true, meltable = true, object = true, player = true, water_tile = true, is_object = true, is_lower_object = true}}
```

parameters.name: colliding_with_tiles_only
parameters.description: Any prototype with this collision option will only be checked for collision with other prototype's collision masks if they are a tile. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: consider_tile_transitions
parameters.description: Uses the prototypes position rather than its collision box when doing collision checks with tile prototypes. Allows the prototype to overlap colliding tiles up until its center point. This is only respected for character movement and cars driven by players. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: layers
parameters.description: Every key in the dictionary is the name of one [layer](runtime:LuaCollisionLayerPrototype) the object collides with. The value is meaningless and always `true`. An empty table means that no layers are set.

parameters.name: not_colliding_with_itself
parameters.description: Any two entities that both have this option enabled on their prototype and have an identical collision mask layers list will not collide. Other collision mask options are not included in the identical layer list check. This does mean that two different prototypes with the same collision mask layers and this option enabled will not collide. Defaults to `false`.

concepts.name: Color
concepts.description:
Red, green, blue and alpha values, all in range [0, 1] or all in range [0, 255] if any value is > 1. All values here are optional. Color channels default to `0`, the alpha channel defaults to `1`.

Similar to [MapPosition](runtime:MapPosition), Color allows the short-hand notation of passing an array of exactly 3 or 4 numbers. The game usually expects colors to be in pre-multiplied form (color channels are pre-multiplied by alpha).
examples:
```
red1 = {r = 0.5, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0.5}  -- Half-opacity red
red2 = {r = 0.5, a = 0.5}                -- Same color as red1
black = {}                               -- All channels omitted: black
red1_short = {0.5, 0, 0, 0.5}            -- Same color as red1 in short-hand notation
```

concepts.name: ColorModifier
concepts.description: Same as [Color](runtime:Color), but red, green, blue and alpha values can be any floating point number, without any special handling of the range [1, 255].

concepts.name: EnemyEvolutionMapSettings
concepts.description: These values represent a percentual increase in evolution. This means a value of `0.1` would increase evolution by 10%.

parameters.name: destroy_factor
parameters.description: The amount evolution progresses for every destroyed spawner. Defaults to `0.002`.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether enemy evolution is enabled at all.

parameters.name: pollution_factor

parameters.name: time_factor
parameters.description: The amount evolution naturally progresses by every second. Defaults to `0.000004`.

concepts.name: EnemyExpansionMapSettings
concepts.description:
Candidate chunks are given scores to determine which one of them should be expanded into. This score takes into account various settings noted below. The iteration is over a square region centered around the chunk for which the calculation is done, and includes the central chunk as well. Distances are calculated as [Manhattan distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taxicab_geometry).

The pseudocode algorithm to determine a chunk's score is as follows:

```
player = 0
for neighbour in all chunks within enemy_building_influence_radius from chunk:
  player += number of player buildings on neighbour
    * building_coefficient
    * neighbouring_chunk_coefficient^distance(chunk, neighbour)
base = 0
for neighbour in all chunk within friendly_base_influence_radius from chunk:
  base += num of enemy bases on neighbour
    * other_base_coefficient
    * neighbouring_base_chunk_coefficient^distance(chunk, neighbour)
score(chunk) = 1 / (1 + player + base)
```

parameters.name: building_coefficient
parameters.description: Defaults to `0.1`.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether enemy expansion is enabled at all.

parameters.name: enemy_building_influence_radius
parameters.description: Defaults to `2`.

parameters.name: friendly_base_influence_radius
parameters.description: Defaults to `2`.

parameters.name: max_colliding_tiles_coefficient
parameters.description: A chunk has to have at most this high of a percentage of unbuildable tiles for it to be considered a candidate to avoid chunks full of water as candidates. Defaults to `0.9`, or 90%.

parameters.name: max_expansion_cooldown
parameters.description: The maximum time between expansions in ticks. The actual cooldown is adjusted to the current evolution levels. Defaults to `60*3 600=216 000` ticks.

parameters.name: max_expansion_distance
parameters.description: Distance in chunks from the furthest base around to prevent expansions from reaching too far into the player's territory. Defaults to `7`.

parameters.name: min_expansion_cooldown
parameters.description: The minimum time between expansions in ticks. The actual cooldown is adjusted to the current evolution levels. Defaults to `4*3 600=14 400` ticks.

parameters.name: neighbouring_base_chunk_coefficient
parameters.description: Defaults to `0.4`.

parameters.name: neighbouring_chunk_coefficient
parameters.description: Defaults to `0.5`.

parameters.name: other_base_coefficient
parameters.description: Defaults to `2.0`.

parameters.name: settler_group_max_size
parameters.description: The maximum size of a biter group that goes to build a new base. This is multiplied by the evolution factor. Defaults to `20`.

parameters.name: settler_group_min_size
parameters.description: The minimum size of a biter group that goes to build a new base. This is multiplied by the evolution factor. Defaults to `5`.

concepts.name: LocalisedString
concepts.description:
Localised strings are a way to support translation of in-game text. It is an array where the first element is the key and the remaining elements are parameters that will be substituted for placeholders in the template designated by the key.

The key identifies the string template. For example, `"gui-alert-tooltip.attack"` (for the template `"__1__ objects are being damaged"`; see the file `data/core/locale/en.cfg`).

The template can contain placeholders such as `__1__` or `__2__`. These will be replaced by the respective parameter in the LocalisedString. The parameters themselves can be other localised strings, which will be processed recursively in the same fashion. Localised strings can not be recursed deeper than 20 levels and can not have more than 20 parameters.

There are two special flags for the localised string, indicated by the key being a particular string. First, if the key is the empty string (`""`), then all parameters will be concatenated (after processing, if any are localised strings themselves). Second, if the key is a question mark (`"?"`), then the first valid parameter will be used. A parameter can be invalid if its name doesn't match any string template. If no parameters are valid, the last one is returned. This is useful to implement a fallback for missing locale templates.

Furthermore, when an API function expects a localised string, it will also accept a regular string (i.e. not a table) which will not be translated, as well as a number, boolean or `nil`, which will be converted to their textual representation.
examples:
```
-- In the English translation, this will print "No ammo"; in the Czech translation, it will print "Bez munice":
game.player.print({"description.no-ammo"})
-- The 'description.no-ammo' template contains no placeholders, so no further parameters are necessary.
```

```
-- In the English translation, this will print "Durability: 5/9"; in the Japanese one, it will print "耐久度: 5/9":
game.player.print({"description.durability", 5, 9})
```

```
-- This will print "hello" in all translations:
game.player.print({"", "hello"})
```

```
-- This will print "Iron plate: 60" in the English translation and "Eisenplatte: 60" in the German translation.
game.print({"", {"item-name.iron-plate"}, ": ", 60})
```

```
-- As an example of a localised string with fallback, consider this:
{"?", {"", {"entity-description.furnace"}, "\n"}, {"item-description.furnace"}, "optional fallback"}
-- If 'entity-description.furnace' exists, it is concatenated with "\n" and returned. Otherwise, if 'item-description.furnace'
--  exists, it is returned as-is. Otherwise, "optional fallback" is returned. If this value wasn't specified, the
--  translation result would be "Unknown key: 'item-description.furnace'".
```

concepts.name: MapAndDifficultySettings
concepts.description: A standard table containing all [MapSettings](runtime:MapSettings) attributes plus an additional table that contains all [DifficultySettings](runtime:DifficultySettings) properties.

parameters.name: max_failed_behavior_count
parameters.description: If a behavior fails this many times, the enemy (or enemy group) is destroyed. This solves biters getting stuck within their own base.

parameters.name: spoil_time_modifier
parameters.description: A value in range [0.01, 100].

parameters.name: technology_price_multiplier
parameters.description: A value in range [0.001, 1000].

concepts.name: MapExchangeStringData
concepts.description: The data that can be extracted from a map exchange string, as a plain table.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: Whether this is the preset that is selected by default.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The string used to alphabetically sort the presets. It is a simple string that has no additional semantic meaning.

concepts.name: MapGenSettings
examples:
```
-- Assuming a NamedNoiseExpression with the name "my-alternate-grass1-probability" is defined...
local surface = game.player.surface
local mgs = surface.map_gen_settings
mgs.property_expression_names["tile:grass1:probability"] = "my-alternate-grass1-probability"
surface.map_gen_settings = mgs
-- ...would override the probability of grass1 being placed at any given point on the current surface.
```

```
-- To make there be no deep water on (newly generated chunks) a surface
local surface = game.player.surface
local mgs = surface.map_gen_settings
mgs.property_expression_names["tile:deepwater:probability"] = -1000
surface.map_gen_settings = mgs
-- This does not require a NamedNoiseExpression to be defined, since literal numbers (and strings naming literal
-- numbers, e.g. `"123"`) are understood to stand for constant value expressions.
```

parameters.name: autoplace_controls
parameters.description: Indexed by autoplace control prototype name.

parameters.name: autoplace_settings
parameters.description: Each setting in this dictionary maps the string type to the settings for that type.

parameters.name: cliff_settings
parameters.description: Map generation settings for entities of the type "cliff".

parameters.name: default_enable_all_autoplace_controls
parameters.description: Whether undefined `autoplace_controls` should fall back to the default controls or not. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Height in tiles. If `0`, the map has 'infinite' height, with the actual limitation being one million tiles in each direction from the center.

parameters.name: no_enemies_mode
parameters.description: Whether enemy creatures will not naturally spawn from spawners, map gen, or trigger effects.

parameters.name: peaceful_mode
parameters.description: Whether enemy creatures will not attack unless the player first attacks them.

parameters.name: property_expression_names
parameters.description: Overrides for tile property value generators.

parameters.name: seed
parameters.description: The random seed used to generated this map.

parameters.name: starting_area
parameters.description: Size of the starting area.

parameters.name: starting_points
parameters.description: Positions of the starting areas.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Width in tiles. If `0`, the map has 'infinite' width, with the actual limitation being one million tiles in each direction from the center.

concepts.name: MapGenSize
concepts.description:
A floating point number specifying an amount.

For backwards compatibility, MapGenSizes can also be specified as a string, which will be converted to a number (when queried, a number will always be returned).

The map generation algorithm officially supports the range of values the in-game map generation screen shows (specifically `0` and values from `1/6` to `6`). Values outside this range are not guaranteed to work as expected.

concepts.name: MapPosition
concepts.description:
Coordinates on a surface, for example of an entity. MapPositions may be specified either as a dictionary with `x`, `y` as keys, or simply as an array with two elements.

The coordinates are saved as a fixed-size 32 bit integer, with 8 bits reserved for decimal precision, meaning the smallest value step is `1/2^8 = 0.00390625` tiles.

concepts.name: MapSettings
concepts.description: Various game-related settings. Updating any of the attributes will immediately take effect in the game engine.
examples:
```
-- Increase the number of short paths the pathfinder can cache.
game.map_settings.path_finder.short_cache_size = 15
```

attributes.name: max_failed_behavior_count
attributes.description: If a behavior fails this many times, the enemy (or enemy group) is destroyed. This solves biters getting stuck within their own base.

concepts.name: MapTick
concepts.description: `math.huge` represents the maximum possible tick.

concepts.name: MapViewSettings
concepts.description: What is shown in the map view. If a field is not given, that setting will not be changed.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Count of the item. Cannot be 0.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Prototype name of the required item.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: Normal quality will be used if not specified.

concepts.name: MathExpression
concepts.description:
A string that represents a math expression. The expression parser recognizes four basic token types (with their regex):

- Whitespace: `[ \n\r\t]*`

- Number: `(0x[0-9a-f]+|([0-9]+\.?[0-9]*|\.[0-9]+)(e-?[0-9]+)?)` (e.g. `3.2`, `100`, `.6`, `4.2e-5`, `0x2a5f`). Supports hexadecimal input and scientific notation for decimal numbers.

- Operator: `+`, `-`, `*`, `/`, `^`, and `()` for brackets, which may be nested.

- Identifier: The functions listed below and any variables listed where the expression is used.

Identifiers are used to name functions and variables, which result in or represent numbers. The following functions are always available:

- `abs(value)`: Returns absolute value of the given argument; i.e. if the argument is negative, it is inverted.

- `log2(value)`: Returns a binary logarithm of the given value.

- `sign(value)`: Returns `-1` for negative numbers, `0` for zero (regardless of sign), `1` for positive numbers

- `max(value1, value2, ...)`: Returns the greater of the given values. Supports between 2 and 255 arguments.

- `min(value1, value2, ...)`: Returns the smaller of the given values. Supports between 2 and 255 arguments.

The property where the expression is used may provide variables. For example in [TechnologyUnit::count_formula](prototype:TechnologyUnit::count_formula) `L` and `l` may be used for the technology level.

The formula is executed following the [BODMAS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Order_of_operations#Conventional_order) order (also known as PEMDAS).

parameters.name: fluid_amount
parameters.description: The required fluid amount if any.

parameters.name: minable
parameters.description: Is this entity mineable at all?

parameters.name: mining_particle
parameters.description: Prototype name of the particle produced when mining this entity. Will only be present if this entity produces any particle during mining.

parameters.name: mining_time
parameters.description: Energy required to mine an entity.

parameters.name: mining_trigger
parameters.description: The mining trigger if any.

parameters.name: products
parameters.description: Products obtained by mining this entity.

parameters.name: required_fluid
parameters.description: The prototype name of the required fluid if any.

parameters.name: new_version
parameters.description: New version of the mod. May be `nil` if the mod is no longer present (i.e. it was just removed).

parameters.name: old_version
parameters.description: Old version of the mod. May be `nil` if the mod wasn't previously present (i.e. it was just added).

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value of the mod setting. The type depends on the kind of setting.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The condition to filter on.

parameters.name: invert
parameters.description: Inverts the condition. Default is `false`.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: How to combine this with the previous filter. Defaults to `"or"`. When evaluating the filters, `"and"` has higher precedence than `"or"`.

parameters.name: mod
parameters.description: The mod name

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The setting scope type.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The prototype type, or a list of acceptable types.

type.variant_parameter_description: Other attributes may be specified depending on `filter`:

concepts.name: ModifierType
concepts.description: Used by [TechnologyModifier](runtime:TechnologyModifier).

concepts.name: ModuleEffectValue
concepts.description:
The percentual increase of the attribute. A value of `0.6` means a 60% increase.

Quality values are divided by 10 internally, allowing for one more decimal of precision.

concepts.name: ModuleEffects
examples:
```
-- These are the effects of the vanilla Speed Module 3
{speed = 0.5, consumption = 0.7, quality = -0.25}
```

concepts.name: MouseButtonFlags
concepts.description:
A set of flags. Active flags are in the dictionary as `true`, while inactive flags aren't present at all.

To write to this, use an array[[string](runtime:string)] of the mouse buttons that should be possible to use with on button. The flag `"left-and-right"` can also be set, which will set `"left"` and `"right"` to `true`.

concepts.name: NoiseExpression
concepts.description: A fragment of a functional program used to generate coherent noise, probably for purposes related to terrain generation. These can only be meaningfully written/modified during the data load phase. More detailed information is found on the [prototype docs](prototype:NamedNoiseExpression).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Names the type of the expression and determines what other fields are required.

parameters.name: nth_tick
parameters.description: The nth tick this handler was registered to.

parameters.name: tick
parameters.description: The tick during which the event happened.

concepts.name: Offer
concepts.description: A single offer on a market entity.

parameters.name: offer
parameters.description: The action that will take place when a player accepts the offer. Usually a `"give-item"` modifier.

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: List of prices.

concepts.name: ParticleID
concepts.description: A particle prototype may be specified in one of two ways.

parameters.name: cache_accept_path_end_distance_ratio
parameters.description: When looking for a path from cache, make sure it doesn't end too far from the requested end in relative terms. This is typically more lenient than the start ratio since the end target could be moving. Defaults to `0.15`.

parameters.name: cache_accept_path_start_distance_ratio
parameters.description: When looking for a path from cache, make sure it doesn't start too far from the requested start in relative terms. Defaults to `0.2`.

parameters.name: cache_max_connect_to_cache_steps_multiplier
parameters.description: When looking for a connection to a cached path, search at most for this number of steps times the original estimate. Defaults to `100`.

parameters.name: cache_path_end_distance_rating_multiplier
parameters.description: When assigning a rating to the best path, this multiplier times end distances is considered. This value is typically higher than the start multiplier as this results in better end path quality. Defaults to `20`.

parameters.name: cache_path_start_distance_rating_multiplier
parameters.description: When assigning a rating to the best path, this multiplier times start distances is considered. Defaults to `10`.

parameters.name: direct_distance_to_consider_short_request
parameters.description: The maximum direct distance in tiles before a request is no longer considered short. Defaults to `100`.

parameters.name: enemy_with_different_destination_collision_penalty
parameters.description: A penalty that is applied for another unit that is too close and either not moving or has a different goal. Defaults to `30`.

parameters.name: extended_collision_penalty
parameters.description: The collision penalty for collisions in the extended bounding box but outside the entity's actual bounding box. Defaults to `3`.

parameters.name: fwd2bwd_ratio
parameters.description: The pathfinder performs a step of the backward search every `fwd2bwd_ratio`'th step. The minimum allowed value is `2`, which means symmetric search. The default value is `5`.

parameters.name: general_entity_collision_penalty
parameters.description: The general collision penalty with other units. Defaults to `10`.

parameters.name: general_entity_subsequent_collision_penalty
parameters.description: The collision penalty for positions that require the destruction of an entity to get to. Defaults to `3`.

parameters.name: goal_pressure_ratio
parameters.description: When looking at which node to check next, their heuristic value is multiplied by this ratio. The higher it is, the more the search is directed straight at the goal. Defaults to `2`.

parameters.name: ignore_moving_enemy_collision_distance
parameters.description: The distance in tiles after which other moving units are not considered for pathfinding. Defaults to `5`.

parameters.name: long_cache_min_cacheable_distance
parameters.description: The minimal distance to the goal in tiles required to be searched in the long path cache. Defaults to `30`.

parameters.name: long_cache_size
parameters.description: Number of elements in the long cache. Defaults to `25`.

parameters.name: max_clients_to_accept_any_new_request
parameters.description: The amount of path finder requests accepted per tick regardless of the requested path's length. Defaults to `10`.

parameters.name: max_clients_to_accept_short_new_request
parameters.description: When the `max_clients_to_accept_any_new_request` amount is exhausted, only path finder requests with a short estimate will be accepted until this amount (per tick) is reached. Defaults to `100`.

parameters.name: max_steps_worked_per_tick
parameters.description: The maximum number of nodes that are expanded per tick. Defaults to `1 000`.

parameters.name: max_work_done_per_tick
parameters.description: The maximum amount of work each pathfinding job is allowed to do per tick. Defaults to `8 000`.

parameters.name: min_steps_to_check_path_find_termination
parameters.description: The minimum amount of steps that are guaranteed to be performed for every request. Defaults to `2000`.

parameters.name: negative_cache_accept_path_end_distance_ratio
parameters.description: Same principle as `cache_accept_path_end_distance_ratio`, but used for negative cache queries. Defaults to `0.3`.

parameters.name: negative_cache_accept_path_start_distance_ratio
parameters.description: Same principle as `cache_accept_path_start_distance_ratio`, but used for negative cache queries. Defaults to `0.3`.

parameters.name: negative_path_cache_delay_interval
parameters.description: The delay in ticks between decrementing the score of all paths in the negative cache by one. Defaults to `20`.

parameters.name: overload_levels
parameters.description: The thresholds of waiting clients after each of which the per-tick work limit will be increased by the corresponding value in `overload_multipliers`. This is to avoid clients having to wait too long. Must have the same number of elements as `overload_multipliers`. Defaults to `{0, 100, 500}`.

parameters.name: overload_multipliers
parameters.description: The multipliers to the amount of per-tick work applied after the corresponding thresholds in `overload_levels` have been reached. Must have the same number of elements as `overload_multipliers`. Defaults to `{2, 3, 4}`.

parameters.name: short_cache_min_algo_steps_to_cache
parameters.description: The minimal number of nodes required to be searched in the short path cache. Defaults to `50`.

parameters.name: short_cache_min_cacheable_distance
parameters.description: The minimal distance to the goal in tiles required to be searched in the short path cache. Defaults to `10`.

parameters.name: short_cache_size
parameters.description: Number of elements in the short cache. Defaults to `5`.

parameters.name: short_request_max_steps
parameters.description: The maximum amount of nodes a short request will traverse before being rescheduled as a long request. Defaults to `1000`.

parameters.name: short_request_ratio
parameters.description: The amount of steps that are allocated to short requests each tick, as a percentage of all available steps. Defaults to `0.5`, or 50%.

parameters.name: stale_enemy_with_same_destination_collision_penalty
parameters.description: A penalty that is applied for another unit that is on the way to the goal. This is mainly relevant for situations where a group of units has arrived at the target they are supposed to attack, making units further back circle around to reach the target. Defaults to `30`.

parameters.name: start_to_goal_cost_multiplier_to_terminate_path_find
parameters.description: If the actual amount of steps is higher than the initial estimate by this factor, pathfinding is terminated. Defaults to `2000.0`.

parameters.name: use_path_cache
parameters.description: Whether to cache paths at all. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: allow_destroy_friendly_entities
parameters.description: Allows pathing through friendly entities. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: allow_paths_through_own_entities
parameters.description: Allows the pathfinder to path through entities of the same force. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: Enables path caching. This can be more efficient, but might fail to respond to changes in the environment. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: low_priority
parameters.description: Sets lower priority on the path request, meaning it might take longer to find a path at the expense of speeding up others. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: no_break
parameters.description: Makes the pathfinder not break in the middle of processing this pathfind, no matter how much work is needed. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: prefer_straight_paths
parameters.description: Makes the pathfinder try to path in straight lines. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: needs_destroy_to_reach
parameters.description: `true` if the path from the previous waypoint to this one goes through an entity that must be destroyed.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position of the waypoint on its surface.

concepts.name: Product
concepts.description: Returns one of the subtypes, depending on the value of `type`.
examples:
```
-- Products of the "steel-chest" recipe (an array of Product)
{{type="item", name="steel-chest", amount=1}}
```

```
-- Products of the "advanced-oil-processing" recipe
{{type="fluid", name="heavy-oil", amount=1},
  {type="fluid", name="light-oil", amount=4.5},
  {type="fluid", name="petroleum-gas", amount=5.5}}
```

```

-- minimum amount of 1 and a maximum amount of 5
{{type="item", name="custom-item", probability=0.5, amount_min=1, amount_max=5}}
```

concepts.name: PropertyExpressionNames
concepts.description: All other MapGenSettings feed into named noise expressions, and therefore placement can be overridden by including the name of a property in this dictionary. The probability and richness functions for placing specific tiles, entities, and decoratives can be overridden by including an entry named `{tile|entity|decorative}:(prototype name):{probability|richness}`.
lists:
Values either name a NamedNoiseExpression or can be literal numbers, stored as strings (e.g. `5`). All other controls can be overridden by a property expression names. Notable properties:

- `moisture` - a value between 0 and 1 that determines whether a tile becomes sandy (low moisture) or grassy (high moisture).
- `aux` - a value between 0 and 1 that determines whether low-moisture tiles become sand or red desert.
- `temperature` - provides a value (vaguely representing degrees Celsius, varying between -20 and 50) that is used (together with moisture and aux) as part of tree and decorative placement.
- `elevation` - tiles values less than zero become water. Cliffs are placed along certain contours according to [CliffPlacementSettings](runtime:CliffPlacementSettings).
- `cliffiness` - determines whether (when >0.5) or not (when <0.5) a cliff will be placed at an otherwise suitable (according to [CliffPlacementSettings](runtime:CliffPlacementSettings)) location.
- `enemy-base-intensity` - a number that is referenced by both `enemy-base-frequency` and `enemy-base-radius`. i.e. if this is overridden, enemy base frequency and size will both be affected and do something reasonable. By default, this expression returns a value proportional to distance from any starting point, clamped at about 7.
- `enemy-base-frequency` - a number representing average number of enemy bases per tile for a region, by default in terms of `enemy-base-intensity`.
- `enemy-base-radius` - a number representing the radius of an enemy base, if one were to be placed on the given tile, by default proportional to a constant plus `enemy-base-intensity`.

Climate controls ('Moisture' and 'Terrain type' at the bottom of the Terrain tab in the map generator GUI) don't have their own dedicated structures in MapGenSettings. Instead, their values are stored as property expression overrides with long names:

- `control:moisture:frequency` - frequency (inverse of scale) multiplier for moisture noise.  Default is 1.
- `control:moisture:bias` - global bias for moisture (which normally varies between 0 and 1). Default is 0.
- `control:aux:frequency` - frequency (inverse of scale) multiplier for aux (called 'terrain type' in the GUI) noise.  Default is 1.
- `control:aux:bias` - global bias for aux/terrain type (which normally varies between 0 and 1). Default is 0.

concepts.name: RealOrientation
concepts.description:
The smooth orientation. It is a [float](runtime:float) in the range `[0, 1)` that covers a full circle, starting at the top and going clockwise. This means a value of `0` indicates "north", a value of `0.5` indicates "south".

For example then, a value of `0.625` would indicate "south-west", and a value of `0.875` would indicate "north-west".

concepts.name: SoundPath
concepts.description:
It can be either the name of a [SoundPrototype](prototype:SoundPrototype) defined in the data stage, or a path in the form `"type/name"`. The latter option can be sorted into three categories.

The validity of a SoundPath can be verified at runtime using [LuaHelpers::is_valid_sound_path](runtime:LuaHelpers::is_valid_sound_path).
lists:
The utility and ambient types each contain general use sound prototypes defined by the game itself.

- `"utility"` - Uses [UtilitySounds](prototype:UtilitySounds). Example: `"utility/wire_connect_pole"`
- `"ambient"` - Uses [AmbientSound](prototype:AmbientSound). Example: `"ambient/resource-deficiency"`

concepts.name: SpritePath
concepts.description:
It can be either the name of a [SpritePrototype](prototype:SpritePrototype) defined in the data stage, or a path in form "type/name" or "type.name".

The validity of a SpritePath can be verified at runtime using [LuaHelpers::is_valid_sprite_path](runtime:LuaHelpers::is_valid_sprite_path).
lists:
The supported types are:

- `"item"` - for example "item/iron-plate" is the icon sprite of iron plate
- `"entity"` - for example "entity/small-biter" is the icon sprite of the small biter
- `"technology"`
- `"recipe"`
- `"fluid"`
- `"tile"`
- `"item-group"`
- `"virtual-signal"`
- `"shortcut"`
- `"achievement"`
- `"equipment"`
- `"ammo-category"`
- `"decorative"`
- `"space-connection"`
- `"space-location"`
- `"surface"`
- `"airborne-pollutant"`
- `"asteroid-chunk"`
- `"quality"`
- `"file"` - path to an image file located inside the current scenario. This file is not preloaded so it will be slower; for frequently used sprites, it is better to define sprite prototype and use it instead.
- `"utility"` - sprite defined in the utility-sprites object, these are the pictures used by the game internally for the UI.

parameters.description: Amount of steps pathfinder performed. This is a measure of how expensive this search was.

parameters.name: total_length
