type.variant_parameter_description: Other attributes may be specified depending on `type`:

parameters.name: max_gathering_unit_groups
parameters.description: The maximum number of automatically created unit groups gathering for attack at any time. Defaults to `30`.

parameters.name: max_group_gathering_time
parameters.description: The maximum amount of time in ticks a group will spend gathering before setting off. The actual time is a random time between the minimum and maximum times. Defaults to `10*3 600=36 000` ticks.

parameters.name: max_group_member_fallback_factor
parameters.description: When a member of a group falls back more than this factor times the group radius, the group will slow down to its `max_group_slowdown_factor` speed to let them catch up. Defaults to `3`.

parameters.name: max_group_radius
parameters.description: The maximum group radius in tiles. The actual radius is adjusted based on the number of members. Defaults to `30.0`.

parameters.name: max_group_slowdown_factor
parameters.description: The minimum speed as a percentage of its maximum speed that a group will slow down to so members that fell behind can catch up. Defaults to `0.3`, or 30%.

parameters.name: max_member_slowdown_when_ahead
parameters.description: The minimum speed a percentage of its regular speed that a group member can slow down to when ahead of the group. Defaults to `0.6`, or 60%.

parameters.name: max_member_speedup_when_behind
parameters.description: The maximum speed a percentage of its regular speed that a group member can speed up to when catching up with the group. Defaults to `1.4`, or 140%.

parameters.name: max_unit_group_size
parameters.description: The maximum number of members for an attack unit group. This only affects automatically created unit groups, manual groups created through the API are unaffected. Defaults to `200`.

parameters.name: max_wait_time_for_late_members
parameters.description: After gathering has finished, the group is allowed to wait this long in ticks for delayed members. New members are not accepted anymore however. Defaults to `2*3 600=7 200` ticks.

parameters.name: member_disown_distance
parameters.description: When a member of a group falls back more than this factor times the group radius, it will be dropped from the group. Defaults to `10`.

parameters.name: min_group_gathering_time
parameters.description: The minimum amount of time in ticks a group will spend gathering before setting off. The actual time is a random time between the minimum and maximum times. Defaults to `3 600` ticks.

parameters.name: min_group_radius
parameters.description: The minimum group radius in tiles. The actual radius is adjusted based on the number of members. Defaults to `5.0`.

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: Prototype name of the unit that would be spawned.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the item, or entity.

parameters.name: quality

parameters.description: `"item"`, or `"entity"`.

parameters.name: comparator
parameters.description: The quality comparison type.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the item, or entity.

parameters.name: quality

concepts.name: Vector
concepts.description: A vector is a two-element array or dictionary containing the `x` and `y` components. The game will always provide the array format. Positive x goes east, positive y goes south.

concepts.name: Vector3D
concepts.description:
Reading this always returns the table with the named keys.

If this is specified as a three-element array then the array items are x, y and z, in that order.

concepts.name: VerticalTextAlign
concepts.description:
The text is aligned so that the target position is at the given side of the text.

For example, `"top"` aligned text means the top of the text is at the target position. Or in other words, the target is at the top of the text.

concepts.name: VirtualSignalID
concepts.description: A virtual signal prototype may be specified in one of two ways.

parameters.name: compare_type
parameters.description: Specifies how this condition is to be compared with the preceding conditions in the corresponding `wait_conditions` array. Always present when reading, defaults to `"and"` when writing.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: This is a CircuitCondition and only present when `type` is `"item_count"`, `"circuit"`, `"fluid_count"`, `"fuel_item_count_all"`, or `"fuel_item_count_any"`, and a circuit condition is configured. This is a ItemIDAndQualityIDPair and only present when `type` is `"request_satisfied"` or `"request_not_satisfied"`

parameters.name: damage
parameters.description: Amount of damage to take when `type` is `"damage_taken"`.

parameters.name: planet

parameters.name: station
parameters.description: Name of the station. Only present when `type` is "`specific_destination_full`", "`specific_destination_not_full`", "`at_station`", or "`not_at_station`", and a station is configured.

parameters.name: ticks
parameters.description: Number of ticks to wait when `type` is `"time"`, or number of ticks of inactivity when `type` is `"inactivity"`.

parameters.description: The item to place if relevant.

parameters.name: target_count

parameters.name: target_item
parameters.description: The target item of the pickup or deliver order.

parameters.name: type

concepts.name: boolean
concepts.description: Either `true` or `false`.

concepts.name: double
concepts.description: A double-precision floating-point number. This is the same data type as all Lua numbers use.

concepts.name: float
concepts.description: A floating-point number. This is a single-precision floating point number. Whilst Lua only uses double-precision numbers, when a function takes a float, the game engine will immediately convert the double-precision number to single-precision.

concepts.name: int
concepts.description:
32-bit signed integer. Possible values are `-2 147 483 648` to `2 147 483 647`.

Since Lua 5.2 only uses doubles, any API that asks for `int` will floor the given double.

concepts.name: int8
concepts.description:
8-bit signed integer. Possible values are `-128` to `127`.

Since Lua 5.2 only uses doubles, any API that asks for `int8` will floor the given double.

concepts.name: nil
concepts.description: Nil is the type of the value `nil`, whose main property is to be different from any other value. It usually represents the absence of a useful value.

concepts.name: number
concepts.description: Any kind of integer or floating point number.

concepts.name: string
concepts.description: Strings are enclosed in double-quotes, like this `"hi"`.

concepts.name: table
concepts.description:
Tables are enclosed in curly brackets, like this `{}`.

Throughout the API docs, the terms "array" and "dictionary" are used. These are fundamentally just [Lua tables](http://www.lua.org/pil/2.5.html), but have a limitation on which kind of table keys can be used. An array is a table that uses continuous integer keys starting at `1`, while a dictionary can use numeric or string keys in any order or combination.

concepts.name: uint
concepts.description:
32-bit unsigned integer. Possible values are `0` to `4 294 967 295`.

Since Lua 5.2 only uses doubles, any API that asks for `uint` will floor the given double.

concepts.name: uint16
concepts.description:
16-bit unsigned integer. Possible values are `0` to `65 535`.

Since Lua 5.2 only uses doubles, any API that asks for `uint16` will floor the given double.

concepts.name: uint64
concepts.description:
64-bit unsigned integer. Possible values are `0` to `18 446 744 073 709 551 615`.

Since Lua 5.2 only uses doubles, any API that asks for `uint64` will floor the given double.

concepts.name: uint8
concepts.description:
8-bit unsigned integer. Possible values are `0` to `255`.

Since Lua 5.2 only uses doubles, any API that asks for `uint8` will floor the given double.

values.name: invalid
values.description: The default destination type of a cargo pod when created runtime. Setting its destination to any other type will instantly launch it.

values.name: orbit
values.description: Cargo pods with orbit destination are destroyed when ascent is completed.

values.name: space_platform
values.description: Only used for sending a space platform starter pack to a platform that is waiting for one. Regular deliveries to space platform hubs use [station](runtime:defines.cargo_destination.station) destination type instead.

values.name: station
values.description: Any cargo landing pad or space platform hub.

values.name: surface
values.description: Cargo pods will switch destination type from surface to station before starting descent if there is a station available and [CargoDestination::position](runtime:CargoDestination::position) has not been specified. Note, setting the destination to "surface" when the surface is the same as the one the pod is on forces it to find and set a landing position.

defines.name: command

values.description: Fail on first failure. Only succeeds if all commands (executed one after another) succeed.

values.name: logical_or

values.name: return_last

values.name: character

values.name: editor

values.name: ghost

values.name: god
values.description: The controller isn't tied to a character. This is the default controller in sandbox.

values.name: remote

values.name: spectator
values.description: Can't change anything in the world but can view anything.

values.name: by_anything

values.name: by_enemy
values.description: Attack closer enemy entities with force.

values.name: none
values.description: Perform command even if someone attacks the unit.

values.name: broken

values.name: disabled
values.description: Used by constant combinators: Combinator is turned off via switch in GUI.

values.name: full_output

values.name: not_plugged_in_electric_network

values.name: pipeline_overextended
values.description: Used by pipes, pipes to ground and storage tanks.

values.name: waiting_for_more_items

values.name: waiting_for_target_to_be_built

defines.name: prototypes
defines.description: This define describes all top-level prototypes and their associated subtypes. It is organized as a lookup table, meaning the values of all the defines is `0`. As an example, `defines.prototypes['entity']` looks like `{furnace=0, inserter=0, container=0, ...}`.

values.name: deliver_items
values.description: Deliver specific items to an entity (item request proxy).

values.name: pickup_items
values.description: Pickup items from an entity (item request proxy).

defines.name: rocket_silo_status
defines.description: The various parts of the launch sequence of the rocket silo.

values.name: arms_advance
values.description: The next state is `rocket_ready` or if the rocket is destroyed in this state then the next state will be `lights_blinking_close`. The rocket is getting prepared for launch.

values.name: arms_retract
values.description: The next state is `rocket_flying` or if the rocket is destroyed in this state then the next state will be `lights_blinking_close`. The rocket is getting launched.

values.name: building_rocket
values.description: The rocket silo is crafting rocket parts. When there are enough rocket parts, the silo will switch into the `create_rocket` state.

values.name: create_rocket
values.description: The next state is `lights_blinking_open`. The rocket silo rocket entity gets created.

values.name: doors_opened
values.description: The next state is `rocket_rising` or if the rocket is destroyed in this state then the next state will be `lights_blinking_close`. The rocket is getting prepared for launch.

values.name: doors_opening
values.description: The next state is `doors_opened`. The rocket is getting prepared for launch.

values.name: engine_starting
values.description: The next state is `arms_retract` or if the rocket is destroyed in this state then the next state will be `lights_blinking_close`. The rocket is getting launched.

values.name: launch_started
values.description: The next state is `engine_starting` or if the rocket is destroyed in this state then the next state will be `lights_blinking_close`. The rocket is getting launched.

values.name: lights_blinking_open
values.description: The next state is `doors_opening`. The rocket is getting prepared for launch.

values.name: rocket_flying
values.description: The next state is `lights_blinking_close`. The rocket is getting launched.

values.name: rocket_ready
values.description: The rocket launch can be started by the player. When the launch is started, the silo switches into the `launch_starting` state.

values.name: rocket_rising
values.description: The next state is `arms_advance` or if the rocket is destroyed in this state then the next state will be `lights_blinking_close`. The rocket is getting prepared for launch.

global_functions.name: localised_print
global_functions.description: `localised_print()` allows printing [LocalisedString](runtime:LocalisedString) to stdout without polluting the Factorio [log file](https://wiki.factorio.com/Log_file). This is primarily useful when communicating with external tools that launch Factorio as a child process.

global_functions.name: log
global_functions.description: `log()` can print [LocalisedStrings](runtime:LocalisedString) to the Factorio [log file](https://wiki.factorio.com/Log_file). This, in combination with the serpent library, makes debugging in the data stage easier because it allows the inspection of entire prototype tables. For example, printing all properties of the sulfur item prototype can be done like so: `log(serpent.block(data.raw["item"]["sulfur"]))`

global_functions.name: table_size
global_functions.description:
Factorio provides the `table_size()` function as a simple way to determine the size of tables with non-continuous keys, as the standard `#` operator does not work correctly for these. The function is a C++ implementation of the following Lua code, which is faster than doing the same in Lua:

```
local function size(t)
  local count = 0
  for k,v in pairs(t) do
    count = count + 1
  end
  return count
end
```

Note that `table_size()` does not work correctly for [LuaCustomTable](runtime:LuaCustomTable), their size has to be determined with [LuaCustomTable::length_operator](runtime:LuaCustomTable::length_operator) instead.
